About the job
At U.S. Bank, we’re on a journey to do our best. Helping the customers and businesses we serve to make better and smarter financial decisions and enabling the communities we support to grow and succeed. We believe it takes all of us to bring our shared ambition to life, and each person is unique in their potential. A career with U.S. Bank gives you a wide, ever-growing range of opportunities to discover what makes you thrive at every stage of your career. Try new things, learn new skills and discover what you excel at—all from Day One.

Job Description

The Corporate Audit Services Audit Project Manager is primarily responsible for supervising staff in the completion of audit engagements with minimal supervision from managers, however there are no direct reports. The Audit Project Manager is expected to monitor progress of audit engagements against plan and schedule, assess work performed by the audit engagement team, and provide coaching and on-the-job training for team members to ensure engagements are completed in conformance with internal audit policies and procedures

Primary Responsibilities:

 Supervising audit staff in the completion of audit engagements, ensuring the highest quality work delivered timely. Supervision includes:
 Assessing work performed by staff by providing coaching notes that are relevant to the scope, accuracy and completeness of work performed
 Performing sufficient reviews to ensure work contains relevant facts to support audit scope and conclusions and adhere to internal audit policies and procedures
 Reviewing issues to ensure potential exposures and significance are included, root causes are identified, and operationally effective and cost-effective actions to address those causes are developed into appropriate recommendations
 Completing or assisting managers in planning audit engagements. Includes identifying and analyzing business processes, key risks and critical controls; interviewing auditees; determining audit scope; evaluating control design adequacy; and developing audit programs which provide sufficient guidance for testing control performance effectiveness and making evaluations which effectively achieve audit objectives
 Maintaining requisite knowledge of laws and regulations applicable to U.S. Bancorp products, services, and processes. Includes monitoring financial service industry trends, changes in relevant laws and regulations, and evaluating the impact(s) to auditable entities and the audit plan.
 Assisting the managers in reporting and wrap-up phases of audits. Includes appropriate disposition of issues and drafting audit reports which include issues
 Monitoring progress of audit engagements against plan and schedule. Includes making necessary adjustments and promptly completing work paper reviews on a timely basis to ensure all issues are identified and dispositioned prior to report draft issuance
 Providing on-the-job training for staff. Includes business knowledge of products, services, and delivery systems; company policies and procedures; applicable laws and regulations; and formal/informal control frameworks
 Collaborating across the three lines of defense regarding business processes, risks, and controls. Coordinating audit activities by integrating other internal audit subject matter teams (Information Technology, Anti-Money Laundering, Compliance, Risk Management, Treasury, etc.) to ensure appropriate and efficient coverage of the business products, services, and processes. Managing the team’s workload to assist other audit teams when resources are needed for areas of higher risk.
 Performing other duties as requested by management

This role is hybrid. Team members who are in a hybrid role typically spend three days a week at a U.S. Bank location, while having flexibility on their work location for the other working days.

Basic Qualifications

 Bachelor's degree, or equivalent work experience
 Typically, more than six years of applicable experience

Preferred Skills/Experience

 Thorough understanding and/or ability to analyze and evaluate applicable laws and regulations to execute audits to assess the adequacy of first and second lines of defense compliance risk management practices.
 Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
 Strong critical thinking and analytical skills.
 Proven leadership skills.
 Proven adaptability to changing priorities.
 Ability to manage multiple tasks and deadlines simultaneously.
 Ability to build and continuously improve working relationships with internal audit peers, business line leaders, and partners (risk and compliance)
 Relevant Wealth Management and Financial Service Industry knowledge (e.g., Broker Dealer, Trust Services, Wealth Management, SEC Regulations, FINRA Regulations, 12CFR9 Regulation, Investments, Wealth Operations, Private Banking, Credit, Models, Regulatory Compliance, etc.)
 CFIRS, CIA, CPA, FINRA licenses or other relevant professional designation or advanced degree

About the job


About Us

Treasury Wine Estates (TWE) is one of the world’s leading wine companies.  We know that it’s the thinkers, makers, and doers who have the most impact as we continue to strive towards being recognized as the world’s most admired premium wine company.

Treasury Americas is focused on portfolio premiumization and brand-led marketing.  With our world-class production facilities and wineries located in the iconic Napa, Sonoma, and Central Coast wine regions of California, we are proud of our portfolio of brands that have tremendous heritage, rich quality, and a reputation for excellence across the globe.  From the iconic luxury of Penfolds, Stags’ Leap, Beaulieu Vineyards, and Beringer, to the broad appeal of Sterling Vineyards, Etude, Matua and newer brands like Frank Family Vineyards and 19 Crimes, we are committed to creating memorable wine experiences for our consumers.

Summary:

Reporting to the Regulatory Compliance Manager, the Compliance Specialist is responsible for federal and state alcoholic beverage regulatory compliance, including but not limited to licensing, product registrations, state reporting and excise tax payments. 

THIS IS A HYBRID ROLE, REQUIRING WEEKLY ON-SITE WORK IN NAPA, CA.

Key Responsibilities include (Specific duties to be based on experience):

Review new labels and label revisions and provide compliance feedback to business partners.

Submit labels to TTB for COLA consideration.

Submit formulas to TTB for approval.

Maintain COLA submissions and approvals on the public drive.

Oversee direct to consumer compliance in the ShipCompliant system, monitoring for accurate data inputs and outputs. Ensure all excise tax filings are submitted on time by our third party.

Work with the Tax Team to maintain online account logins with each jurisdiction and authority.

File any reports or amendments which our third party cannot file.

Receive and resolve notices from excise tax authorities and state alcohol beverage authorities.

Manage the special application process requirements for wine treatments and variances from federal and state regulations. Submit COLA Use-Up Requests and COLA Waiver Requests. Assist with import clearances from US Customs.

Analyze and approve marketing promotional material and advertising, consumer coupon and sweepstakes and contests, and traditional marketing (i.e. print, television and radio). Support the business with legal clearance and state approvals.

Apply for and maintain NABCA codes for all domestic and imported products, which are required for some markets and used for statistical information gathering.

Maintain distributor database of current distributors and brand assignments.

Conduct annual reporting for the business entities with required states.

Conduct company officer reporting with federal and state entities.

File and renew Fictitious Business Name (FBN) statements with county and TTB.

File and renew FDA registrations for our wine bottling sites globally.

Support the business with general import and export queries.

Collaborate with TBS on standardizing export documents across the global business.

Support the business with Certificate of Insurance requests.

About you

 You have a BA degree or comparable job experience

You have administrative experience in a compliance setting; Certified Notary Public (or ability to obtain) preferred

You have a understanding of federal and state alcoholic beverage regulations, or the ability to get up to speed quickly

You have the ability to exercise discretion and independent judgment with respect to legal compliance matters

You have strong ability to manage deadlines

You have excellent organizational skills and ability to multi-task

You are detail oriented

You can communicate clearly and concisely in both written and oral form

You maintain a positive work environment, contribute to group morale and reflect TWE growth behaviours

You are proficient in use of Microsoft Office and SharePoint

What’s in it for you

The opportunity to be bold and make an impact in the world of wine
 Access to the world's most celebrated wines through our employee product allowance
 Opportunity to build a career across multiple functions
 Structured development programs to support your health, wellbeing and career
 "TWEforME Day" - an additional day of leave each year, for you to do you
 

Culture

As part of Treasury Wine Estates we bring our whole selves, we're courageous and we deliver together - that's our DNA. We're a passionate bunch who enjoy working together, like to have fun and keep things down-to-earth. We're brave enough and care enough to have the right conversations to get the best outcome and are famous for our can-do attitude. We're definitely "glass half full" people and see challenges as opportunities and move with pace to achieve our goals.

Inclusion, Equity and Diversity

Just like the wide range and variety of brands in our wine portfolio, TWE embraces diversity and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer.  All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin or on the basis of disability.

We do move quickly at TWE and continually review applications, so if you don't want to miss out, apply today!

Pay Transparency Disclosure: The base pay range offered for this position is $65,000 to $78,000 annually. These figures represent what we reasonably expect to pay for this position, but the actual compensation offered will depend upon numerous job-related factors, including but not limited to candidate qualifications, skills, experience, education, location, and alignment with market data. Our expectation is that the incumbent will work out of the Napa CA area. If the incumbent works out of another location, the wage rate may fall above or below this range. Treasury reserves the right to modify the range in the future.

Technical Proficiency

We never stop identifying problems. We understand there is always a solution, and sometimes the solution is difficult. 


Change Agility
 We demonstrate change agility (the ability to identify and seize opportunities in the environment faster than competitors), an essential key to success at Creative Planning. We understand where the business is going and advise on risk mitigation strategies.

About the job
Product Material Compliance & Sustainability Specialist Location: Lansdale, PA About SKF: SKF has been making the world spin since 1907 SKF is an industry-leading manufacturer dedicated to a culture of belonging, where our people flourish in an equitable environment that promotes leadership development and career growth. As an SKF team member, you’ll join 40,000 colleagues from more than 130 countries developing bearing technology and services that make rotation more reliable and sustainable. Sustainability is at the heart of everything we do. SKF aims to have net zero greenhouse gas emissions at all our production facilities by 2030. SKF products keep vehicles rolling, power the machines that put food on your table, and even reach into the cosmos as part of the Mars rover mission. Founded in Sweden in 1907, today SKF is publicly traded on the Nasdaq Stockholm with annual sales in 2020 of approximately $10 billion. Summary: The Product Material Compliance and Sustainability Specialist will oversee product material compliance for SKF operations in the Americas Region. The PMC Specialist will coordinate across the different functions in the full value chain of the region: Sales, Customer Service, Supplier, Factory, Demand Chain / Purchasing, Solutions Factory, within and outside the Americas. The goal of this position is to manage all aspects of product material compliance including maintaining the PMC ENVCOMP database by working with the responsible SKF functions as well as managing request from proof compliance and regulation from external stakeholders. The work environment is fast paced, and you must be capable of managing projects within the full value chain and have a passion for quality, compliance, and sustainability. While the initial focus of the position will be centered on PMC the role with transition to sustainability. This new responsibility will be to work with SKF’s sales product and service delivery teams to growth the business but articulating the sustainability value proposition. SKF products and service offer a unique contribution to our customer’s environmental footprint through reduced friction, increased uptime and overall longer life for their products and assets. Helping SKF’s sales teams articulate this value proposition by outlining the potential sustainability impact within the client needs analysis will help the customer see this value and ultimately growth SKF market share. Responsibilities Include but Not Limited to: Supports the mapping of local legislation. Attend and maintain knowledge of material related regulations (REACH & RoHS). Maintain compliance oversight of product change management. Complete the product compliance investigation for all manufacturing sites in SKF Americas Region, including bearings, seals, greases, air dryers other kinds of components, and finished products. Update and maintain SKF’s product compliance database. Sort out legal requirements and market/customer requirements. Prioritization classification based on risks and market strategy. Organize the regional product compliance management process. Define to manage the requirements in the Full Value Chain. Oversee the resolutions of identified product compliance issues. Analyzing regulatory changes and formulating solutions to new regulatory developments. Confirm the product compliance status, reply to the customer requirements. Manage requests from industrial customers through different software and 3 party platforms such as BOMCheck, CDX, & IMDS. Translate group material compliant policies, demands, and set up a communication platform with the relevant internal organizations. Conduct product compliance training for relevant internal organizations such as sales, purchasing, and factory management. Assist with projects that help SKF and customers understand and achieve relevant sustainability goals with regards to products and services. Work with product development engineering and service engineers to articulate the impact our product and services have on sustainability. Work with the sales and service delivery teams to incorporate the sustainability value proposition into the client needs analysis. Conduct internal and external training on the environment impact of SKF products and services. Objectives: Implement strategy and objectives for SKF product material compliance in the Americas Region. Investigate, control, and improve the product material compliance process for products made in the Americas Region. Improve the effectiveness and efficiency of the retrieval and reporting of product compliance data through digitalization and automation. Utilize compliance and sustainability data for SKF products and services to develop value propositions that grow the business. Key Performance Indicators (KPIs): Percentage products with compliance data to applicable regulations.

of customer compliance request filled. Lead time for answering customer compliance request. Percent of unanswered compliance requests.

of Citations and $ fines from non-compliance.

of client needs analysis completed with sustainability value proposition articulated. $ sales growth from products via sustainability impact. $ sales growth from services via sustainability impact. Requirements: Bachelor’s degree in Chemistry, Industrial Engineering, Environmental Science or similar field. Experience with US and global substance restriction regulations (REACH, RoHS, TSCA, California Proposition 65). Project management skills with the ability to coordinate and lead cross-functional project team activities effectively and efficiently. Self-motivation, strong drive, and action-oriented with high sense of personal accountability. Experience in working in the full value chain including manufacturing (factory, warehouses) and transactional environments (sales, purchasing, engineering). Strong analytical and problem-solving skills and courage to apply own thinking and recommendation to analysis. Strong interpersonal relationship and stakeholder management skills. Willingness to travel as required. What You’ll Love About SKF: Rest and Relaxation. Enjoy a generous PTO policy and 13 paid holidays. Work/Life Integration. SKF supports work /life integration, home, family, community, personal well-being and health. Flexible work options available, depending on role. SKF Celebrates Diversity in the Workplace.? We strive to embed Diversity, Equity and Inclusion in everything we do. By developing a culture of belonging, our people can flourish; leading to an inclusive, equitable environment that promotes leadership, engagement and innovation. Best in Class Benefits . SKF cares about the wellbeing of our employees. Comprehensive healthcare options to fit your needs and opt out payment. Added benefits include company paid life insurance, STD, LTD. Supplemental benefits include critical illness coverage, tuition reimbursement, employee discount programs, and much more Invest in your Future. Participate in our 401K program that boasts a 10% employer contribution: 100% match up to 5% of your elected contribution (100% Vested) plus an additional 5% company contribution. About the job
Position: Enterprise Governance, Risk, and Compliance (EGRC) Analyst
Location: Houston, Texas, USA
Status: Full-time, Permanent


We are a full-service provider of analytical geochemistry services to the global mining industry. An integrated network of 70 laboratories around the world ensures consistent quality and dependable client service. Design, installation & operation of dedicated remote mine site labs. Prep facilities, analytical laboratories, core services & photography, hyperspectral mapping & interpretation.
Leader in process development, circuit optimization, mineralogical analysis, bankable metallurgical testing, and consulting services for mineral process flowsheet development and optimization. ALS offers mineral processing testing by both bench scale and pilot scale facilities, hydrometallurgical and mineralogical test services, and project management by expert metallurgists.

About the Position:
The Enterprise Governance, Risk, and Compliance (EGRC) Analyst will be responsible for ensuring that our organization is compliant with all relevant regulations and policies, managing risk, and developing and implementing effective governance strategies. This role involves a high level of collaboration with cross-functional teams, including IT, legal, finance, and operations.


The Enterprise Governance, Risk, and Compliance (EGRC) Analyst has the following duties:
Develop, implement, and maintain enterprise-wide policies and procedures related to governance, risk management, and compliance.
Collaborate with internal stakeholders to ensure that policies and procedures are aligned with business objectives and operational requirements.
Provide guidance to cross-functional teams on compliance and risk management issues.
Conduct risk assessments, identify potential risks, and develop mitigation plans to minimize risk exposure.
Monitor compliance with laws, regulations, and industry standards and provide reports to senior management.
Provide change management oversight to ensure that changes to policies and procedures are implemented effectively and efficiently.
Conduct audits of internal controls, policies, and procedures to ensure compliance and identify areas for improvement.
Develop and deliver training programs to ensure that employees are aware of policies, procedures, and best practices related to governance, risk management, and compliance.
Continuously monitor and assess the effectiveness of policies, procedures, and controls, and make recommendations for improvement as needed.
Stay up-to-date with regulatory changes, emerging risks, and best practices related to governance, risk management, and compliance.


Qualifications

Degree in Management of Information Systems, Cybersecurity, Risk Management, or Business Administrator
3-5 years of experience in governance, risk management, and compliance in a large organization.
Strong knowledge of regulations and standards related to governance, risk management, and compliance, such as Sarbanes-Oxley, GDPR, ISO 27001/2, etc.
Excellent communication, collaboration, and interpersonal skills.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Ability to work independently and with a team.
Strong project management skills.
Ability to adapt to changing regulatory environments and business needs.


ALS is proud to be an equal-opportunity employer and is committed to fostering an inclusive work environment where the different strengths and perspectives of each employee are both recognized and valued. We therefore encourage applications from all individuals; particularly women, First Nations, people with disabilities, and visible minorities. 

ALS also welcomes applications from people with all levels of ability. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

The Compliance Specialist will ensure strict compliance with United States’ laws and regulations relating to Global Trade Compliance, including ITAR, EAR, OFAC, and Customs/Traffic. 
This position is expected to understand operational compliance in global trade, monitor federal regulations, have interpersonal skills to interact with senior management, employees in training, and clients or customers.

Act as an Empowered official for trade compliance on international business transactions, exercising due diligence to mitigate potential risk.

Prepares annual reports, maintains documentation and recordkeeping in compliance with licenses and ITAR.
Engages with DOS, DTSA, BIS, Customs officers and freight forwarders on license provisos, policy changes and logistics.
Acts as a company resource for ITAR regulations and compliance.

Coordinates with other departments as necessary regarding regulatory affairs inquiries and requests.

About the job
Job Title: BSA/Compliance Specialist Department: Main Office
Reports to: BSA/AML/OFAC Officer FLSA Status: Non-exempt
Prepared by: Human Resources Prepared Date: January 30, 2023
Approved by: Emily Frohriep Approved Date: January 30, 2023


Summary: Under general supervision, but acting according to established policies, procedures, and strategic plan, performs a variety of BSA/AML duties. This position exists to assist the BSA/AML Officer in ensuring that Sturgis Bank & Trust Company is in compliance with the laws, rules and regulations associated with, including but not limited to, the Bank Secrecy Act, the US PATRIOT Act, and OFAC requirements. It serves a vital risk management function that protects the company from compliance, operational, legal and reputational risks.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
 BSA/AML/OFAC Duties
·        Process the Currency Transaction Reports (CTRs) including transmission to FinCEN
·        Review and identify unusual or suspicious activity as presented in CTR Reports and file Suspicious Activity Investigative Reports (SAIR) if necessary.
·        Communicate with branch offices, as needed, in connection with investigation and customer related issues.
·        Participate in all internal/external BSA/AML audits and examinations while ensuring no violations of law or repeat findings from previous audits or examinations occur.
·        Assist the BSA/AML Officer in the annual review of the BSA/AML compliance program including the annual Risk Assessment review, related forms, training material, etc.
·        Perform Enhanced Due Diligence (EDD) reviews of all high-risk customers.
·        Assist with the Risk assessment process and risk rating methodology of customers.
·        Manage the list of accounts & entities identified as High Risk
·        Ensure compliance with Customer Identification Policy procedures.
·        Maintain the Exempt Persons files in coordination with branches annual review.
·        Demonstrate the ability to provide leadership, motivating and persuading others to address compliance risk without having actual authority over them.
·        Analyze customer profiles and define appropriate action.
·        Perform other related duties as assigned.
·        Employee is required to report suspicious customer or employee activity to the BSA Officer as soon as they become aware of the suspicious activity. Failure to report suspicious activity is grounds for termination.
·        Communicate with internal/external customers through a variety of means- telephone, e-mail, fax or regular mail correspondence, or in person.

Supervisory Responsibilities
This job currently has no supervisory responsibilities.

Qualifications
To perform this job successfully, an individual must be knowledgeable and/or able to learn company products, services, and related information to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. Individual must have basic knowledge of BSA/AML regulations. Individual must possess good analytical skills with the ability to interpret information, research problems and suggest appropriate solutions. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Education and/or Experience
Associates degree preferred; 2+ years banking experience; or equivalent combination of education and experience.

Language Skills
They must possess the knowledge and ability to communicate effectively with internal/external customers. They must have the ability to express oneself clearly and effectively in both oral and written form. They must have the ability to understand and work from oral and written instructions.


Reasoning Ability
BSA/AML Support Analyst must have the ability to remain calm and professional during peak periods of activity and manage multiple tasks simultaneously. This job requires him/her to prioritize/organize work and applies common sense, as well as proofread and edits documents for accuracy. They must have the ability to think strategically and a desire to influence change.

Computer Skills
To perform this job successfully, an individual should have knowledge and be efficient in the use of office equipment such as; telephone, computer, calculator, fax, typewriter, and reference materials, as well as various software packages (i.e., Microsoft Word, Excel, Internet, Outlook)

Certificates, Licenses, Registrations
Currently not applicable

Other Skills and Abilities
 He/she must have the ability to manage and maintain confidential information. Individual must be able to an effective team member; communicate and cooperate with other Banking Center Offices and bank personnel. They must be able to work without supervision, complete related tasks correctly in a timely and satisfactory manner and make sound decisions without direct supervision.

Other Qualifications
Employee must have the ability to assist in other job-related areas as required and the ability to work daily and overtime as needed and approved.

About the job
Chief Compliance Officer / Senior Compliance Leader

Regal Securities, Inc. is seeking a Chief Compliance Officer (CCO) for its headquarters in Glenview, Illinois. We are searching for a motivated CCO to lead the Compliance Department of a FINRA registered broker-dealer, and its affiliated SEC registered investment advisory firm.

If you are a CCO or SR COMPLIANCE LEADER looking to move to the next level, our well-established Chicago area investment brokerage and Registered Investment Advisory firm might be just the place for you. We are searching for a motivated individual to lead the Compliance Department of a FINRA registered broker-dealer firm. Excellent growth / advancement opportunity.

Essential Responsibilities:

Direct and manage a staff of experienced compliance professionals and work closely under the guidance of the Firm's general counsel.
Conduct and oversee surveillance for brokerage (including both online deep-discount trading and full service), and fee-based business activities.
Monitor and alert management to current regulatory issues, risks, and deadlines.
Evaluate and implement latest technology solutions for compliance related surveillance.
Communicate proactively with supervisors, registered representatives and investment advisory representatives.
Manage regulatory exams, inquiries, responses, and investigations with federal and state regulators.
Ensure compliance with annual calendar for regulatory deadlines, filings, audits, internal reviews, etc.
Manage the Firm's FINRA Gateway filings (i.e. Form BD, U4s, U5s, state registrations, FOCUS reporting, etc.).
Collaborate and review Written Supervisory Procedures and other guidance provided to registered representatives and personnel.
Organize and coordinate branch audit inspections of registered representatives.
Oversee and administer the Firm's Anti-Money Laundering (AML) Program.
Improve the efficiency of the Firm's supervisory system of branch and home offices.
Conduct risk oversee assessments and internal reviews for the Firm's activities, and test the effectiveness of policies and procedures.

Requirements:

Minimum of 8 years professional compliance experience, with extensive knowledge of FINRA and SEC regulations
Series 7, 24, 65/66 required
Bachelor's Degree
Extensive experience dealing with SEC, FINRA, and state securities regulators.
Certified Anti-Money Laundering Specialist designation is preferred
Detail orientated, accurate, organized, able to set priorities
Excellent interpersonal skills, sound judgement and ability to work effectively with staff at all levels
Solid written and verbal communication skills
Ability to multi-task and adapt to quick-shifting priorities
Team player with strong coaching, feedback and listening skills

Candidate must have a broad range of knowledge of regulatory landscape for broker-dealers, registered investment advisors, and have a wide range of experience with investment products in the financial services industry. The Firm offers a fast-paced, challenging environment, and you will have the chance to play a large role in its exciting growth initiatives for its representatives and advisors throughout the country. If you are interested in this opportunity, please send a cover letter and resume.

Job Description

The FMR LLC Legal Department is seeking to hire a senior attorney to join the Workplace Investing legal team to provide legal support for all aspects of Fidelity’s defined contribution plan recordkeeping, individual retirement account and small business retirement plan businesses, primarily focusing on tax and ERISA issues but also including federal securities law, privacy law and various other laws as they relate to workplace and individual retirement plans and accounts. You will support the creation, enhancement and maintenance of retirement products and services and further enterprise-wide goals and initiatives in collaboration with multiple groups across Fidelity, including product, operations, relationship management, client experience, risk, compliance, finance, sales, marketing, and technology.

The Expertise And Skills You Bring

JD and 8 - 10 years of relevant law firm, industry or regulatory experience.
In-depth working knowledge of employee benefits law, focusing on Internal Revenue Code (“IRC”) qualified retirement plan provisions, ERISA, and applicable regulations. Experience with securities laws, privacy law and other laws as they relate to employee benefit plans is helpful.
Experience with IRC 403(b), 457, and 409A plans and IRAs is beneficial.
Experience with multiple employer plans, pooled employer plans and other similar groups of plans is also beneficial.
Crisp and clear oral and written communication skills, in particular the ability to reduce complex legal issues to straightforward, practical analysis and advice. Strong work ethic, excellent judgment, and keen attention to detail.
Strong writing and research skills.
Strong analytical, investigatory, and problem-solving skills.
Admitted to practice, or willing to secure bar admission, in the relevant jurisdiction(s).

The Value You Deliver

Effectively collaborate on projects and initiatives, building relationships with partners in Fidelity’s compliance, risk, and business organizations, while exhibiting behavior consistent with Fidelity’s culture and values.
Develop strategies for addressing complex factual situations with an understanding of the broader business context and of relative risks to the firm.
Provide strategic legal advice and analysis to working teams and business partners.
Work independently under pressure in a fast-paced and dynamic environment with a “can-do” attitude.
Analyze legislative and regulatory changes related to employee benefit plans and retirement accounts and advise on implementation strategies.
Provide subject matter expertise for plan and governing documents, client contract drafting, interpretation, and negotiation.

How Your Work Impacts The Organization

The Legal Department supports the businesses of Fidelity by:

Structuring creative, timely and practical solutions to business and legal issues in a customer-obsessed way.
Anticipating and influencing changes and trends in the law and business environment. 
Maintaining the highest ethical standards.
Providing advice that enables Fidelity to continually achieve its goals, comply with the law and maintain its reputation.

About the job
Mission Produce is a global leader in the worldwide avocado business, with additional offerings in mangos. Since 1983, we have invested in people, state-of-the-art technology, and avocado-specific and ripening infrastructure to expertly serve our customers, growers, and partners in over 25 countries. We own and operate four packing facilities in multiple global locations including California, Mexico, and Peru. Our global distribution network includes strategically placed forward distribution centers in North America, China, and Europe, which promote company expansion into new territories and categories. Throughout our history, we have remained rooted in honesty, respect, and loyalty to provide a year-round supply of high-quality fruit from field to fork.
 
JOB SUMMARY
The role is responsible for providing guidance and support to the organization on contracts and related policies and processes, including negotiation, drafting, contract review, and advising on contractual agreements. This role will build relationships across the organization to strategically prepare, refine, and implement external agreements, as well as company processes and policies. This role reports directly to the General Counsel.


ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
Draft, review, and negotiate a wide variety of vendor and customer agreements that support and enable business operations including, but not limited to, commercial contracts, master services agreements, confidentiality agreements, technology licensing, leases, construction and real-estate, R&D, and professional services agreements.
Provide front-line support to business organization on customer contracts and process, including advising on RFPs, contract review, negotiation approach and process.
Engage with internal stakeholders during the contracting process to ensure that company agreements adequately address risk management concerns, information security and privacy issues, accounting considerations, and other pertinent issues.
Assist the legal team’s efforts in the preparation, implementation and refinement of standard form agreements, and company processes and policies.
Provide legal support for business transactions, including acquisitions, investments and partnerships.
Provide substantive and administrative support for the legal team, including training, contract management, and more.
Perform additional duties as assigned such as marketing compliance reviews and/or IP portfolio management.
 
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS & REQUIREMENTS
JD from an accredited law school, with exceptional academic credentials.
Minimum 7 years of legal experience in related matters.
Must be a member in good standing of a state bar or be eligible to become licensed as in-house counsel.
In-house experience is strongly preferred.
Demonstrated experience drafting and negotiating complex commercial agreements.
Must demonstrate an ability to grasp business and operational strategies to provide sound legal counsel in diverse matters affecting the business.
Requires excellent language and writing skills and ability to drive projects and earn the confidence and cooperation of business partners. Must have strong project management, interpersonal, and persuasion skills.
Enjoyable to work with. Positive attitude, no ego. Resourceful. Willingness to roll up sleeves (no job too big, no job too small).
Detail oriented and organized. Highly self-directed and proactive, with the ability to manage a high-volume practice in a dynamic, fast paced, metrics-driven environment and adapt quickly to changing priorities.
Ability to uphold and demonstrate the highest level of integrity in all situations.

Summary

Job Description

The Compliance Officer is responsible for ensuring that the Bank and its subsidiaries remain in strict compliance with current and proposed rules and regulations and providing technical advice and expertise to operating management.

Primary Responsibilities

 Reviews current and proposed regulations in order to maintain a current and in-depth knowledge and understanding of the regulatory environment and its impact upon the financial industry and on Bank operations. 
 Advises operating management on regulatory changes and assists in implementing the required changes to existing Bank policies and procedures. Renders professional opinions and clarifications on current and proposed regulations when requested by Bank management. 
 Reports to the Bank’s Board of Directors the overall effectiveness of the bank’s compliance program on a regular basis, including monthly reporting of exceptions. Conducts monthly audit meetings with the compliance team and reporting the outcome to the Board. 
 Assists general counsel on matters involving litigation which may affect the company's compliance with laws and regulations. 
 Performs periodic audits of departments, branches and subsidiaries, including loan and deposit files; assists in audits conducted by the Internal Audit Department to ensure regulatory compliance. 
 Trains bank personnel on compliance requirements and how to comply with these requirements. This would include helping loan officers and assisting with clearing their exceptions. This would include daily post and pre-reviews of loan files. It would also include writing up exceptions on Real Estate and Commercial loans and clearing exceptions daily. 
 Maintaining the HMDA LAR logs. 
 Prepares and submits reports required by the state; i.e., unclaimed personal property, home mortgage disclosure, etc. 
 Issues reports to Bank operating management, rendering compliance opinions, as well as periodic reports to the Examining Committee of the Board of Managers on results of reports issued. 
 Performs daily supervisory review, monitoring compliance to the Bank Secrecy Act. 
 Responsible for the ongoing maintenance of the corporate library. 
 Maintains advanced knowledge and awareness of financial industry status and trends. 
 Follows policies and procedures, completes administrative tasks correctly and on time, supports the Bank’s goals and values, and benefits the bank through outside activities. 
 The position of Compliance Officer performs duties specific to the position and other functions as assigned. 

ENVIRONMENT AND PHYSICAL ACTIVITY

The incumbent in the course of performing this position spends time writing, typing, speaking, listening, lifting (up to 30 pounds), carrying, seeing (such as close, color and peripheral vision, depth perception and adjusted focus), sitting, pulling, walking, standing, squatting, kneeling and reaching.

The incumbent for this position may operate any or all of the following: telephone, cellular telephone, beeper, copy and fax machines, adding machine (calculator), check protector, microfilm equipment, encoder, money counter, credit card terminal, typewriter, computer terminal, personal computer and related printers.

The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job.

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job.

Minimum Requirements

These specifications are general guidelines based on the minimum experience normally considered essential to the satisfactory performance of this position. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill and/or ability required to perform the position in a satisfactory manner. Individual abilities may result in some deviation from these guidelines.

 Bachelor’s degree from a four-year college or university in finance/accounting; or three or more years of related experience and/or training; or the equivalent combination of education and experience. Work related experience should consist of an in-depth background in accounting, management and supervisory skills. Educational experience, through in-house training sessions, formal school or financial industry related curriculum, should be applicable to the financial industry. 
 Knowledge of overall bank operation procedures with actual experience in auditing, teller operations, general ledger, investments, and loan operations is preferred. 
 Knowledge of banking regulations is preferred. 
 Work experience in regulatory agency examining and accounting would be given preference. 
 Knowledge in the use of a PC, calculator, and programs including Word and Excel is required. 
 Intermediate math skills; calculate interest, commissions, proportions, and percentages; balance accounts; add, subtract, multiply and divide in all units of measure, using whole numbers, common fractions and decimals; locate routine mathematical errors; compute rate, ratio and percent, including the drafting and interpretation of bar graphs. 
 Excellent oral, written and interpersonal communication skills with the ability to apply common sense to carry out instructions and instruct others, interpret documents, understand procedures, write reports and correspondence, speak clearly to customers, other employees, and the Board of Directors. 
 Ability to deal with complex problems involving multiple facets and variables in non-standardized situations and to work with minimal supervision while performing duties. 
 Effective organizational and time management skills. 
 Ability to work with minimal supervision while performing duties. 
 Current driver’s license and a vehicle with appropriate insurance coverage if required to drive in the course of performing assigned duties and responsibilities.

Attention to detail
Orientation toward customer service
Flexibility and a team player

Compliance Officer

Summary

Regulatory Compliance is responsible for developing and maintain a Compliance Management Program for the Bank that ensures compliance with laws and regulations, addresses associated risks of harm to consumers and customers and integrates consumer compliance into the day-to day responsibilities of management and employees. This position is responsible for assisting the Chief Compliance Officer with implementing various aspects of the Bank's Compliance Management Program. The Compliance Officer is responsible for providing guidance and direction with respect to compliance with laws and regulations with direction from management. This includes ongoing guidance and monitoring as well as the managing of implementation processes. The Compliance Officer works collaboratively with lines of business to understand current processes and to help each line of business adhere to regulatory requirements.

Responsible for administering the Compliance Monitoring Program. 
Develop compliance monitoring schedule and conduct monitoring and testing.
Ensure all monitoring performed complies with policies and procedures and regulatory requirements.
Continually evaluate methods, processes, procedures and risks to identify any significant compliance and control issues, making recommendation to strengthen functions when needed.
Analyze findings, provide recommendations and evaluate management responses for appropriateness.
Prepare compliance monitoring reports that summarize results, findings and recommendations.
Assist with fair lending reviews and self-assessments.
Assist with various other aspects of the Bank's Compliance Program
Assist with the implementation of new rules and regulations or regulatory change. 
Be an active member of the Compliance Committee
Assist with Compliance Exams.

About the job
Position: Senior Internal Auditor
Status: Exempt, Full-Time
Supervisory Responsibilities: None
Location: Evansville, IN
 Job Summary:

United Fidelity Bank is growing and in search of Senior or Director level candidates to join our Internal Audit team!

The Senior Internal Auditor plays an important role in the organization by performing several activities directly related to the company’s Internal Audit function. The candidate is primarily responsible, under limited to moderate supervision, for planning and conducting internal audits in a timely and professional manner while: following established criteria, working with other internal auditors, and engaging with other business units. The incumbent will also be responsible for reviewing findings with management, presenting recommendations, and writing reports summarizing audit findings and corrective actions. This position is fully onsite at our Downtown Evansville location.

Essential Job Functions include, but are not limited to:

Plan and perform moderate to complex internal audit projects with limited supervision.
Perform process walkthroughs to document key controls and changes to processes.
Apply risk and control concepts to assess control design and develop audit procedures.
Conduct audit procedures associated with the field work phase of internal audits and internal audit projects.
Determine compliance with the established system of internal controls.
Determine compliance with the organization’s policies and procedures.
Conduct FDICIA testing of key financial and entity wide controls.
Present audit results, conclusions, and recommendations to the organization’s management.
Perform appropriate follow-up procedures on recommended corrective actions.
Assist the external auditors and regulators, as necessary, with information requests.
Perform all duties in relation to the Bank Secrecy Act under the guidance of the BSA Officer.


To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. In accordance with the Americans with Disabilities Act, Reasonable Accommodations may be made to enable qualified individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.


Skills and Abilities Required to Perform Essential Job Functions:

Must demonstrate strong analytical skills and the ability to use sound judgement.
Advanced organizational and time management skills.
Proficiency in Microsoft Office suite of products.
Outstanding written and verbal communication skills.
Excellent leadership skills with a problem-solving ability.
Ability to perform work accurately and thoroughly.
Ability to use logic and reasoning to solve a problem.
Ability to demonstrate conduct conforming to a set of values and accepted standards.
Provide information related to the Bank Secrecy Act in cooperation with the BSA Officer.

Education, Experience and Qualifications:

‪Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting, Finance, or Business is preferred. Equivalent work experience will be considered in lieu of a degree.
An active professional certification such as CIA, CPA, or CFSA is preferred.
‪4+ years of experience in internal or external audit, preferably with experience in the financial services industry

Physical Requirements of Essential Job Functions:

The associate is frequently required to sit and/or stand, communicate, reach, and manipulate objects, tools or controls that are typical of an office/bank environment. Lifting items weighting up to 10 pounds on a consistent basis. Manual dexterity and coordination are required over 80% of the work period while operating equipment such as computers, phones, calculators, etc.

Working Conditions:

Typical office environment
Extended viewing of computer screens
Periodic travel between locations may be required.

The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work performed by associates assigned to this position. They are not intended to be an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and skills required of the associate classified as such. Duties and responsibilities may be added or changed as deemed appropriate by management at any time therefore, they could differ from those outlined above.

 Responsible for working with the Chief Compliance Officer in development, monitoring and oversight of the Corporate Compliance areas: Testing and Monitoring, Risk Assessment and Reporting & Monitoring, Regulatory Watch, Model Validation, Data Management and others

Promoting Compliance culture within CACIB US staff, in coordination with Global Compliance. Monitoring the execution of the annual Risk Assessment and report progress and issues to the CCO and at the CMC or other relevant committees

Governance:

Assist the CCO with the definition of the Business Strategy, based on the US regulatory events and Global Compliance strategy. Coordinate the presentation of the Business Strategy to US and Head Office management teams.   In collaboration with the expert Compliance Managers, define and consolidate the set of metrics for reporting to the CCO and the frequency of the reporting
  Maintain an updated set of Compliance policies and procedures for CACIB US and oversee policy development with the expert Compliance Managers, as required to address US banking regulations
  Coordinate with Compliance Managers to adapt global Compliance policies and guidelines for US implementation

  Responsible for overseeing the process for Risk and Control Self-Assessment (RCSA) and related risk mapping
 
Program Management:
 
Lead and/ or drive key Corporate Compliance initiatives forward from identification to closure

  Provide tracking, status updates and related reporting on all Corporate Compliance work streams
  Manage technical enhancements related to Corporate Compliance

 Internal Reporting:

  Prepare and consolidate the contributions of Compliance function for all the relevant committees including the management committee

  Work closely with key stakeholders in other functions (Business Lines, CUSO Compliance and Risk teams, Global Compliance Team, Legal and others) to ensure consistent, insightful and clear messaging to senior management

 Projects & Innovation:

Represent Compliance in the community of Innovation Relays of CACIB US, attend the dedicated meetings and identify enhancements opportunities for Compliance for discussion with the Innovation team of CACIB US and with Compliance Project & Innovation in Head Office

 Compliance Controls:

Partner with bank stakeholders to help build an effective Compliance program
  Provide advice and guidance to management on implications of compliance trends and issues affecting the firm
  Coordinate with expert Compliance Managers to guarantee that appropriate Compliance second-level controls are in place. Consolidate and report the results of the controls to the relevant stakeholders and Committees
  Prepare, review, consolidate and timely report data and reporting requested by the CUSO Compliance team
  Act as Secretary for the NAP Committee and liaise with Business Lines to guide them through the process to ensure application of the NAP policies and procedures
  Act as Permanent Control correspondent for Compliance
  Coordinate with expert Compliance Managers to guarantee that appropriate Compliance second-level controls are in place. Consolidate and report the results of the controls to the relevant stakeholders and Committees
  Prepare, review, consolidate and timely report data and reporting requested by the CUSO Compliance team
  Act as Secretary for the NAP Committee and liaise with Business Lines to guide them through the process to ensure application of the NAP policies and procedures
  Act as Permanent Control correspondent for Compliance
Maintain the Compliance risk control maps
  Define a yearly schedule for Compliance reviews of the various Business Lines and ensure that those are performed timely and fully documented. Review the results of the Compliance reviews and ensure that they are communicated to the CCO and to the relevant Heads of Business Line and senior management. Monitor the implementation of remediation actions when applicable

Management position: Yes

Experience with driving cross-functional complex projects and driving change management.

Good understanding of the different Business Functions, such as HR, finance, and the regulatory environment in the US.

Detailed oriented, articulate with very good organization skills.

About the job
We are open to a Hybrid role with the person we hire being in the office 2 to 3 days per week.

POSITION SUMMARY: Commercial Underwriter I, II, and III

The Commercial Underwriter underwrites commercial business, real estate, agriculture, and SBA 504 loan requests. The underwriter analyzes financial information, recommends loan actions, and approves loan requests within his or her authority as assigned. Analyzes commercial loan applications and renewals and determines credit worthiness and appropriate grading for consideration of the loan request. Assists the sales staff to maximize the cross sales effort as the loan request is being processed. Prepares loan for legal documentation and monitors the closing process. Follows for timely renewals, reporting requirements, compliance and delinquencies.

MAJOR RESPONSIBILITIES: Commercial Underwriter I, II, and III

 Analyzes commercial loan applications received by Relationship Managers to determine eligibility of request. Provides prompt turnaround time upon request. Confers with Relationship Managers to determine client needs and discuss options for borrowers. Requests any additional information needed to complete processing and periodically attends client meetings to provide credit expertise. Approves or declines commercial loan requests within assigned limits. Recommends credit approval requirements including the establishment of financial performance covenants, monitoring requirements, and other loan provisions and ensures accurate grading of new and existing credits based on analysis.
 Coordinates the credit approval process, evaluates repayment, and mitigates risk.
 Analyzes key factors such as industry, management, and economic trends.
 Provides assistance and exceptional sales support to all sales staff in answering questions relating to commercial loans.
 Assures the customer loan request is processed accurately and timely. Coordinates with appraisal department and escrow companies for secured loan products.
 Orders business credit reports and personal credit reports on business principals.
 Coordinates compliance, decline letter preparation and maintenance of adverse action database.
 Maintains a log of maturing lines and coordinates renewal process to ensure that necessary information is received prior to line maturity.
 Monitors past due loans for assigned portfolio(s) and recommends action to sales staff or contacts customers directly, as appropriate. Maintains a log of pending action or resolution for past due loans.
 Assists Relationship Managers as needed in the preparation of Interim Credit Reports and Real Estate Update Memos.

OTHER RESPONSIBILITIES: Commercial Underwriter I, II, and III

 Maintains a current understanding of Bank underwriting guidelines, procedures, policies and compliance issues. Maintains a working knowledge of regulatory requirements for documentation and regulations relating to commercial lending.
 Maintains a current understanding of Bank policies and procedures in compliance with all federal and state laws, including but not limited to Bank Secrecy Act (SARs, CIP, OFAC), Information Security (GLBA), Identity Theft Red Flags, Financial Elder Abuse Reporting, and any other applicable regulations that may be specific to your job duties.
 Inputs application and financial information.
 Performs Commercial Credit Officer duties in their absence as needed.
 Performs other work-related duties as assigned.
 Orders the preparation of loan documentation and reviews for completion.
 May be asked to provide formal or informal training and support to various colleagues within the bank and across multiple job functions with regard to credit fundamentals, policy, and underwriting techniques and guidelines.
 Assists Commercial Loan Supervisor in the development and completion of special projects, spreadsheets, graphs, and reports as assigned.

EDUCATION, EXPERIENCE AND OTHER SKILLS REQUIRED: Commercial Underwriter I, II, and III

 High school diploma or GED required.
 Undergraduate degree in Finance, Business Administration or Accounting, or related work experience preferred.
 Three years’ experience in a small business/commercial lending environment.
 Established knowledge of financial accounting theory and logic, loan structuring, commercial products and services.
 A proven ability to interpret and discuss analytical data and make credit recommendations to Senior Management and/or Risk Management on strategic issues or initiatives.
 Excellent organizational skills with efficient work demeanor that allows involvement in multiple areas.
 Ability to utilize personal computers, and Windows-driven programs, with an emphasis on the Microsoft Office suite of applications, specifically Word and Excel.
 Ability to complete a high volume of work efficiently and with accuracy.
 Excellent verbal and written communication skills.

LEVEL DISTINCTION

Commercial Underwriter II – Above plus the following: Five years of proven experience in a small business/commercial lending environment. Must have substantial experience in small business/commercial lending and credit analysis. Must have a thorough understanding of commercial financial statements and an ability to communicate with commercial business owners. Must be able to analyze financial information, prepare cash flow and ratio analysis. Must have experience in loan recommendations and provide a concise loan write up. Experience in statistical portfolio management. Ability to supervise in manager’s absence. Possess leadership abilities in a team environment and provide project leadership. Serves as a product specialist and a technical consultant to branches and sales staff and provides assistance and exceptional sales support in answering questions relating to small business/commercial loans. Provides guidance to the Commercial Underwriter I when appropriate and recommends appropriate loan structure when presented with loans for approval. Assists the Commercial Loan Supervisor in identifying training needs for staff within the department.

Commercial Underwriter III – Above plus following: Demonstrated ability to interpret and underwrite the most complex commercial credits in the Bank with minimal guidance or oversight, seven years of experience. Subject matter expert across a broad range of credit topics including financial statements and cash flow analysis, the regional commercial real estate market, and working capital finance. Track record of appropriately utilizing credit approval authority to make sound credit recommendations on complex commercial credits in line with the Bank’s credit culture, policies and procedures. Will serve as team leader for respective regional commercial underwriting group and in various departmental and bank wide projects. Must have ability to train and mentor junior credit personnel. Expert user of Bank systems, software, and third-party vendor platforms. Ability to perform primary relationship management or credit administrator functions in place of Relationship Managers and Commercial Loan Supervisors.

Company Profile

Established in 1975, Tri Counties Bank is a wholly-owned subsidiary of TriCo Bancshares (NASDAQ: TCBK) headquartered in Chico, California, with assets of nearly $10 billion and more than 45 years of financial stability. Tri Counties Bank provides a unique brand of Service With Solutions® for communities throughout California with a breadth of personal, small business and commercial banking services, plus an extensive branch network, more than 37,000 surcharge-free ATMs nationwide, and advanced online and mobile banking.

Tri Counties Bank remains strong and profitable through our top-down commitment to our core values, sound business principles and responsible lending practices.

Our success is also based on our community engagement. We still believe in the vision of the helpful and caring community banker. As we grow and serve more communities, we become more involved, providing substantial financial and volunteer support to local economies and community organizations. We applaud our employees who roll up their sleeves to work and volunteer for a greater good in our communities.

Tri Counties Bank hires individuals who are qualified for the role and who represent the communities in which we serve. We look to place people in positions where they can best utilize their abilities and strengths, and where they are able to grow with the Bank.

The hiring range for this opportunity is $78,258 to $129,000 annually along with incentive opportunities, creating a competitive total compensation package based on our pay scale, and may be modified by location and is commensurate with qualifications and experience.

Tri Counties Bank is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer, Race/Color/Religion/Sex/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity/National Origin/Disability/Veteran.

About the job
Scope:
The primary purpose of this position is to provide independent, objective compliance testing support across the organization. The Staff/ Senior Auditor is responsible for supporting the SOX Compliance Program and working with process and control owners on implementation, execution and compliance with identified key controls. The Staff/ Senior Auditor assists in the development, monitoring/ update and execution of the SOX Compliance program and related supporting documentation. The Staff/ Senior Auditor assists in the development of documentation detailing audit status and results to management to facilitate internal communication and execution of any remediation required by process and control owners.

The Staff/ Senior Auditor reports to the Director, SOX Compliance and works collaboratively with business process owners bringing a systematic, disciplined approach to evaluating the effectiveness of governance, risk management, and control.
Additionally, the Staff/ Senior Auditor supports the performance of internal audit assignments of the Company, as needed.
 Responsibilities:
While the position reports directly to the Director, SOX Compliance, the candidate will have frequent interactions with the Chief Financial Officer, Chief Compliance Officer, as well as other internal and external stakeholders. The Staff/ Senior Auditor’s key responsibility is to assist with the performance of financial, operational, and compliance audits in accordance with accepted standards. Specific activities include but are not limited to the following:
Assisting with audit planning, creating work programs, identifying risks, establishing objectives, and scope of work.
Executing the audit - including fieldwork, preparation of work papers, drafting preliminary audit issues, identifying areas of potential improvement, developing practical recommendations that address root causes, and generating effective and reliable audit reports and presentations.
Assisting with the communication of audit status, findings and corrective actions to management at the local and corporate levels.
Providing administrative support for meetings and travel.
 SOX Compliance Program responsibilities include: 
Performing process walkthroughs, updating documentation, evaluating controls, testing, following-up on any action plans for identified deficiencies and monitoring any remediation and or process changes throughout the year.
Keeping abreast of current developments in accounting, auditing, fraud and other emerging risks that could impact the organization.
Learning key concepts about the construction industry including project management, project controls, percentage of completion accounting, contract administration, etc.
Working collaboratively with key stakeholders across the organization, including external auditors, business process owners, and management.
Executing testing strategies with appropriate level of professional skepticism to ensure internal controls are operating effectively and efficiently.
Evaluating the efficiency and effectiveness of testing strategies throughout the audit and proposing suggestions for improvements, as appropriate.
Contributing to the drafting of audit reports and key communications to management.
Offering constructive feedback and elevating issues in a timely manner.
Assisting in preparations for meetings and travel including but not limited to scheduling and confirming meeting times, ordering lunch, making copies, researching travel options, and preparing expense reports.

Position Requirements/Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in Business, Finance or Accounting, along with three (3) plus years’ job related experience in audit, fraud, compliance, accounting or as a business analyst (or equivalent combination of experience required).
Relevant certification (CIA, CISA, CFE, CPA) preferred, but not required.
Working knowledge of GAAS, GAAP, SOX and COSO risk frameworks (COBIT/ISO and cybersecurity framework knowledge is a plus).
Willingness to comply with the Company’s Code of Business Conduct and the Institute of Internal Auditor’s International Professional Practices Framework.
Ability to perform audit tests and detect/document weaknesses in internal controls.
Proficient in Microsoft Office applications, including advanced Excel functionality.
Strong analytical skills and attention to detail. Ability to work with detailed information while perceiving and defining the larger/underlying issues and drivers.
Ability to communicate effectively with a broad group of users with different backgrounds.
Excellent interpersonal, analytical, problem-solving, and decision-making skills.
Some domestic travel is required.

We are an equal opportunity employer: We do not discriminate based on race, color, national origin, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, age, genetic information, marital status, military status, membership or activity in a local human rights commission, or status with regard to public assistance, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law.

About the job
Duties

Summary

This vacancy is for an Investigation and Compliance Specialist in the Office of the Under Secretary, Bureau of Industry and Security within the Department of Commerce.

Requirements

Qualifications

Qualification requirements in the vacancy announcements are based on the U.S. Office of Personnel Management (OPM) Qualification Standards Handbook, which contains federal qualification standards. This handbook is available on the Office of Personnel Management's website located at: https://www.opm.gov/policy-data-oversight/classification-qualifications/general-schedule-qualification-standards/ Applicants must possess one year of specialized experience equivalent in difficulty and responsibility to the next lower grade level in the Federal Service. Specialized experience is experience that has equipped the applicant with the particular competencies/knowledge, skills and abilities to successfully perform the duties of the position. This experience need not have been in the federal government. Experience refers to paid and unpaid experience, including volunteer work done through National Service programs (e.g., Peace Corps, AmeriCorps) and other organizations e.g., professional; philanthropic, religious; spiritual; community, student, social). Volunteer work helps build critical competencies; knowledge, and skills and can provide valuable training and experience that translates directly to paid employment. You will receive credit for all qualifying experience, including volunteer experience. To qualify at the GS-14 level: SPECIALIZED EXPERIENCE: You must possess one full year (52 weeks) of specialized experience equivalent to the GS-13 level in the Federal service. Specialized experience is defined as: Designing, developing, analyzing, managing and/or implementing a comprehensive regulatory compliance program in the areas of investment security, import/export controls, telecommunications authorizations, and/or acquisition reviews; Advising and updating management officials on the status of regulatory compliance issues; and Leading the analysis of complex cases or projects related to regulatory compliance. The initial cut-off date is 06/19/2023. Applicants found eligible may receive consideration at any point during the open period of the announcement, as requested by the organization. 06/19/2023 07/05/2023 Cutoff dates and the closing date of this announcement may be adjusted as needed, and any updates will be reflected on this announcement.

The Bureau of Industry and Security (BIS) advances U.S. national security, foreign policy, and economic objectives by ensuring an effective export control and treaty compliance system, and by promoting continued U.S. leadership in strategic technologies. BIS accomplishes its mission by maintaining and strengthening adaptable, efficient, effective export controls and treaty compliance systems, along with active leadership and involvement in international export control regimes. The Office of Information and Communications Technology and Services fulfills responsibilities in reviewing information and communications technology and services (ICTS) supply chain transactions and the effects on national security, the digital economy, public safety and security and critical infrastructure mandated through Executive Order 13873. The office leads and coordinates transaction reviews with nine Executive and independent U.S. Government branches and agencies.

About the job
The ACS certification program is a mandatory program that serves as a performance management strategy to address the need for overarching consistency and Service-specificity of Military Family Readiness programs. The performance management strategy must assess elements of cost, quality, effectiveness, utilization, accessibility, and customer satisfaction.

Systems Navigators and ACS Compliance Specialists (SNACS) – ACS Compliance Specialists

Provide inspection and administrative support services at Army Community Services locations to support IMCOM HQ’s certification process, IAW the Department of Defense Instructions 1342.22, and Army Regulation 608-1. Support includes ongoing quality control related tasks outside of the scheduled site inspections. Certification support personnel will work remotely to the Installation Management Command (IMCOM) Headquarters (HQ), ACS Certification Teams to include the planning and coordination of inspections and site visits at ACS locations to support IMCOM HQ’s certification process.

Job Duties

Perform all required duties via telecommuting (telework) with the exception of on-site certification reviews conducted with the government. 
Administrative support includes ongoing quality control related tasks outside of the scheduled site inspections. 
At least once every four years the specialist will be responsible for participating in all certification inspection for ACS Centers, all ACS Programs, and Operations. 
Provide support virtually and/or onsite. 
Coordinate certification inspection milestones with IMCOM HQ, Certification Team, ID Functional Manager and ACS Directors at the Garrisons and schedule site visits with site points of contact at the sites to be inspected (Virtual and On-site).
Responsible for participating in all on-site certification inspections for no less than five (5) and up to fifteen (15) days on-site visit per years (this includes travel time). 
Be responsible for performing a variety of administrative support tasks to include issuing the inspection packet to the sites a year in advance, reviewing submitted materials, providing guidance as it pertains to the certification process, the completion of government provided checklists, entering data in Department of Defense (DOD) Family Programs Certification Management System (FP- CMS) tracking system, completing reports, and follow-up actions. 
Review ACS center’s pre-positioned documents to meet certification; prepare corrective action plans; review corrective actions for compliance; prepare certification correspondence and documentation; and obtain and review information from the DoD Family Program Certification Management System (FP-CMS). 
Plan and coordinate up to one approved training event per year to provide Army centric training for no less than nine (9) contractors per event. 

Required Skills/Qualifications

Ability to effectively communicate and interact with others, both in person and/or by telephone to conduct business.
Must be able to travel.
Experience with Microsoft Suite programs
Must be legally authorized to work in the United States. 
Must be able to pass a background check.

Required Education Level

Bachelor’s degree in a business or a behavior science field 
One year experience performing social science administrative work or social science inspections.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.
