About the job
*Local Candidates Only Please *

Our employer is in search of a Contract Compliance Specialist. This position provides statistical forecasting and metrics on all aspects of the Equal Business Opportunity program, and will advocate, track, monitor, and reports the utilization of small, minority and women-owned business enterprise (SMWBE) firms in the authority's equal business opportunity program.

The position will ensure contract compliance via data collection, management, data analysis, goal development, and record maintenance. Tracks, monitors and report the authority's prime contractors' performance as it relates to meeting EDO program goals and requirements. Serves as the primary contact for EDO program data and metrics. This position also trains internal and external stakeholders on the SMWBE contract compliance processes and procedures and assists with vendor advocacy, outreach events and vendor development.
This position reports to the director of EDO and requires reliability and accountability in all aspects of the defined role.

JOB RESPONSIBILITIES

Prepares, reviews and monitors authority's contracts and agreements to ensure contract compliance with economic inclusion policies and procedures.
Collects, maintains, monitors and reports SMWBE contract data in accordance with appropriate economic inclusion policies and contract requirements.
Provides statistical forecasting and metrics on all aspects of the EDO program.
Tracks and monitors contract participation and/or compliance with contract requirements, commitments, and in field activity.
Analyzes and summarizes availability and utilization statistical models and compile data and statistics on program operation.
Analyzes individual contracts and projects to develop specific goals. Establishes and maintains contact with contract and project managers, inspectors, prime contractors, and subcontractors to provide assistance, information, and/or guidance.
Prepares procedures, and other administrative materials.
Reviews and participates in the approval process for the SMWBE subcontracting plans for contractors, vendors, and suppliers to ensure compliance with the EDO program.
Evaluates vendor, supplier, and/or contractor SMWBE subcontracting plans and analyzes plans for good faith efforts toward compliance with EDO program and monitors progress toward achieving goals.
Provides technical assistance to key stakeholders to comply with the EDO program requirements.
Draft conciliatory measures to bring vendor/supplier/contractors into compliance and recommend necessary action to the director to be in compliance.
Maintains the vendor, supplier, and contractor database.
Participates in pre-bid meetings and pre-construction conferences and in SMWBE activities related to expansion goals for the EDO program.
Performs outreach activities for targeted stakeholders, contractors, vendors, and suppliers doing business with the authority.

KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES

Knowledge of business administration principles, practices, and procedures relative to business ownership, operation, purchasing, subcontracting, and related areas.
Knowledge of contract compliance, affirmative action, and equal opportunities principles, practices, and guidelines.
Ability to provide assistance to vendors, suppliers, contractors, targeted businesses, and other key stakeholders as needed.
Ability to develop and maintain professional working relationships with business contractors, vendors, suppliers, targeted businesses, company, and the public.
Ability to apply understanding and deal with problems involving several concrete variables in standardized situations. Ability to establish and implement effective monitoring systems and procedures.
Computer skills and the ability to use MS Office Suite, including Outlook, Word, PowerPoint, with intermediate level experience in Excel.
EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE

Bachelor's degree in business administration, or related field from an accredited institution with a minimum of two (2) years of experience and/or training in statistical analysis and forecasting in contract compliance, contracting, government procurement, or other areas involving applying policies and procedures.
Or Associate degree in business administration, or related field from an accredited institution and a minimum of four (4) years of recent experience and/or training in statistical analysis and forecasting in contract compliance, contracting, government procurement, or other areas involving applying policies and procedures
Or Six (6) years of demonstrated training, experience and education that provides the required knowledge, skills, and abilities in statistical analysis and forecasting in contract compliance, contracting, government procurement, or other areas involving applying policies and procedures.
Any combination of experience, education and training that provides the required knowledge, skills, and abilities to perform the essential functions of the position.

 Ability to learn and understand complex legal and regulatory concepts and convert them into relevant, practical business requirements and compliance solutions.
 Strong subject matter knowledge of the Compliance Risk Management Program and in-depth knowledge and understanding of compliance risk management practices and methodologies, applicable AXP policies and procedures, including risk and control assessments.
 Knowledge and understanding of American Express’ core business offerings, APIs, spend management and accounting systems, accounts payable and/or accounts receivable processes as well as the benefits of digital tools in the business to business marketplace is a plus.

 Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent work experience

Excellent written and verbal communication skills and the ability to build and maintain relationships across the Firm

About the job
Compliance Officer - Boston, MA - Investment Management

An investment management firm with approximately $93 billion on behalf of major pension funds, endowments, foundations, governments, and other investors based in the U.S. and abroad is looking to hire a Compliance Officer to their growing team. The Compliance Officer will be a generalist who along with other members of the global compliance team will support the firm’s Chief Compliance Officer in developing, implementing, testing, and enforcing the Compliance Program.

Key Responsibilities:

Review and approve marketing and advertising materials, including, but limited to, prospect books, fact sheets, RFPs and due diligence questionnaires, to ensure compliance with the requirements of the Advisers Act, NFA/CFTC, FINRA and other global regulatory requirements as applicable. 
Review and approve personal trading and other required reporting under the firm’s Code of Ethics. 
Review clients and prospects for KYC and AML compliance. 
Prepare compliance specific reporting for clients as needed. 
Assist with the preparation and filing of required regulatory reporting. 
Assist with the review of client mandates to ensure compliance with contractual, firm, and regulatory requirements. 
Other compliance related responsibilities as directed. 

Qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree in Business or related and 3-5 years of relevant compliance experience at a registered investment adviser. 
Strong working knowledge of the Investment Advisers Act and the requirements of a Compliance and Risk program under the Advisers Act. 
Strong Experience with the review and approval of marketing and advertising materials. 
A working knowledge of many of the following is highly desirable: Investment Company Act, Securities Act, Exchange Act, ERISA, FINRA, GIPS, CFTC/NFA, Dodd Frank swap requirements, fixed income trading, and Private Placement requirements. 
Strong work ethic and attention to detail; Proven ability to handle simultaneous multiple tasks and meet competing deadlines with limited oversight and support. 
Team orientation and willingness to engage in tasks of all sizes; Great communication skills 
Experience with the use of Charles River, My Compliance Office, Signal, and Bridger are a plus. 

This role is a full-time opportunity that will offer a base of 115k, 25% bonus, and great benefits. If you are interested in this opportunity, please reach out to Vincenzo Kulturides directly at vkulturides@daleyaa.com

About the job
We are partnered with a leading hedge fund to source a Compliance Analyst to join their Minneapolis or Chicago office. As a Compliance Analyst, you will play a crucial role in ensuring the hedge fund's adherence to applicable laws, regulations, and internal policies. Your primary responsibility will be to assist in maintaining an effective compliance program while monitoring and assessing regulatory risks. This position requires exceptional analytical abilities, a comprehensive understanding of financial markets, and a strong commitment to regulatory compliance.

Responsibilities:

Collaborate with the compliance team to develop, review, and update compliance policies and procedures in line with regulatory requirements. Ensure all policies are accurately documented, communicated, and adhered to by relevant stakeholders within the organization.
Regulatory Reporting: Prepare and submit regulatory filings, such as form U4 and U5, reports, and other required documentation in accordance with regulatory deadlines. Ensure accuracy and timeliness of submissions while maintaining appropriate records and documentation.
Compliance Testing and Monitoring: Conduct periodic compliance testing and monitoring activities to assess the effectiveness of the hedge fund's compliance controls. Identify areas of non-compliance or potential risks and recommend appropriate remedial actions to management.
Internal Investigations: Support internal investigations related to compliance matters, including potential violations, conflicts of interest, and employee misconduct. Collect and analyze relevant data, document findings, and assist in implementing corrective measures.
Industry Best Practices: Stay informed about industry best practices, emerging trends, and regulatory developments relevant to hedge fund compliance. Proactively recommend and implement enhancements to the firm's compliance program based on evolving regulatory requirements.

Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in finance, business administration, or a related field. 
1-3 years working in a compliance role within the financial services industry, preferably within a hedge fund or asset management firm.
Strong knowledge of financial markets, investment products, and applicable regulations (e.g., SEC, CFTC, FINRA).
Excellent analytical skills with the ability to identify and assess compliance risks.
Strong written and verbal communication skills to convey complex compliance concepts to diverse stakeholders.
Ability to work collaboratively within a team environment and establish positive working relationships with internal and external stakeholders.
Proficiency in using compliance software, tools, and databases to manage compliance-related activities.

This role is on a flexible hybrid schedule (1-2 days a week in-office). Candidates not local to Chicago or Minnesota will not be considered.

About the job
Position Summary:

The Compliance Specialist is responsible for submitting notice filings on behalf of funds and other investment products with all applicable jurisdictions in the United States. The Compliance Specialist works closely with a manager who performs daily reviews of all work. The Compliance Specialist also assists with special filing projects such as initial filings, name changes, terminations, and fund reorganizations.

The Compliance Specialist is expected to model RELX core values by mirroring one’s words with action – fostering diversity and inclusion, valuing, and respecting differences, demonstrating, and inspiring high ethical standards and actions, showing greater concern for the well-being of others over self, honoring commitments and promises, and acting decisively.

Essential Job Functions: This job description indicates the general level and nature of work expected of the incumbent. It is not a comprehensive list of specific duties or activities associated with the position. The incumbent may be asked to perform other duties as assigned.
Serve in the capacity of client service representative for both state examiners and BSRS clients.
Assume full ownership for client relationship and fund filing responsibilities including:
Performing renewal and amendment filing activities for an assigned list of mutual funds and clients. Perform review of warning reports to identify action items and analyze historical sales data to project future filing needs. Perform special filings (initial registrations, name changes, FYE changes, terminations, and reorganizations) only under close supervision and direction of the Manager.
Working closely with the Manager to learn how to set up Blue Sky Solution (“BSS”) to perform more complex filing projects, such as initial applications, name changes and fund reorganizations.
Reviewing all incoming State correspondence and compare to items in the pending files. Follow-up with State examiners on open items. Collate final documents, update BSS and keep all legal files in highest quality order for archive and retrieval. 
Communication of fund changes from client and preparation and submission of all files and related documents to state agencies.
Maintenance of all fund files to ensure accurate and timely record keeping.
Timely follow-up with state agencies on open filing issues and resolution per state instructions.
Proactive management of fund files as necessary to accommodate new funds and to reflect changes to existing funds. This includes requesting new files and/or labels as appropriate and working with administrative support staff to prepare permanent files.
Act as a liaison between the State and BSRS in matters regarding Blue Sky filings by documenting conversations with State examiners and updating Department policies, procedures, and systems that reflect any change affecting Blue Sky filings. Ensure that all filing parameters and documentation produced from the system are done in compliance within department policy and states regulation. Present significant changes to the entire staff within the Blue Sky Group to ensure understanding and uniformity.
Maintain BSS to reflect accurate permit information and participate in department control programs (such as audits) to ensure timeliness and accuracy of all filings and data.

Minimum Position Requirements:

Education and Experience:

Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent job experience.
Superior performance in current job.
Demonstrated skill ability in Customer Service, Professionalism and Organization
Blue Sky Solution experience.
Strong administrative and organizational skills required; ability to work independently and meet critical deadlines.
A team player with outstanding interpersonal skills and strong communication skills.
Strong attention to detail and a significantly high “I care quotient”.

Skills/Knowledge/Competencies:

Computer literate, with a strong aptitude in the Microsoft Office Suite, specifically with Word, Excel and Outlook. Basic understanding of Q/A function and development of test cases for both positive and negative results. 
Makes good decisions based on a mixture of analysis, wisdom, experience and judgment. Quickly grasps the complexities of problems and uses sound analyses to identify solutions, foresee obstacles, and recognize opportunities for the organization. Encourages alternative approaches and new ideas; provides analysis and solutions to complex problems to others, as requested; brings strategic perspective to challenging situations, makes decisions based on organization’s goals; identifies patterns and trends in complex data and uses those patterns to outline a path forward.
Results driven by doing everything possible to contribute to strategic goals, persisting in the face of obstacles, maintaining and communicating a clear vision of the desired results, holding self and other accountable for achieving results, leading or championing efforts to increase productivity and goal accomplishment throughout the organization.
Team orientation, customer focus, flexibility and adaptability, integrity and trust, organizational skills, attention to detail, good follow through, understanding and appreciation of regulatory functions and issues. Actively develops strong supportive and collaborative working relationships with others across all career levels, functions, cultural and organizational boundaries to achieve objectives. Gains the trust and respect of others by encouraging and enabling cooperation, resolving/addressing conflicts that effect performance, building and cultivating diverse teams, and actively seeks opportunities to work with others across the organization

About the job
See full job description and application process at https://www.sdao.com/lebanon-fire-district-chief-administrative-officer

General Position Summary:
The Chief Administrative Officer is responsible for planning, coordinating, supervising, evaluating, and managing all accounting, financial, procurement and human resources systems for the District. Work in this position requires a high degree of coordination with other District members, independent judgement, and professional decision making.

Essential Functions/Major Assignments
(The essential functions listed below are not intended to reflect all duties that may be assigned to this position. The District may augment duties and/or essential functions at its discretion) • The Chief Administrative Officer receives general administrative direction and direct supervision from the Fire Chief within established goals, budget, and boundaries set by District policy as well as all applicable laws. • Duties of this position vary widely and include but are not limited to attendance at meetings, trainings, and conferences. • Develops, administers, and maintains budgeting, accounting, and reporting systems that are compliant with professional standards. • Directs the development and administration of the District budget process and budget document that meets Oregon Local Budget Law. • Conducts thorough financial analysis and forecasting for long-term strategic planning and budget development; identifies trends, opportunities and threats related to the District’s financial position. • Prepares month end reconciliation and financial reports for Board approval; monitors and analyzes revenues and expenditures. • Directs and participates in the coordination and preparation of the District’s annual financial audit and maintains positive relations with the District’s independent auditor. • Ensures compliance of Federal, State, and local labor laws. • Develops, prepares, and recommends financial policies and procedures, monitors internal controls, and recommends changes when deemed necessary. • Supervises and/or performs all phases of the District’s payroll, accounts payable and receivables, general ledger, and fixed assets, and monitors the District’s cash management and debt administration. • Manages human resource functions, coordinates personnel, pre-employment processes, policy development, and supports executive staff in confidential personnel matters. Oversees District workers’ compensation program and family medical leave administration, member benefits, implementation, and compliance. • Maintains positive relations with District pre-loss legal and special counsel. • Directs the tracking and progress of the District’s employee performance measurements. • Oversees the District’s public contracting purchasing policies and procedures ensuring compliance with State law; provides support in contract administration. • Serves on the labor negotiating team representing the District and prepares financial impact studies. Chief Administrative Officer June 2023 • Supervises employees of the Administrative Division which includes scheduling and assigning work; mentoring, coaching, and training; developing work plans and reviewing work for completion; evaluating performance and providing feedback, setting work standards; imposing or effectively recommending necessary disciplinary action; responding to grievances; and making or effectively recommending hiring and termination decisions. • Responsible for coordinating and overseeing all duties performed by the administrative support personnel.

Secondary Functions: 
• Promote safe working practices; supports an environment of mental and physical well-being. • May respond to emergencies on an infrequent basis to assist with logistics and/or financial duties. • Operates vehicles to travel to District stations, meetings, conferences, and events. • All other duties as assigned. 

Supervisory Responsibility:
• The Chief Administrative Officer will have full supervisory responsibility of all personnel within the Administrative Division of the District.

Specific Job Knowledge, Skill, and Ability:
KNOWLEDGE • Knowledge of principles, methods, and practices of general management, governmental accounting and budgeting, financial analysis, forecasting and reporting, internal controls and auditing procedures, cash management, debt issuance, and investments. • Knowledge of generally accepted accounting principles (GAAP), Oregon Local Budget Law, Federal fringe benefit regulations, workers compensation law, and other pertinent Federal, State, and local laws. • Knowledge of organizational and management practices as applied to the analysis and evaluation of programs, policies, and operational needs. • Knowledge of principles of supervision, training, and performance evaluation, practices of organization, administration, and personnel management. • Knowledge of office practices, procedures, and equipment including computerized accounting and software systems. • Knowledge of District rules, regulations, procedures, collective bargaining agreement, mission, vision, values, and strategic planning processes. 

Education, Experience, and Certification/Licensure: Required Qualifications • Bachelor’s Degree in business, public administration, accounting, finance, or related field. • Five (5) years responsible experience in all phases of accounting, financial, budgeting, analysis and human resources including at least three years of administrative and supervisory responsibilities. OR • An equivalent combination of education, training, and experience sufficient to successfully perform the essential duties of the job.

About the job
As part of Risk Management and Compliance, you are at the center of keeping JPMorgan Chase strong and resilient. You help the firm grow its business in a responsible way by anticipating new and emerging risks, and using your expert judgement to solve real-world challenges that impact our company, customers and communities. Our culture in Risk Management and Compliance is all about thinking outside the box, challenging the status quo and striving to be best-in-class.

We are seeking a Compliance, Conduct and Operational Risk (CCOR) Associate who will effectively partner with Line of Business (LOB) and global/regional Compliance teams; including Internal Audit, Operational Risk and other Control functions. This position requires knowledge and experience in Compliance, as well as familiarity with regulatory and/or audit best practices.

Job Responsibilities

Identify potential concerns and control issues, determine the root cause of issues and ensure stakeholders develop and implement appropriate corrective actions
Execute on key strategic Compliance initiatives within the context of the firm's global compliance mandate
Work collaboratively with team members across LOBs and staff areas and participate actively in working groups

Required Qualifications, Capabilities, And Skills

5+ years of relevant Compliance or other related experience; such as Risk management, Audit, or similar Control-related experience
Demonstrated ability to identify key issues and obtain appropriate information for further analysis and must be highly analytical with experience in collecting, analyzing, and synthesizing information on various subjects
Must possess excellent written and oral communications skills
Teamwork skills; you must be flexible in work style and be able to work appropriately with stakeholders and colleagues at all levels
Strong PC Skills including Microsoft Excel, SharePoint, Word, PowerPoint and other reporting tools
Ability to establish credibility and strong partnerships with senior business leaders, control functions, and corporate partners globally
Ability to manage numerous reviews and confidential and sensitive information in a professional manner in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment

Preferred Qualifications, Capabilities, And Skills

MBA or Bachelor's degree with professional certification preferred
Audit, Regulatory &/or Testing experience

JPMorgan Chase & Co., one of the oldest financial institutions, offers innovative financial solutions to millions of consumers, small businesses and many of the world's most prominent corporate, institutional and government clients under the J.P. Morgan and Chase brands. Our history spans over 200 years and today we are a leader in investment banking, consumer and small business banking, commercial banking, financial transaction processing and asset management.

We recognize that our people are our strength and the diverse talents they bring to our global workforce are directly linked to our success. We are an equal opportunity employer and place a high value on diversity and inclusion at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of any protected attribute, including race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital or veteran status, pregnancy or disability, or any other basis protected under applicable law. In accordance with applicable law, we make reasonable accommodations for applicants' and employees' religious practices and beliefs, as well as any mental health or physical disability needs.

The health and safety of our colleagues, candidates, clients and communities has been a top priority in light of the COVID-19 pandemic. JPMorgan Chase was awarded the "WELL Health-Safety Rating" for all of our 6,200 locations globally based on our operational policies, maintenance protocols, stakeholder engagement and emergency plans to address a post-COVID-19 environment.

As a part of our commitment to health and safety, we have implemented various COVID-related health and safety requirements for our workforce. Employees are expected to follow the Firm's current COVID-19 or other infectious disease health and safety requirements, including local requirements. Requirements include sharing information including your vaccine card in the firm's vaccine record tool, and may include mask wearing. Requirements may change in the future with the evolving public health landscape. JPMorgan Chase will consider accommodation requests as required by applicable law.

We offer a competitive total rewards package including base salary determined based on the role, experience, skill set, and location. For those in eligible roles, discretionary incentive compensation which may be awarded in recognition of individual achievements and contributions. We also offer a range of benefits and programs to meet employee needs, based on eligibility. These benefits include comprehensive health care coverage, on-site health and wellness centers, a retirement savings plan, backup childcare, tuition reimbursement, mental health support, financial coaching and more. Additional details about total compensation and benefits will be provided during the hiring process.

Equal Opportunity Employer/Disability/Veterans

About the job
SAGICOR LIFE (EASTERN CARIBBEAN) INC. 

Job Description & Specification

 JOB Title : Compliance Officer

GRADE: 4

DEPARTMENT: Compliance

REPORTS TO: Senior Compliance Officer, EC Southern Hub

NUMBER OF REPORTING POSITIONS: Nil

 GEOGRAPHIC LOCATION: St. Vincent ( Must reside in St. Vincent )

Job Summary

Manages the compliance function, addressing money-laundering, terrorist financing, FATCA, CRS and similar regulatory risk within the St. Vincent Agency of Sagicor Life (Eastern Caribbean) Inc. (SLECI) in accordance with the laws and jurisdictions of this country.

Essential Duties And Responsibilities
 Execution of AML, CFT & PF Compliance Function: 
 Implements the AML, CFT & PF compliance programme for the operations of Sagicor Life (Eastern Caribbean) Inc. 
 Responsible for the updating of local country addendum and other procedural documents guiding the AML, CFT & PF compliance function. 
 Conducts annual AML, CFT & PF compliance Business Risk Assessment. 
 Provides Senior Compliance Officer with assessment results and initiates corrective action for compliance deficiencies. 
 Reviews compliance with the Sagicor AML, CFT & PF Programme, other policies and procedures, country addendum and regulatory requirements in countries of operation. 
 Develops and conducts AML, CFT & PF training for SLECI staff and advisors on key compliance issues and regulatory updates as appropriate. 
 Provides guidance to employees and Agency staff regarding Compliance related issues and regulatory updates, appropriate to the company operations. 
 Oversees Know Your Customer/customer due diligence process for new and existing customers. 
 Creates profiles, queries and conditions for Anti-Money Laundering detection, utilizing in-house systems, external resources and other reports. 
 Reviews activity on a monthly basis for suspicious activity. 
 Initiates investigation with customer and internal departments to obtain additional supporting information regarding transactions or activity identified. 
 Reviews data from in-house databases for evidence of customer policy/account variance. 
 Analyzes compliance monitoring reports and data in order to identify suspicious activity. 
 Maintains a log of new, pending and closed investigations relating to AML, CFT & PF review. 
 Reviews departmental logs and data for compliance with KYC and other AML, CFT & PF record keeping and currency transactions requirements. 
 Submits periodic reports to Senior Compliance Officer on compliance related matters. 
 Consults with Legal counsel as needed on internal and external reports of unusual or suspicious transactions to facilitate determination of the necessary action in a timely manner. 
 Prepares and files unusual or suspicious activity reports, terrorist property reports or other regulatory reports on possible violations of money laundering laws, terrorist financing activity and regulations and other illegal activity to applicable regulatory and/or law enforcement agencies. 
 Maintains records of internal and external reported unusual or suspicious transactions. 
 Remains up to date on local and international developments on money laundering and terrorist financing and make suggestions to management for improvements in the company's anti-money laundering and anti-terrorism policies and procedures. 
 Execution of Automatic Exchange of Information Tax Compliance Function: 
 Implements the tax compliance process for the operations of SLECI reporting business lines. 
 Implements other processes to address automatic exchange of tax information legislation requirements. 
 Responsible for the updating of local country addendum and other procedural documents guiding the FATCA, CRS and any other tax compliance function 
 Conducts annual FATCA and CRS Reviews. 
 Provides the Senior Compliance Officer with the results of the annual FATCA and CRS Review and initiates corrective action(s) to address the deficiencies identified. 
 Conducts FATCA, CRS and any other tax compliance training for the staff on key issues and updates as appropriate. 
 Provides guidance to employees regarding related issues and regulatory updates, appropriate to the company’s operations. 
 Prepares annual reports for filing with the relevant tax authority. 
 Files copies of the annual reports with the Senior Compliance Officer – EC Southern Hub. 
 Remains up to date on local and international developments on FATCA, CRS and similar initiatives/legislation to facilitate the making of suggestions to management for improvements in the company's FATCA, CRS and other similar policies and procedures. 
 Other Duties: 
 Relief Compliance Officer for other jurisdictions within SLECI. 
 Performs any other duties as assigned. 
 COMPENSABLE FACTORS 

Education/Experience

KNOWLEDGE & SKILLS REQUIRED
 A Bachelor's degree in a business-related discipline 
 Certified Anti-Money Laundering Specialist (CAMS) designation and a minimum of 3 years’ related work experience in an internal audit/compliance environment. 
 Knowledge of local and industry related requirements including anti-money laundering guidelines. 
 Highly proficient in the use of Microsoft Office software. 
 Good interpersonal skills. 
 Excellent oral and written communication skills. 
 Good organizational and time management skills. 
 Detailed oriented. 
 Ability to work effectively across functions and organisational levels and within a team environment. 
 Ethical and trustworthy. 
 Previous experience in the Financial Services environment or the Insurance Industry would be an asset.

About the job
Job Description

Johnson & Johnson Services Inc. is recruiting for a Senior Director, Value & Vendor Management.

The preferred candidate would reside in Raritan. However, this position can be based in any J&J MedTech locations.

Caring for the world, one person at a time, has inspired and united the people of Johnson & Johnson for over 125 years. We embrace research and science -- bringing innovative ideas, products, and services to advance the health and well-being of people. Employees of the Johnson & Johnson work with partners in health care to touch the lives of over a billion people every day, throughout the world. Johnson & Johnson is the world's most comprehensive and broadly based manufacturer of health care products, as well as a provider of related services, for the consumer, pharmaceutical, and MedTech and diagnostics markets. Thriving on a diverse company culture, celebrating the uniqueness of our employees and committed to inclusion. Proud to be an equal opportunity employer.

The  Senior Director, Value & Vendor Management  will be a part of the MedTech SC Digital & Business Transformation Management Organization (TMO), which owns strategy and execution across a complex portfolio of strategic transformation iniatives within its domain.

The role will be responsible for value management, partner program enablement, and resource optimization, across multiple highly complex programs with combined $300MM+ annual spend and value commitments across a broad range of areas covering efficiency, reduction, avoidance, and revenue protection.

This individual will partner across a broad spectrum of functional and technical partners, while leveraging a refined, multi-functional toolset of business expertise, process improvement, change management knowledge, execution of transformative initiatives, and digital acumen to effectively interact with a breadth of stakeholders.

Key Responsibilities

 Value Management: Lead and own end-to-end value management framework and playbook to ensure program value is identified, aligned, and realized. 60% 
 Identification:Analyze data and trends, conduct market research, and collaborate with cross-functional partners to understand the potential value that can be achieved through process improvements, cost optimization, and operational efficiencies driven by in-scope transformation programs.
 Alignment: Shape and drive alignment across key partners on the strategic goals and objectives of the business transformation program.Lead discussions and provide insights to gain buy-in.
 Realization: Partner with program leaders to implement identified value drivers and value capture/realization mechanics.Lead efforts across the impacted functions to drive value realization and cost containment.
 Define and track an overarching value proposition and related success metrics across programs, avoiding duplication
 Working with the Portfolio Lead, prioritize programs and deliverables against the value proposition
 Vendor Management: Lead newly formed transformation partner program across 20+ key external vendors & partners supporting our transformation programs. 30% 
 Manage Vendor Relationships: Maintain strong partnerships with key vendors and suppliers. Evaluate vendor performance, negotiate contracts, shape talent needs, and implement best practices to optimize the vendor management process.
 Vendor Selection and Evaluation: Collaborate with cross-functional teams to assess vendor capabilities, conduct due diligence, and select strategic vendors to support various program needs.Define evaluation criteria, manage vendor relationships, and monitor performance to ensure adherence to quality, cost, and delivery standards.
 Contract and Relationship Management: Partnering with procrurement, oversee contract negotiations, terms, and agreements with vendors. Foster open communication, resolve issues, and drive continuous improvement initiatives to enhance vendor relationships and maximize value.
 Resource Management: 10% 
 Working with BUHR and the Talent Strategy Lead, optimize Resource Forecasting: Develop and implement resource management capabilities; Forecast resource needs across multiple programs and skillsets based on program demand.Standardize roles and skills across the programs to be able to make data-driven decisions.
 Cost Control: Collaborate with program leaders and finance controls to understand resource needs, allocation, and budget alignment.
 Minimum of Bachelor’s degree required; advanced degree or MBA is highly desirable
 Requires a minimum of 10 years of progressive experience in leadership roles within Operations, Supply Chain, or large transformation programs.
 Requires a minimum of 5 years of major transformation experience
 Demonstrated hands-on expertise in driving value management and cost containment
 Experience designing, developing, implementing, and managing complex processes within a global organization required
 Excellent interpersonal and negotiating skills, with proven ability to influence/collaborate to get to desired result
 Requires people management and development experience
 Strong customer focus (internal & external), including development and management of stakeholders
 Certification in areas of expertise (e.g., PMP, APICS, Lean/Six Sigma /Process Excellence, etc.) is preferred

About the job

Overview

Masonite is growing our Global Trade and Customs Team. The Global Trade and Customs Team is responsible for Masonite's trade policies, procedures, systems, special programs (supply chain security, Lacey, forced labor), broker/forwarder management and duty reduction programs.

Currently we are looking for an experienced trade data specialist to support trade data set up, maintenance and automation. Our ideal candidate would be skilled in the core functions of trade such as classification (HTS,ECCN), valuation, origin determination, free trade agreement qualification and solicitation. This position will function as subject matter in these areas and will work closely with other functions and departments within the organization such as Sourcing, Finance, Engineering, Operations, and Legal to ensure reasonable care. This role will report to the Manager of Global Trade Data

Responsibilities
Research, summarize and provide strategic insights regarding Global Trade processes, policies, and regulations as it relates to Trade Data
Identify & execute opportunities to increase bandwidth through automation and streamlining of business processes
Automated Classification, Origin Determination, Business Analytics, Landed Cost Modeling
HTS Classification and Country of Origin determination as well as support Masonite’s Free Trade Agreement and Special Trade program operations
Use product descriptions and technical data to determine correct classification of goods being imported or exported. Develop and retain audit trails to support the classification assigned and update classification database system. Respond to daily classification inquiries from customs brokers, government agencies, customers, and vendors.
Provide direction related to rules of origin for country of origin determination, reporting, and product marking. Assist in the qualification, solicitation, and use of preferential related to free trade agreements.
Determine if additional duties or fees apply (ADD/CVD, 301, etc.)
Respond to inquiries from U.S. Customs and Border Protection, Canadian Border Services Agency, and other Customs agencies.
Prepare Binding Ruling requests for submission to U.S. Customs and Border Protection.
Respond to Customs CF 28/29 related to Trade Data inquiries
Develop post entry documentation and data to support any free-trade agreement claims or to resolve any compliance issues.
Execute audits for Masonite’s trade data. Based on results from those audits, assist in the development of a robust action item plan to address any exceptions found.
Support the monitoring, maintenance, and retention of records and documentation related to Trade Data in accordance with local regulations and Masonite’s internal policy.
Complete special projects as needed including preparations of executive level presentations
Develop appropriate documentation, training modules, and job aids to deliver training and instruction to internal and external parties involved with or affected by Customs and Trade issues.
In-depth review of complex legal regulatory documents to successfully address and respond to questions or issues identified by internal and external parties.
Participate in the development and publishing of internal and external manuals related to import and export requirements.
Travel as needed (<10%)
Qualifications
Bachelor’s Degree in related field of study or equivalent professional experience
Import Operations experience
Country of Origin Assignment and Free Trade Agreement Qualifications
Import/Export Compliance Audit Programs
Classification (HTS - Harmonized Tariff Schedule, ECCN- Export Control Classification Number)
Experience filing for CBP Rulings
Experience responding to CBP request for information (CF28s)
Strong analytical skills with regards to financial analysis, data manipulation, and the ability to create actionable information from data
Proficient in Microsoft Excel, PowerPoint, Word, and Visio
Ability to communicate clearly to technical and non-technical audiences
Capable of creating written reports, proposals, processes, and project documentation
Ability to deliver high quality results
Direct experience with and use of the U.S. Customs Automated Commercial Environment (ACE) on-line portal.
Experience with Customs-Trade Partnership Against Terrorism (C-TPAT), Importer Self-Assessment (ISA), Focused Assessment Audits, is highly desired for this position.
Licensed Customs Broker or equivalent work experience

The Manager of Pharmacy Compliance is responsible for managing and ensuring that the daily processes are conducted in compliance with our PBM vendor. Report to other business areas of any risk identified in their process flow regarding Pharmacy.

Serve as the RxClaim SME.
 

Qualifications:

  An undergraduate degree in Business Administration or equivalent work experience in a related field, plus eight (8) years of related experience in a compliance environment. A minimum of three (3) years leadership experience.
Medicare, Affordable Care ACT (ACA), and/or health plan Compliance experience is strongly preferred.
Experience working with and leading audits either at the Federal or state levels. 
 

Knowledge, & Skills

Excellent customer service skills with effective communication skills both written and verbal.
Excellent interpersonal skills, including the ability to work across the organization and with the PBM vendor.
Comfortable dealing with and managing in an extremely fast-paced environment.
Decision making/problem solving skills.
Effective in relationship building with the PBM vendor.
Exceptional oral and written and presentation skills.
Ability to work collaboratively with all levels of management.
Strong project management skills.

Self-directed with proven initiation skills.

Proficiency with MS Excel, Word, and Access

This role is designated as a role that fits into the “Hybrid of Choice” model. Share information (i.e. reports, briefing presentations, The Surgeon General (TSG) Smart Sheets), processes, improvement initiatives, and other work products across all stakeholders within the Directorate as approved.

About the job
Job Title: Associate Attorney - Business Law

NO RECRUITERS, PLEASE. REAL APPLICANTS ONLY. THANK YOU!

Position Summary:
Our law firm is seeking an early career Associate Attorney with a strong interest in business law, contracts, and mergers and acquisitions to join our growing team. As an Associate Attorney, you will be responsible for providing legal advice and counsel to clients on various matters related to business law. You will work closely with senior attorneys, paralegals, and other legal and administrative professionals to ensure that clients receive high-quality business advisory and legal services.

Essential Functions:
Conduct legal research and analysis on various business law issues, including contracts, mergers and acquisitions, general corporate law, intellectual property law, tax law, insurance law and securities law.
Draft and review legal documents, including contracts, agreements, and corporate formation and governance documents.
Represent clients in negotiations, mediations, and other legal proceedings related to business law.
Advise clients on legal and business issues related to their operations, including regulatory compliance, employment law, and commercial transactions.
Collaborate with senior attorneys and paralegals to prepare for client meetings, to prepare strategic guidance for clients, and to work with outside or specialty counsel to provide expected client services.
Communicate with clients regularly to update them on legal matters and provide advice and counsel on legal and business issues.

Qualifications:
J.D. or LLM from an accredited law school and active membership in the State Bar of Nevada.
Multi-jurisdictional admissions are a plus.
Dual major JD/MBA or other highly business focused education also a plus.
1-3 years of experience working in a small to medium sized firm with a focus on business law, contracts, mergers and acquisitions, or other business related areas of law serving primarily business clients.
Prior experience working in a non-law related business is a definite plus.
Strong analytical and research skills.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Solid business automation capabilities including Microsoft Office applications, law firm automation packages (esp. Clio) and other automation systems. Experience with AI including a strong understanding of what it can and cannot do is another plus.
Ability to work well independently as well as part of a team.
Strong work ethic and commitment to providing high-quality legal and business advisory services to clients.

About Our Firm:
“Navvee” is short for “Navigation” or “Navigator”. It’s what we do for our business and investor clients: providing direction and advice on achieving business success. We’re not your garden variety business advisory and law firm. We have decades of experience in actually running businesses, INCLUDING acquisitions, growth, exits, and how the law supports and frames a business’s operation. We provide services to business owners, key executives, and investors that are looking for solid business advice coupled with a strong understanding of the law and how to apply that knowledge to create winning business solutions. We are experiencing phenomenal growth right now and have a need for at least one associate to join our team. Navvee pays competitive salaries and benefits packages. For more information, visit our website at https:/navvee.com.

To Apply:
Send an email to hr@navvee.com with a current resume, a writing sample of between 5-10 pages, and a cover letter explaining your interest in joining the firm.

By joining the American Red Cross you will touch millions of lives every year and experience the greatness of the human spirit at its best. Are you ready to be part of the world's largest humanitarian network?

Join us—Where your Career is a Force for Good!

Job Description

Why Choose Us? 

As one of the nation’s premier humanitarian organizations, the American Red Cross is dedicated to helping people in need throughout the United States and, in association with other Red Cross networks, throughout the world. When you join our team, you have a direct impact on a meaningful mission, and you can help save lives every day. If you share our passion for helping people, join us in this excellent career opportunity. Work where your career is a force for good.

We are committed to the diversity of our workforce and to delivering our programs and services in a culturally competent manner reflecting the communities we serve. Our work environment is collaborative, respectful, and inclusive with a focus on building allyship and a culture of belonging that empowers all team members. Come to learn, grow, and succeed while sharing your passion for making a difference.

The Red Cross supports a variety of cultural and community resource groups for employees and volunteers. From the Ability Network, our Asian American & Pacific Islander Resource Group, the Latino Resource Group, and Red Cross PRIDE, to the Umoja African American Resource Group, our Veterans+ Resource Group, and the Women’s Resource Group, these networks provide connections, mentoring and help give voice to important concerns and opinions.

At the American Red Cross, your uniqueness can shine! 

The American Red Cross is currently seeking a Community Disaster Risk Reduction Manager for Lake County, Indiana.

What You Need To Know

Join the American Red Cross in tackling the urgent climate crisis on the front lines!

Our humanitarian network is making a vital difference for families and communities worldwide, and our new Community Adaptation Program aims to build a resilient network of community-based partners and workers who can enhance emergency services, food security, and shelter in the face of climate emergencies. By joining us, you can help reduce the impact of climate change on families at greater risk and support their transition to safe, stable, and affordable housing.

As our Lake County Community Disaster Risk Reduction Manager, you'll play a crucial role in overseeing and building our community partner network and workforce in support of this program. You'll work closely with our National Headquarters Disaster Risk Reduction Director, developing and managing a team, building partner relationships, and managing budgets to achieve program outcomes. We're looking for someone with a proven track record in social services, partner collaboration, and community outreach, as well as experience in grant administration, disaster risk reduction, and building volunteer teams. Don't miss this excellent career opportunity to make a real impact and help those in need!

Learn more about the Community Adaptation Program at this link: https://arcg.is/108uui

This position does not have to reside in Lake County, however, must be within driving distance. The Disaster Risk Reduction Manager will be expected to work within Lake County the majority of the work week. 

Where Your Career Is a Force Good

Field management of Community Adaptation program in Lake County, including workforce management, budget development, and accomplishment of mission objectives.
Overseeing community needs assessments to identify vulnerable populations and their resilience needs in health, food security, and housing.
Integrating partnerships into planning, readiness, response, and recovery activities with American Red Cross divisional and regional staff.
Identifying and building positive relationships with local partner organizations, community-based organizations, and key stakeholders.
Leading implementation of Community Adaptation initiatives and convening partner support networks to enhance support for vulnerable populations.
Supporting grant management through oversight of grant requirements and data reporting.
Leading the development and management of internal and external communications strategy.
Collaborating with internal teams to meet program objectives, determine areas of opportunity for existing workforce base, and supporting region and stakeholder communities during disaster relief response.

What You Need To Succeed

Education: Bachelor’s degree required, preferably in Education, Social Work or Public Health.
Experience: Minimum 5 years of related experience, preferably in an outcomes-based social services/community organizing environment, or equivalent combination of education and related experience required.
Management Experience: 3 years of supervisory or management experience. Experience in community mobilization and disaster recovery preferred. Experience building and supporting a volunteer workforce preferable. Demonstrated familiarity with climate adaptation/resilience strategies and community organizing preferred.
Skills and Abilities: Develop strategies to achieve organizational goals. Demonstrate analytical and decision-making skills to develop creative processes for continuous program or service improvements. Ability to manage multiple priorities with strong skills in planning and problem-solving. Ability to relate well and effectively with diverse groups and individuals. Proficiency with MS Office software, including Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Outlook. Familiarity with federal, state and local employment laws. Flexibility and ability to work on and manage a new team during program development. Familiarity with government disaster assistance programs desirable. Spanish speaking preferred.
Location: Given trust and social capital requisite to successful community resilience networks, the position would require residence in or physically near Lee County.
Other: This position is also responsible for ensuring that all American Red Cross finance policies and procedures are followed as related to the scope of work activity. Upon employment, must be able to learn and become proficient in: ARC programs and procedures, Volunteer Management, Financial Management, Cultural Competency, and Community & Government Partnerships.
Travel: Travel required. Must have a current, valid driver's license.

What Will Give You The Competitive Edge

 Bilingual English/Spanish language skills

Physical Requirements: The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. While performing the duties of this Job, the employee is regularly required to sit; use hands to handle or feel; and talk or hear. The employee is frequently required to reach with hands and arms. The employee is occasionally required to stand; walk and stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl. The employee must frequently lift and/or move up to 15 pounds and occasionally lift and/or move up to 30 pounds. The work environment will consist of moderate noise (i.e. business office with computers, phones and printers, light traffic). The employee must have the ability to work in a small cubicle and have the ability to sit at a computer terminal for an extended period of time.

Benefits For You

We take care of you, while you take care of others. As a mission-based organization, we believe our team needs great support to do great work. Our comprehensive benefits help you in balancing home and work. With our resources and perks, you have amazing possibilities at the American Red Cross to advance the learn.

 Medical, Dental Vision plans
 Health Spending Accounts & Flexible Spending Accounts
 PTO + Holidays
 401K with 4% match
 Paid Family Leave
 Employee Assistance Program
 Disability and Insurance: Short + Long Term
 Service Awards and recognition

Apply now! Joining our team will provide you with the opportunity to make a difference every day.

The American Red Cross is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religion, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, age, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Interested in Volunteering?

Life’s emergencies don’t stop, and neither do American Red Cross volunteers, who represent more than 90 percent of our workforce to help prevent and alleviate human suffering. You can make a difference by volunteering in a position that appeals to you and allows you to use your unique skills and talents. The Red Cross relies on generous volunteers who give their time and talent to help fulfill our lifesaving mission.

Visit redcross.org/volunteertoday to learn more, including our most-needed volunteer positions.

About the job
Chief Compliance Officer - Folger Nolan Fleming Douglas Incorporated and 
Folger Nolan Fleming Douglas Capital Management, Inc.
Location: Washington D.C.
Folger Nolan Fleming Douglas Incorporated (“FNFD”) is a privately owned, full-service dually registered broker-dealer and investment advisor headquartered in Washington, D.C. with branches in Hunt Valley, MD and Cambridge, MD. Folger Nolan Fleming Douglas Capital Management, Inc. (“CMI”) is a separately registered investment adviser and subsidiary of FNFD. FNFD and CMI are referred to below as “the entities.” FNFD is Washington’s oldest investment firm, with over a century of financial expertise, focused on helping clients build and manage wealth. FNFD has maintained its independence since its founding, with roots in Washington dating back to 1889. CMI was formed in 1977. The independence of FNFD has allowed it to stay true to its core mission of providing quality investment services to its clients. 
Position Summary:
The Chief Compliance Officer (“CCO”) is responsible for ensuring that both the entities have appropriate systems and procedures in place to comply with all applicable federal, self-regulatory, and state laws, rules and regulations, and high ethical standards. The CCO will work closely with senior management of both entities to develop and implement policies, procedures, and systems to ensure that both entities operate within regulatory requirements.
Primary Responsibilities:
Conduct regular risk assessments and perform ongoing monitoring to identify and address potential compliance risks.
Maintain up-to-date knowledge of industry trends, regulatory developments, and best practices in compliance.
Develop and implement policies and procedures as required relating to compliance with all applicable state, federal, and self-regulatory rules and regulations.
Act as AML Compliance Officer
Maintain and update the investment advisors’ and broker-dealer’s compliance manuals and related documents, including Forms ADV, CRS, BD, and other regulatory filings.
Work with senior management to develop and implement programs and processes to detect and prevent non-compliant and fraudulent activities. 
Provide training and guidance to personnel on compliance-related issues.
Act as a primary point of contact for all regulatory examinations, audits, and inquiries.
Act as a liaison between the entities and regulatory bodies.
Manage registration of entity and personnel. 
Responsible for managing and assist in maintaining required books and records.
Be present in the FNFD office several days each week or as otherwise directed by the entities’ management.
Perform other duties as assigned.
Qualifications:
·           Educational background: a Bachelor’s degree is required; a Juris Doctor degree and/or Master’s degree in finance is a plus.
·           Holds (or will promptly obtain) all required licenses for the position, including the Series 4, 14, 24, 53 and 65 and all prerequisites thereto. 
·        Extensive knowledge of broker-dealer and registered investment adviser laws, rules and regulations, including but not limited to MSRB, FINRA, state and SEC rules and regulations.
Seven to ten years of experience in the securities industry or with a securities regulator, preferably with the compliance/legal department of a broker-dealer and investment adviser or a relevant division of a securities regulator. 
Practice of keeping up with the evolution of MSRB rules, FINRA rules, relevant state rules, and SEC rules and regulations relevant to the entities’ business by, among other practices, regularly reviewing applicable FINRA Regulatory Notices and SEC B-D and IA Releases.
The ability to synthesize new rules applicable to the entities’ business and make timely adjustments to the entities’ policies and procedures, as applicable. 
Forward-thinking – able to anticipate areas of regulatory concern and take steps to address such concerns in advance of regulatory examinations.
Ability to conduct supervisory systems reviews in anticipation of/preparation for regulatory examinations and/or annual compliance certifications and annual compliance reports.
Knowledge of regulatory hot topics and examination priorities.
Knowledge of and experience with state regulators and other regulatory inquiries and investigations.
Proficient with Excel, Adobe and Microsoft Office suite of products, and with compliance management and surveillance software. Familiarity with NetX360 a plus.
Organized and detail-oriented with the ability to manage and make timely filings as required.
Ability to maintain the highest level of confidentiality and integrity.
Ability to develop and communicate a strong culture of compliance.
Ability to create, communicate and implement and otherwise manage effective supervisory policies and procedures.
Ability to work with persons at all levels within the entities – from senior managers to representatives to back office personnel, and within sales management, operations and IT department.
Ability to act independently and collaboratively to achieve desired results and outcomes.
Knowledge and understanding of, and ability to analyze, available third-party software and services that could be beneficial to the entities.
Ability to understand and analyze industry technology trends, the software and data that results from its use, and how this can benefit and impact the entities and their regulatory compliance. Software and data include, but are not limited to, Smarsh email and electronic communications archival, and supervision of electronic communications such as text messages and What-App.
Contacts at other firms and/or in industry groups (such as SIFMA-CL, NSCP, et al.) to receive and provide input on: (i) compliance and regulatory issues facing B-D’s and IA’s; (ii) how other firms have handled exam or other regulatory encounters; and (iii) developing regulatory issues/ trends.
Ability to communicate with and train colleagues re: current and changed laws, rules, regulations and the entities’ policies and the importance of complying with the same.
Ability and willingness to seek assistance from the entities’ management, compliance consultants, and/or outside counsel when needed, including but not limited to areas in which there is any doubt or unfamiliarity.
Note: This job description is intended to be a general representation of the duties and responsibilities of the CCO. Other duties may be assigned as needed.
Working Location: The position is based in the entities’ downtown Washington D.C. headquarters. We expect the successful candidate to be physically present in the entities’ offices several days each week or as otherwise directed by the entities’ management.
Clean background check and execution of confidential and non-disclosure agreement required for employment.
Email resume to pard@donovanrainie.com

About the job
Position Overview:
The Risk Manager plays a vital role in the metal recycling industry by overseeing the company's risk management and insurance programs. This position is responsible for supporting and negotiating annual insurance program renewals, identifying and quantifying risk exposures, advising management on appropriate insurance levels, managing insurance claims, and implementing risk mitigation strategies. The Risk Manager will collaborate with various stakeholders to ensure effective risk management practices throughout the organization.

Job Responsibilities:

Insurance Program Management:
Support and negotiate annual insurance program renewals and coverages for the company's entities.
Provide timely and accurate information to brokers and underwriters to facilitate insurance quotations and ensure the timely filing of renewal documentation.
Present renewal results and coverage highlights to the Audit Committee of the Board of Directors annually.

Risk Exposure Identification and Quantification:
Develop and monitor systems to identify and quantify risk exposures across the organization.
Advise management on potential risk exposures and propose appropriate levels of insurance coverage.

Insurance Claims Management:
Oversee all insurance claims and act as the primary corporate liaison for company-wide claims.
Provide timely notification to insurance carriers, third-party administrators (TPA), and senior management.
Evaluate claims in collaboration with the TPA and outside counsel to determine effective mitigation plans.
Maintain a complete listing and evaluate the status of all claims, including those managed by TPAs.
Conduct quarterly claim reviews with in-house claims coordinator, HR personnel, and TPA claims adjusters.

Risk Assessment and Mitigation:
Support ongoing risk assessment, monitoring, and mitigation efforts.
Serve as a resource across departments for risk transfer questions and developing solutions.
Collaborate with the Vice President of Safety to implement strategies and controls to mitigate potential injuries or property damage.
Set risk transfer guidelines for outside contractors, motor carriers, and transportation brokers.

Contract Review and Compliance:
Review contracts from multiple departments to ensure proper risk transfers are in place for outside contractors.
Develop and implement an outside contractor qualification process, maintaining an updated repository of associated data.
Review certificate of insurance requests and issue them to various departments and third parties.

Reporting and Communication:
Support the general ledger close process by reviewing month-end claim reporting and ensuring accuracy of insurance expense and reserve accounts.
Participate in acquisition due diligence by reviewing insurance-related data of potential targets.
Monitor service of suits received through the company's registered agent and ensure timely forwarding to the appropriate parties.

Requirements:
BSBA in Business Administration, Accounting, Finance, or Risk Management. Certified Risk Management Professional (CRMP) designation and/or MBA is a plus.
Exposure to working in or with operations-focused industrial manufacturing businesses is preferred.
Minimum of 5 years of experience in insurance and/or risk management. Corporate risk management/insurance experience is preferred.
Professional, tactful, diplomatic, and convincing with strong oral and written communication skills.
High energy, self-starter, with a hands-on work ethic and a desire to learn and grow.
Willingness to occasionally travel domestically.

Benefits:
Health, medical, dental, and vision insurance
401(k) match
Short-term and long-term disability coverage
Great company culture

About the job
Air Products, a fortune 500 industrial gas company, is hiring an Export Compliance Specialist located at our Allentown headquarters! At Air Products, our purpose is to bring people together to reimagine what’s possible, collaborate and innovate solutions to the world’s most significant energy and environmental sustainability challenges. Reimagine What’s Possible As a member of the Classification and Controls team the primary responsibility of this role will be as a classifier of imported and exported goods. About the job
The Senior AML Monitoring Analyst analyzes account transactions for unusual, out of pattern or suspicious activity. The Senior AML Monitoring Analyst will typically be assigned alerts generated from rules that are more complex and/or higher risk for financial crime. Responsibilities include understanding of all transaction monitoring rules underlying AML typologies and then reviewing and analyzing transaction alerts to assess whether the alerted activity is consistent with customer expectations and/or nature of the business and then appropriately disposition as non-suspicious or escalate the alert to case for further investigation. The Senior AML Monitoring Analyst will also review and disposition Watchlist Monitoring alerts for escalation and reporting, including OFAC, 314(a) and PEP alerts. May also be required to complete and file Currency Transaction Reports, as well other required monitoring and recordkeeping and reporting including but not limited to, monetary instrument reporting and AML System validation. Recommends course of action to management based on an analysis of the findings and documents the analysis in the Bank’s case management system. Supports the company’s compliance efforts with the Banking Security Act (BSA).

Responsibilities
Review and analyze assigned automated transaction alerts produced from the bank’s AML monitoring system. Conducts sufficient analysis of the customer patterns and activities in order to Provide clear written statement supporting disposition decision and documentation within the AML software.
Meet productivity and quality expectations.
Reviews assigned watchlist filtering alerts and assesses the probability of actual customer matches using various investigative tools and research.
Review bi-weekly FinCEN 314(a) alerts, as well as any special 314(a) postings by FinCEN. Review and research all applicable Watch List Alerts, document findings, notify management of any positive matches, and report to FinCEN as required.
Performs OFAC research to determine if alert is a true match or false positive. Ensures any true matches to any of the Bank’s screening lists are appropriately escalated to the BSA Officer for further action (e.g., blocking, freezing, reporting to OFAC, etc.) As assigned, may act as liaison with OFAC as needed for guidance or instructions for handling potential OFAC matches.
Reviews PEP watchlist alerts and performs research to document findings and notify management of true positive matches to ensure compliance with the Bank’s PEP Policy and procedure.
Following established procedures and using system reports, reviews cash transaction for potential Currency Transaction Reporting (CTR). Responsible for preparing and filing CTRs, ensuring transactions are appropriately aggregated and reported to FinCEN.
Identify customers that may qualify for CTR exemption.
Performs data validation checks from established reports to ensure data from the core system is properly ingested into the AML software. Notifies management should any unanticipated discrepancies in the data be noted on reports.
Manually enters data that is not captured electronically, may include making necessary corrections to data in the AML software, when necessary.
Reviews Monetary Instrument Log (MIL) information entered by the branches via Horizon and communicates with branches to accurately complete the log, as needed.
Review and document other monitoring reports as needed.
Maintains a deep and thorough understanding of money laundering and financial crime typologies/red flags and terrorist financing typologies and red flags as well as a thorough understanding of various predicate offenses to money laundering and is able to apply those concepts to the analysis of customer transaction activity and behavior to identify activity consistent with the typologies.
Is able to assist in providing training and guidance on money laundering and financial crime typologies and the recognition of unusual activity that may be associated with money laundering, financial crime and terrorist financing
Maintains a thorough understanding of the BSA/AML suspicious activity detection requirements, USA PATRIOT Information Sharing 314(a)(b), and OFAC Sanctions compliance requirements. Has appropriate understanding to know when to escalate cases to the AML Monitoring and Operations Manager, Director of BSA Operations or Chief BSA Officer as appropriate.
Keeps management apprised of issues or emerging risks.
Cross-trains with management to enhance skills. May provide guidance or training to lower level AML Investigators
Identifies efficiencies or process enhancements and assists management with updates to BSA/AML & OFAC procedures, as assigned.
Participates in ongoing training to maintain current knowledge of BSA/AML and OFAC new and emerging money laundering and financial crime typologies and risks as well as regulatory requirements.
Keeps abreast of Bank policy, procedure, systems, products and services. Monitors industry trends relative to money laundering or fraud schemes including detection and reporting of suspicious activity
Qualifications
4+ years banking experience required
3+ years BSA experience required
Certified Anti-Money Laundering Specialist (CAMS) or equivalent current professional certification(s) preferred.
A reasonable, good faith estimate of the minimum and maximum base salary or pay for this position is $28.29/hr to 42.44/hr. Actual compensation will vary based on various factors including but not limited to location, experience, and performance. A discretionary bonus and/or business line incentive may be provided, in addition to a medical and other benefits, dependent on the position. For more information regarding our benefits, please visit https://www.ppbi.com/careers.html

Job Description

Wanco is seeking a Quality Compliance Specialist with technical writing capabilities to support the creation, development, implementation and maintenance of an ISO 9001:2015 compliant Quality Management System (QMS).

 Writing QMS procedures for ALL elements of ISO 9001: 2015 standard
 Auditing all functional areas to the requirements of the standard, and or have audit or lead auditor certification. 
 Maintaining company wide compliance to ISO and other applicable standards.

The Quality Compliance Specialist will be responsible for identifying areas of concern and improvement in relation to ISO 9001:2015 compliance, technical writing and document control, conducting and documenting audits and associated CAPA and ensuring overall compliance with standard while moving the company towards ISO 9001:2015 certification.

 Help lead the development, implementation and maintenance of the ISO 9001 Quality Management System in the organization.

 Collaborate with cross-functional teams to develop action plans and provide recommendations for standardization within the departments. 
 Monitor the effectiveness of audit-response corrective action plans and verify that corrective actions have been effectively implemented. 
 Train employees on the requirements and principles of ISO 9001 to ensure compliance throughout the organization. 
 Assist in developing and maintaining an ISO 9001 compliant training program. 
 Prepare and maintain ISO 9001 documentation and records. 
 Manage ISO 9001 certification process and ensure it is maintained once certification is obtained. 
 Continually assess the effectiveness of the ISO 9001 QMS and suggest and implement improvements. 

Qualifications:

 At least 3 years of experience working within an ISO 9001 compliant quality management system. 
 Advanced knowledge of ISO 9001 quality management systems, quality control procedures and auditing principles. 
 Experience developing written processes and procedures within an ISO 9001 compliant Quality Management System
 Self-starter with a proactive approach to work efforts and problem solving. 
 Experienced in project management and planning. 
 Strong analytical skills and the ability to recommend solutions and implement improvements. 
 Excellent verbal and written communication skills and the ability to work collaboratively with all levels of the organization. 
 Strong attention to detail. 
 Demonstrated ability to manage multiple tasks and priorities simultaneously. Strong organizational skills are a must. 

Additional Attributes:

 Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Business or related field preferred, or equivalent experience. 
 Process mapping experience preferred. 
 A career-minded individual looking to become an integral part of a growing organization and who is passionate about learning new things. 
 Experience in manufacturing or related industries. 
 Experience in implementing or operating a Quality Management System in a small business. 
 Certification as an ISO 9001 auditor, or other related certification, is highly desirable. 
 Experience with Lean manufacturing and continuous improvement principles (5S, Kanban, etc.)
 Experience working as an ISO 9001 (or other ISO standard) consultant or auditor. 

Physical Requirements:

 Mobility to work in a standard office setting and to use standard office equipment, including a computer. 
 Comfortable working indirectly in a manufacturing facility and adhering to PPE requirements. 
 Some travel may be required (<10%). 

If you are a motivated self-starter who is passionate about quality management and continuous improvement is manufacturing processes, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity.

Benefits: Insurance (Medical, Dental, Life, 401k). Paid time off and holidays.
