Job Description

The Compliance Officer, under direction, assists in oversight of the System Member Compliance Program, monitors and facilitates compliance with federal, state, and Texas A&M University System (TAMUS) regulatory and governing standards, including but not limited to laws, regulations, statutes, codes, policies, procedures, rules, and directives, as well as compliance own internal and external policies and procedures.; Work hours: Mon-Fri; 8 AM-5 PM or as work requirements indicate. Must be able to work remotely as requested by the university.

Responsibilities: -30% Assists Institutional Bio-safety and Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee Chairpersons with the development and coordination of a comprehensive research compliance program which aligns with policies, regulations, rules, and procedures of the Texas A&M University System and federal regulatory agencies. -15% Schedules, staffs, coordinates, attends, contributes to, and documents the proceedings of Institutional Bio-safety and Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee and other research compliance related meetings. -15% Implements and manages Occupational Health and Safety training and certification for faculty, staff and students involved in animal research. -10% Updates WEB content relating to research compliance to reflect changes in institutional programming, operations, System, or federal regulations. -10% Reviews research compliance efforts, activities, procedures, and processes to identify and report areas of compliance that are not in alignment with policies and regulations, revises institutional SAP's and Rules, researches compliance manuals, and other guiding documents as needed. Conducts, documents, and reports internal research compliance assessments, inspections, and audits. -10% Develops and delivers research compliance training programs for faculty, staff, and students. -5% Manages MAESTRO pre- and post-award research compliance tasks and workflows. -5% Performs other duties as assigned as outlined in the Tarleton State University Faculty and Administrative Staff Handbook or as assigned by supervisors in the chain of command.

Education and Experience: -Bachelors degree in applicable field or equivalent combination of education and experience. -Four years of experience in research compliance, audit, accounting, legal, or program development. Experience with lab and farm animal management, biohazards and biosafety, export control compliance and occupational health and safety.

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities: -Knowledge of word processing, spreadsheet and database applications. Strong verbal and written communication skills. -Ability to multitask and work cooperatively with others.

Preferred: Masters degree with 4 years of experience in research compliance, audit, accounting, legal, or program development and an understanding of higher education administration that includes one or more of the following: research with human subjects, vertebrate animals, biohazards and biosafety, conflict of interests and ethics, export control, time and effort, select agents, controlled substances, radioactive materials/radiation, or intellectual property.

Commensurate with experience

About the job
Company Overview: Temu is a leading e-commerce platform that connects buyers and sellers from around the world. Our mission is to provide a secure and trusted environment for conducting online transactions. To support our commitment to maintaining the highest standards of regulatory compliance, we are seeking a dedicated Compliance Officer to oversee various compliance functions relating primarily to Temu’s payment and settlement functions.

Position Overview: As a Compliance Officer at Temu, you will play a critical role in ensuring that our e-commerce platform adheres to all relevant regulatory requirements. You will be responsible for developing, implementing, and maintaining effective compliance programs, policies, and procedures. Additionally, you will monitor transactions, investigate suspicious activities, and provide guidance to internal teams on compliance matters. 

Responsibilities:
Develop, implement, and maintain compliance policies and procedures relating to Temu’s financial operations, including anti-money laundering (AML) and money transmission, ensuring adherence to applicable licensing requirements and reporting obligations.
Monitor developments in relevant laws and regulations, assess their impact on the company, and recommend necessary adjustments as necessary.
Conduct internal audits and assessments to monitor compliance and identify areas for improvement.
Serve as a point of contact for regulatory authorities and auditors, ensuring timely and accurate responses to inquiries and requests for information.
Provide guidance, training, and support to employees on regulatory compliance matters, including AML awareness, policies, and reporting obligations.
Conduct risk assessments to identify areas of vulnerability and implement appropriate risk mitigation strategies.
Collaborate with internal teams, such as Legal, Finance, and Payments, to ensure compliance requirements are integrated into business processes and systems.
Foster a culture of compliance within the organization by promoting awareness, accountability, and ethical behavior.

Requirements:
Bachelor's degree in a relevant field. Advanced degree or relevant certifications preferred (e.g., Certified Anti-Money Laundering Specialist - CAMS).
Proven experience in a compliance role at a financial institution or in e-commerce, preferably with a focus on AML compliance.
In-depth knowledge of relevant laws, regulations, and industry standards.
Strong analytical skills with the ability to identify compliance risks, conduct investigations, and propose effective solutions.
Familiarity with e-commerce payment systems and practices.
Ability to communicate complex compliance concepts effectively to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Strong attention to detail and organizational skills to manage multiple priorities and meet deadlines.
Proactive mindset with the ability to work independently and collaboratively in a dynamic and fast-paced environment.
Ethical and professional conduct with a commitment to maintaining confidentiality and integrity.

About the job
A large, national banking partner of ours is looking to add a Sr. Compliance Officer to their growing team. This person will report to the Governance and Program Management Compliance Manager and focus their effort on assisting the Compliance Manager and Chief Compliance Officer with compliance in the development, implementation, enhancement, maintenance, and support of the Bank’s corporate and regulatory compliance programs, including the Compliance Management System (CMS). Responsible activities for this position include second line of defense expertise, oversight, guidance and advice on the Bank’s overall CMS program, policy, procedures, risk assessments, and other risk mitigation activities.

As a Sr. Compliance Officer, you will:
Perform Compliance risk assessments assessing the inherent risk, quality of risk management, and residual risk based on the regulatory environment, operating environment, products/services/processes, and distribution channels and perform Compliance risk and control self-assessment (RCSA) in line with methodology, scope, and frequency.
Develop and maintain the compliance training course inventory. This includes, but not limited to: (1) annual review of the compliance inventory and its course contents (including custom courses and any required attestations) with appropriate Subject Matter Experts (SMEs) to ensure relevant and accurate compliance training course contents and assignments are administered to appropriate employees and contractors, (2) coordinate the creation of compliance custom courses as required with appropriate SMEs and the Talent & Development Team, and (3) create an annual risk-based compliance training calendar and associated tasks and work with the Learning and Development Team to ensure required compliance training courses/ assignments are integrated within the Bank’s training schedule.
Synthesize compliance management information, identify root cause(s) of potential compliance risk, and provide trending on Department Key Risk Indicators (KRIs) to produce reporting to management committees.
Develops and maintains Compliance policies and procedures and raise issues and collaborate in the development and implementation of new compliance policies, practices, and tools.

As a Sr. Compliance Officer, you will need:
3+ years of Commercial Banking experience within regulatory compliance/risk management/audit experience with a strong focus on risks and controls and risk-based auditing techniques.
Understanding of compliance risk management practices and methodologies, including compliance risk assessment and compliance risk and control assessments.
Practical working knowledge of the components of an effective CMS program.
PREFERRED: CRCM or other relevant compliance certifications

Job Summary
This role works with the Compliance and Legal team to ensure that PharmaCann, Inc. and its
subsidiaries (collectively, “PharmaCann” or the “Company”) are compliant with all cannabis
industry laws, regulations, standards and ethical practices in the jurisdictions in which the
Company operates. The Regulatory Compliance Associate will manage and maintain
compliance priorities, including but not limited to, operational and regulatory deadlines. This
position will report to the Director of Compliance and will work with various leaders at different
levels within the Company. The ideal candidate will possess outstanding organizational skills,
strong attention to detail, and a proven ability to effectively manage multiple priorities in an
exciting, fast-paced and evolving industry. This role is based out of Chicago, IL with intermittent
travel to PharmaCann’s facilities in Colorado, Maryland, Massachusetts, Michigan, New York,
Ohio, and Pennsylvania.

Duties and Responsibilities 
● Assists the Compliance and Legal team to ensure compliance with all applicable state,
county and municipal laws, ordinances and regulations, including the specific cannabis
regulations for that state and applicable municipalities.
● Reviews and interprets state regulations and assists the Director of Compliance in
responding to internal and external inquiries.
● Serves as subject matter expert on current and prospective state cannabis regulations
and provides compliance advice to Company leaders.
● Assists the Compliance team’s licensing group in preparing and reviewing applicable
application materials for new markets, license renewals, facility modifications, and facility
relocations submitted to state and local cannabis agencies.
● Works with key members of PharmaCann’s Operational team and Real Estate and
Facilities team to draft variance requests and operational deadline extension requests.
● Prepares and submits documentation required for regulatory inspections and
coordinates the inspection process for internal departments and state regulators.
● Uses independent judgment and knowledge of applicable state regulations to provide
regulatory analyses to the Compliance and Legal team.
● Assists with the review and creation of Standard Operating Procedures, Operations and
Management Plans and Security Plans as needed.
● Assists with review of marketing collateral, promotions, and cannabis product packaging
and labeling to ensure compliance with state regulations.
● Works with the Director of Compliance to investigate and resolve compliance concerns,
issues, or violations.
● Prepare and submit responses and corrective action plans to regulatory agencies as
applicable.
● Keeps informed of emerging cannabis regulatory issues, trends, and other developments
which could impact PharmaCann operations.
● Reviews and summarizes new cannabis regulations and guidance from applicable state
and local agencies.
● Communicates with state regulators and inspectors as needed.
● Assists with implementing PharmaCann’s policies, procedures, and best practices to
promote compliance.
● Travels periodically among the Company’s multi-state cultivation and dispensary
operations.

Education and Experience
● Juris Doctorate Degree from an ABA accredited school preferred.
● Minimum of 2-4 years of compliance experience, ideally in the regulated cannabis
industry or another regulated industry, such as pharmaceutical, alcohol, gaming,
agriculture, food, hemp, or tobacco.
● Law firm and/or regulatory experience is preferred.
● Strong working knowledge of the cannabis industry is preferred.

Qualifications
● Understanding of the regulatory environment and rules and regulations applicable to the
cannabis industry or other applicable regulated industries such as pharmaceutical,
healthcare, alcohol, gaming, agriculture, tobacco, food, or hemp producers.
● Experience with performing regulatory analysis across multiple jurisdictions.
● Strong analytical skills, including demonstrated experience identifying and quantifying
complex problems and providing effective resolutions.
● Self-starter, innovative, proactive.
● Detail oriented, excellent judgment and time management with ability to manage multiple
projects and set priorities.
● Able to communicate in a professional manner both internally and with regulators.
● Ability to work autonomously as well as within a team environment.
● Performs well under pressure on multiple tasks concurrently and meets deadlines in a
fast-paced work environment.
● Ability to adapt quickly to changing priorities and willingness to handle a variety of tasks
across a broad range of substantive areas and jurisdictions and to learn new areas
quickly.
● Motivated by making a positive impact on the business and the cannabis industry.
● Support company policies, goals, and core values.
● Strong integrity and demonstrate ethical behavior at all times.
● Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
● Strong research and organizational skills.
● Willing and able to travel to support the states of Colorado, Maryland, Massachusetts,
Michigan, New York, Ohio, and Pennsylvania and conduct business at PharmaCann’s
headquarters in Chicago, Illinois.

Most importantly, the desire to have an opportunity to make a positive impact as part of a
fast-growing leader in the cannabis industry by shaping regulatory compliance functions
spanning across all levels of a sophisticated cannabis company as well as the opportunity to
work with smart, driven people who value fun, service, integrity, and respect.

About the job
At SanMar, the work you do makes a difference.

What's the Short Version?

The Compliance Specialist, Product contributes to SanMar's success by supporting our rigorous product safety testing program. This position works cross-functionally with internal departments, our international suppliers and SanMar's testing service provider. They ensure accurate data entry and verify completeness of test reports during review.

What Will You Be Doing?

Execute day-to-day tasks related to SanMar’s product safety program, including enhanced product safety testing program.
Review and determine if internal and supplier-based product safety test reports meet applicable requirements and company policies.
Communicate with internal teams, suppliers and the testing service provider to finalize test reports.
Input and maintain data from various sources into company’s product compliance databases accurately and timely.
Maintain all records pertaining to product safety in accordance with federal regulations and company policies.
Support the Compliance team on new market expansion and regulatory research.

What Are We Looking For?

Associate's Degree Preferred.
4-6 years of related experience supporting a compliance team and reviewing quality test results.
Computer skills; proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite, report generation and internet research.
Fast learner with the ability to balance multiple priorities and meet deadlines.
Must be able to handle, process and enter large amounts of data efficiently and accurately.
Detail oriented with excellent analytical and organizational skills.
Ethical dedication to keeping organizational practices and sensitive information confidential.
Ability to follow through on assignments with minimal direction.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Ability to work independently as well as collaboratively.
Proven team player that maintains a positive attitude at all times.

What's Our Offer? 

Salary Range: You`ll earn between $24.50 - $33.65 on an hourly basis, depending on experience.

Bonus: You`ll be eligible for an annual discretionary bonus up to $2,000.

Paid Time Off: You`ll accrue paid time off on a weekly basis based on hours worked up to 112 hours per year to start. Employees also receive 7 paid holidays and 1 paid family day off.

Additional Benefits:

Comprehensive medical, dental, and vision benefits
401k plan and matches $1 for $1 up to 4% of earnings, matched & vested at every pay cycle
Life insurance
Short/long-term disability coverage
Paid maternity/paternity leave
Pet insurance

What Should You Expect?

Hybrid: While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to sit; reach with hands and arms and talk or hear. The employee is frequently required to use hands to finger, handle or feel. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception and ability to adjust focus. Work environment is moderately quiet. Ability to work on computer for multiple hours with frequent interruptions.

SanMar's Eastpointe office is located near Seattle, WA and our standard working hours are 8:00-5:00 PST. Quarterly travel may be required.

Who is SanMar?

SanMar is more than just a t-shirt company.

We see t-shirts as a blank canvas that can be used to unite a team, tell a story or show your love for your favorite local haunt. We create meaningful connections that elevate lives through the apparel we provide.

As the industry leader in promotional apparel, we live by a refreshingly simple philosophy: Be Nice and Tell the Truth. This is how we’ve done business since Marty Lott founded the company in 1971. Today we work with apparel manufacturers from around the world, we’ve grown to more than 5,000 employees and we still work with those same simple principles in mind.

You can see our values take shape in A Canvas for Good, our platform for positive action and citizenship. We are dedicated to being good stewards of the world we share, to lifting up the communities where we work and to respecting our employees. Our IDEA Council guides company-wide diversity efforts, and our annual Sustainability Report shows our progress toward our goals of doing business responsibly.

Why Work at SanMar?

Our people are at the heart of everything we do. They bring their talent, passion and dedication to work with them every day. Their hard work inspires us and gives us purpose. We love working here together.

Whether you work in our headquarters, from your home or in one of our distribution centers across North America, we believe that investing in you is just the right thing to do. Our comprehensive benefits package is designed to support your health and well-being, life balance, career growth and (eventually) retirement.

SanMar works with brands you already know, like Nike, The North Face and Brooks Brothers, as well as providing industry-leading private label apparel and accessories. Our people come to work excited to do their part, providing clothing that helps people feel that they’re a part of something special.

Here’s your chance to be a part of this story. If you’re ready to work in a place where your participation matters and your growth is a priority, we’re ready for you.

SanMar is an Equal Opportunity Employer

Whoever you are, wherever you’re from, whomever you love or follow in faith, whatever your disability or superpower status, whichever ethnicity or gender you identify with, you are welcome at SanMar. Our team members are committed to creating an open and inclusive environment in which every employee can be successful.

SanMar participates in E-Verify.

About the job
Job Description

Group Overview:

The TP ICAP Group is a world leading provider of market infrastructure.

Our purpose is to provide clients with access to global financial and commodities markets, improving price discovery, liquidity, and distribution of data, through responsible and innovative solutions.

Through our people and technology, we connect clients to superior liquidity and data solutions.

The Group is home to a stable of premium brands. Collectively, TP ICAP is the largest interdealer broker in the world by revenue, the number one Energy & Commodities broker in the world, the world’s leading provider of OTC data, and an award winning all-to-all trading platform.

The Group operates from more than 60 offices in 27 countries. We are 5,300 people strong. We work as one to achieve our vision of being the world’s most trusted, innovative, liquidity and data solutions specialist.

Role Overview:

The Compliance function’s mission statement is to proactively engage and advise the Business so it can achieve its strategic and commercial objectives within applicable regulatory requirements and protect the Firm’s reputation.

The Compliance function has five strategic objectives: (1) proactive engagement with the Business; (2) stay ahead of the regulatory environment; (3) leverage technology solutions; (4) review and enhance policies and controls; (5) build the global Compliance function.

The AMER Compliance Associate Officer will work as a member of the Compliance Strategy & Projects Team within the Compliance function. The Team works closely with each regional Compliance Team and has responsibility for strategic Compliance priorities. This position is based in TP ICAP’s New York offices and reports to the Global Compliance Manager.

Key Stakeholders:

Compliance; Legal; Risk; HR; IT; Finance; Operations and the Business

Role Responsibilities:
Support the Global Compliance Manager with the implementation of the Global Compliance strategy, plan and projects within AMER 
Be the AMER Compliance FCO (Function Control Owner) for the ERMF (Enterprise Risk Management Framework) which involves being the key regional Compliance lead for risk management processes and activities, MI (management information) gathering and monitoring of any Compliance Risk Events and Issues/Actions
As the FCO, work with the AMER Compliance Team in the resolution of risk events and issues/actions relating to Compliance risks. This may include Internal Audit actions and mitigating high priority Compliance risks and providing Compliance input to ensure risks and issues are resolved within specified timescales and with the appropriate remedial action
Analyse Compliance MI and other Compliance reporting information for regional and global Committees and compile papers and reports ensuring consistency and clarity of message. Liaise with key stakeholders including Compliance, the Business and Risk to collate and analyse information
Support the second line review of the Businesses activities to manage Compliance risks, and ensure adherence to compliance controls. Oversee and guide the Business as required to manage effective compliance across various components of the US compliance programme, for example training completion, supervisory processes/checklists, implementation and embedding of policies and procedures and records and retention 
Participate in key projects, for example for the implementation of new regulation or significant organisational change projects to provide input on Compliance risks and ensure an effective compliance control framework is maintained
Identify any resources, process and capability gaps with the AMER Compliance team and help the Global Compliance Manager and AMER Head of Compliance to formulate appropriate remedial approaches
Where required, support the Global Compliance Manager with any activities related to Global Compliance Strategy across AMER, EMEA and APAC (e.g., support QA of Controls Attestations and MI across the regions)
Fulfil additional/ad hoc duties as required to meet the needs of the business

This is a great role for someone that is strategic orientated, highly motivated, confident individual who is looking to develop their career in a compliance function.

Experience / Competencies: 
The ability to analyse information and form judgements about compliance risks in the context of the regulatory and business environment;
The ability to influence staff at all levels in driving consensus and adopting new initiatives, processes or procedures and to deliver successful outcomes
Ability to work with stakeholders to generate ideas and implement agreed vision and strategies;
Excellent planning and execution skills, attention to detail and problem-solving skills
Clear and concise verbal, written and presented communications
Mange tasks with effective structure and organisation skills and ownership to deliver high quality results 
Ability to pragmatically assess business problems to identify proportionate solutions
Understanding of Wholesale Financial Markets and applicable US regulations
Experience of a Compliance Function and Compliance risks and processes
Understanding of risk-based approaches and assessments as well as control design and implementation in Risk and Compliance
Experience of an inter-dealer broking business is preferred.

Company Statement:

The TP ICAP Group is committed to promoting Equality and Diversity and encouraging a culture that actively values difference. It is recognised that employees from different backgrounds and experiences can bring valuable insights to the work environment and enhance the way we work. TP ICAP aims to create a positive, cohesive and inclusive culture, where diversity is valued, respected and built upon. The objective is to recruit and retain a diverse workforce that reflects the global markets in which we work.

TP ICAP is also committed to ensuring that the backgrounds, beliefs and cultures of all its employees are respected and to ensuring that the working environment is free from discrimination, harassment, bullying or any other conduct which causes an employee’s suffering. The Group also is committed to encouraging diversity amongst its current workforce and candidates.

$$105,000k-$120,000k

Location

USA - 200 Vesey Street - New York, NY

About the job
Seneca Savings Bank is committed to serving our community and customers, which is our driving force inspiring innovation of new products and services. A healthy balance between technology and customer service, high empathy for our clients, employees and partners helps us stand apart from the ever-growing financial options for today’s consumers. No one else has the incredibly talented and customer-centric team of resourceful people that Seneca Savings has. Our leadership team collaborates well across all divisions.

Job Summary:

The Compliance Officer manages a comprehensive Compliance Audit Program monitoring all operational processes and procedures to ensure personnel are complying with appropriate banking consumer laws and regulations, as well as Board approved policies and procedures. This position provides appropriate training, support, and guidance as need is identified. And analyzes new and pending laws and regulations which directly affect the company’s practices to ensure compliance. Must possess knowledge of applicable federal and state consumer compliance regulations. Working onsite is required for an extended period of time while training and learning all about Seneca Savings. Hybrid work situation may be discussed after 6 months.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:

Assist in managing the Bank’s comprehensive compliance program including compliance with Community Reinvestment Act (CRA), Fair Lending, Right to Financial Privacy, Home Mortgage Disclosure Act (HMDA), Truth in Savings, Truth in Lending, Equal Credit Reporting Act, Flood Disaster Protection Act, Real Estate Settlement Procedures Act (RESPA) and Electronic Funds Transfer Act.
Perform compliance audits to determine whether established protocols are being followed and if/where they can be improved.
Remain current on state and federal banking laws. Evaluate new laws to determine their impact on Bank policy, procedures and/or practices.
Provide compliance guidance and regulatory updates to appropriate officers and functional areas when necessary. Monitor implementation of new laws and regulations.
Work with branch and department supervisors at the inception of new deposit or loan products/services to ensure Bank remains in compliance with applicable laws and regulations.
Manage the annual assignment of training via the Bank’s on-line compliance training platform for all employees.
Act as the Bank’s liaison on regulatory compliance matters during federal, state, and other outside, compliance and CRA examinations.
Establish and maintain a central advertising file for record keeping purposes. Sign-off on any marketing and advertising collateral to ensure it is compliant.
Act as a back-up to our BSA Officer, working in tandem to accomplish all BSA, AML and bank compliance requirements.
Manage and help resolve, in a timely manner, customer complaints alleging discrimination and/or disparate treatment.
Review data and loan files to assist with Bank’s Fair Lending Program.
Review information regarding outside seminars, workshops, and conferences to provide recommendation to SVP- Compliance as to appropriate personnel for attendance, and to ensure own maintenance and expansion of knowledge through these outside sources.
Perform compliance reviews and report to the Audit Committee on the results as necessary.
Required to attend or participate in necessary compliance training, including but not limited to BSA, Security, Information Technology, OFAC, Privacy and applicable BVS courses.

Qualification Requirements:

 Three or more years’ experience with risk management, regulatory compliance, banking law and/or loan documentation.
 Bachelor of Science Degree or equivalent job experience
 Excellent attention to detail, analytical and communication skills
 General understanding of banking systems
 Working knowledge of federal and state banking regulations
 Certified Regulatory Compliance Manager (CRCM) designation preferred

Seneca Savings offers a competitive starting salary dependent upon experience and closeness to matching our requirements. Excellent benefits offered include: Health, dental, vision, group-term life, long-term disability insurance available with employer participation; PTO includes holiday, vacation and sick pay; 401K w/employer match; educational and employee assistance programs.

In addition, the Compliance Officer will be responsible for ongoing execution of various “run the firm” investment management compliance routines that are aligned with the candidate’s aptitude, background, or desire for career progression.

For Example, You May

As a recently listed publicly traded company, in an ever-changing industry and regulatory environment, you can expect a consistent flow of strategic initiatives.

Develop and implement a compliance program for the oversight of external investment managers
Coordinate the development implementation of new policies, procedures, and controls in response to a new regulatory rule
Lead the Investments Compliance team’s implementation of a new standard protocol issued by the greater Corebridge Financial Compliance department

Examples Include

Ongoing responsibilities may involve compliance routines associated with the Investment Advisers Act of 1940 (“the Advisers Act”), various state insurance regulations applicable to general account investments, and various compliance routines associated with principles of sound corporate controls of a publicly traded company.

Designing and executing monitoring and testing routines
Coordinating the annual compliance risk assessment
Obtaining data from various sources to prepare regulatory filings

Portfolio investment guideline monitoring

The ideal candidate for this role understands the pillars of Compliance: Policies & Procedures, Monitoring & Testing, Advice & Guidance, Issue Remediation & Reporting, Training, and Risk Assessment, and takes ownership in the execution of each pillar with respect to the candidate’s responsibilities or areas of coverage. This role requires “getting in the weeds” and developing a deep understanding of one’s areas of coverage, as well as producing work product in form of: written reports, issue summaries, tracking logs, etc..

High degree of intellectual curiosity and willingness to self-learn through reading regulatory releases and publications, inquiring with business and process owners, and applying past experiences from similar scenarios,

Ability to confront conflict and difficult issues in a professional, assertive, collaborative and proactive manner,
7 years of experience in a compliance function with a registered investment adviser, broker-dealer, investment area of an insurance company, or similar financial services firm,

About the job
Position Title:

BSA Specialist

FLSA Status:

Non-Exempt, Full Time

Reports to:

BSA Supervisor

Summary of the Job:

Be responsible for performing ongoing reviews, research and investigations adhering to applicable Bank Secrecy Act/Anti-Money Laundering (BSA/AML) laws and regulations. The Bank Secrecy Act (BSA) Specialist will prevent money laundering at the money source and be responsible for assisting the BSA Officer with compliance monitoring reviews and other special projects to measure and understand the state of regulatory compliance for the organization. As criminal activity is suspected, the BSA Specialist will start the investigation process by creating a case file and working with the BSA Officer to further investigate the customer and their actions. This may include investigating and identifying activity for possible Suspicious Activity Report (SAR) filings; researching and determining if a SAR should be filed; ensuring all required filings, reports, reviews, and duties are completed and submitted timely; and meeting all regulatory guidelines. The BSA Specialist will provide investigative support regarding possible Suspicious Activity Report (SAR)/Currency Transaction Report (CTR). Ensure that such compliance is handled in accordance with overall bank business objectives, goals and regulatory requirements.

Essential Functions:

Responsible for ensuring all required regulatory reporting is conducted in a timely, accurate, and compliant manner, including the filing of CTRs and SARs to FinCEN.
Conduct appropriate SAR investigation, review and reporting that promotes consistent decisions; adequate investigation and research; and complete and detailed documentation.
Analyze BSA Alerts in Verafin
Analyze cases of suspicious activity received through Verafin. 
Assist employees with reported suspicious activity to ensure the bank's BSA/AML policies and procedures are followed.
Conduct 90-day investigations of recurring suspicious activity.
Assist with Elder Financial Exploitation cases.
Assist Senior BSA Specialist with in-depth case reviews and research
Assist Fraud Team with investigations that may require a SAR Filing
Stay abreast of and analyze developing industry and compliance trends, scams or schemes, and changes to laws and regulations pertaining to BSA/AML and the USA Patriot Act

Additional Functions:

Perform routine duties with minimal supervision using standard practices or procedures in order to proceed alone at routine work; occasional work progress checked; work reviewed upon completion.
Perform other duties as assigned.

Required Education/Experience:

High School Diploma or equivalent required. 
CAMS or Certification in BSA / AML preferred.
Minimum 2 years of similar or related experience in Bank Secrecy Act / Anti-Money Laundering regulations required.
Experience using Verafin software strongly preferred.
Extensive knowledge of BSA/AML regulations, CIP, Customer Due Diligence and Enhanced Due Diligence requirements, FinCEN guidance, and FDIC and other regulatory guidance related to BSA/AML/OFAC and financial crime.
Effective organizational and time management skills.
Knowledge of spreadsheet software and ability to use word processing software.
Ability to maintain confidential information with discretion.

Necessary Skills:

Ability to read and comprehend simple instructions, short correspondence, and memos.
Ability to write simple correspondence.
Ability to effectively present information in one-on-one and small group situations to customers, clients, and other employees of the organization.
Ability to add, subtract multiply and divide in all units of measure, using whole numbers, common fractions, and decimals. 
Ability to compute rate, ratio, and percent and to draw and interpret bar graphs.
Ability to apply common sense understanding to carry out instructions furnished in written, oral or diagram form. 
Ability to deal with problems involving several concrete variables in standardized situations.
Basic personal computer skills including electronic mail, word processing, spreadsheet, graphics, etc.
Handle multiple tasks simultaneously.

Physical Activity/Dexterity:

Manual dexterity sufficient to reach/handle items and work with fingers. Works with fingers and perceives attributes of objects and materials.

Physical Environment Demands:

Must be able to remain in a stationary position 90% of the time.
The person in this position needs to occasionally move about inside the office to visit other offices, conference rooms, office machinery, etc.
Constantly operates a computer and other office productivity machinery, such as a calculator, copy machine, and telephone.
Constantly positions self to operate on a computer.
The person in this position frequently communicates with other people throughout each day. Must be able to exchange accurate information when conversing. 

Working Conditions/Environment:

Well-lighted, heated and/or air-conditioned indoor office setting with adequate ventilation.
Moderate noise (e.g. business office with computers and printers, light traffic).

Work Schedule/Hours:

Monday through Friday; 8:00 a.m. – 5:00 p.m.
Available for overtime as needed.

About the job
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

The Regulatory Compliance Management (RCM) Officer will assist in the implementation and management of CIBC’s Regulatory Compliance Management Program (RCM Program). The RCM Program establishes CIBC’s firmwide approach to compliance risk oversight and assessment of compliance risk in the US Region. The RCM Officer will support the US RCM Program Manager to ensure the RCM Program is operating effectively and efficiently across various business lines, support functions, and legal entities.

Key responsibilities will include but are not limited to:

Regulatory Oversight – Support the regulatory oversight through activities such as researching and analyzing regulatory requirements.
Program Implementation – Build and maintain strong working relationships with business partners and provide support and effective challenge on the RCM Program processes, regulatory changes, risk assessments, controls and deficiencies.
Regulatory Inventory Management – Perform analysis on the regulatory inventory and data libraries to identify opportunities to enhance and strengthen the Program, including data quality in all RCM Program systems.
Training – Develop and facilitate training on methodologies, guidelines, templates and educational materials for the RCM Program, as well as job aids and other communications.
Reporting – Assist with analysis and reporting of RCM Program activities, including developing and maintaining metrics to measure regulatory compliance risk.
Strategic Initiatives – Participate as a member in RCM strategic initiatives and projects as assigned by the RCM Program Manager.

Qualifications:

5+ years’ experience in regulatory compliance, risk management, or compliance audit/testing role with a large banking or financial services organization.
Working knowledge of compliance risk assessment management or risk assessment and control methodologies.
Familiarity with Federal and state laws and regulations applicable to one or more of the following areas: banking, brokered-dealers, swap dealers, or registered investment advisors or knowledge of regulatory requirements related to enterprise regulatory compliance risk management.
Strong research, analysis, problem-solving, and decision-making skills with ability to identify risks and issues for escalation to management, as necessary.
Excellent interpersonal skills, including verbal and written communications.
Advanced Excel, Word, and PowerPoint skills.
Ability to manage workload and shift priorities to meet deadlines in a dynamic and rapidly-changing environment.

Our CIBC risk culture is based on employees striving to exceed the expectations of ourselves and our leadership’s identification and mitigation of risks in their daily responsibilities, not just in quarterly or annual monitoring/assessments. We all are accountable for managing risk.

As an employee of CIBC the incumbent must conduct themselves (and foster an environment for others) in a manner consistent with our strong risk culture. This includes:

Following all aspects of the CIBC Code of Conduct, as well as all applicable CIBC policies, frameworks, guidelines, processes and controls.
At all times acting in accordance with our Purpose and shared values, to achieve our Bank’s strategic goals.
Understanding and following the qualitative and quantitative components of our Risk Appetite Statements.
Completing all annual Corporate Mandatory Training and Testing modules, as well as any additional business-specific modules, as required and employing the learnings in daily activities and undertakings.
Escalating matters through one of the appropriate channels identified in the CIBC Code of Conduct (i.e., HR, management, Ethics Hotline, Whistleblower, etc.) upon observing activities that may be inconsistent with CIBC’s policies, frameworks, guidelines, processes and controls.
Speaking up if witnessing behaviors that drive poor or unfair outcomes for clients, team members or other stakeholders.
Escalating matters that can result in adverse market practices and outcomes, thereby negatively impacting CIBC’s reputation as a leading financial institution.

What You Need To Know

CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com

CIBC is committed to doing our part to protect our team, our clients and our communities. We want to ensure we have a safe and healthy workplace, and we want to do our part to get through this pandemic. About the job

The Product Oversight team within Merchant Services Acquiring Platform and Rails Product Team is seeking a knowledgeable process management and controls candidate to support and propel key initiatives spanning across the Product disciplines. The candidate will be responsible for leading a team and ensuring that end to end processes are appropriately documented with risk and control gaps identified, reported, and ultimately remediated. This includes ensuring that risk policy, guidelines, and risk grading methodologies are calibrated and in-synch with business and corporate standards.

The Product Oversight Manager will coordinate across various departments including Business Control Management, Risk, Compliance, Legal, Third Party Oversight, Technology, Operations and Product Management to communicate and enforce control and change management standards. The ideal person for this role is someone who possesses a strong understanding of controls, process improvement, and a blend of business and technical knowledge.

Job Responsibilities

 Lead periodic assessment of targeted Merchant Services functional processes for accuracy and timeliness regarding risk mapping for performance reporting, issue management and control assessments 
 Facilitate end to end reviews and deep dives across the business units Review processes and procedures to assess impacts or determine efficiency and effectiveness and assist in implementing new procedures when required (ability to evaluate the general risks faced and the impact of those risks on the enterprise as a whole) 
 Become an active member of the Product leadership team with the ability to work effectively and collaboratively across multiple business functions; Work with internal partners to ensure all control/compliance/risk activities are addressed during ongoing partner due diligence processes in multiple countries 
 Sustain best practice framework for defining, reviewing, and maintaining policies, procedures, and process documentation; Triage emerging issues across product landscape and ensuring proper resolution and hand offs 
 Identify and remediate control gaps; work with product managers in early identification and reporting of emerging control issues; Monitor and assess the consistency of risk management practices across our Product offering 
 Lead control related projects, including strategy creation, requirements oversight and implementation; Enable strategic initiatives by providing risk and control design expertise and navigational assistance to help connect the dots across the line of business(es); Perform walkthroughs and assist critical lines of business with process mapping and risk identification, designing the controls framework and testing the controls

 Ability to propel large initiatives spanning across multiple teams and organizations; Experience in business process analysis, documenting gaps, and creating standard operating procedures and policies

About the job
Summary

The Compliance Specialist, Assistant Compliance Officer, Compliance Officer, Senior Compliance Officer and Lead Compliance Officer are responsible for the day-to-day coordination and administration of NYPA’s Compliance Program. These positions objectively evaluate and monitor enterprise compliance issues and requirements while promoting NYPA’s and the Canal Corporation’s commitment to legal and regulatory compliance. They provide reasonable assurance of NYPA and Canals’ compliance with applicable mandatory laws, regulations and standards. The Ethics and Compliance office is a confidential resource to NYPA and Canals’ approximately 2,400 employees and interacts with executive management and staff at all levels and NYPA/Canals’ work locations. It collaborates with the Law Department and NYPA’s business units to maintain and strengthen NYPA’s compliance reputation and standing in the regulatory communities within which it operates.

Responsibilities

Assist the Senior Compliance Officer and the VP, Chief Ethics & Compliance Officer in the daily implementation of the Compliance Program, including perform analyses and research of compliance inquiries and concerns, and ensure closure of logged compliance issues.
Identify new legal and regulatory requirements in a continuously changing, complex regulatory environment. Monitor and verify compliance owners adherence to both current and newly identified requirements. Provide recommendations to the VP and Chief Ethics & Compliance Officer based on the findings.
Collaborating with the Law Department attorneys, ensure business units are aware of and understand the applicable legal and regulatory requirements specific to their areas of accountability.
Provide primary support to the Senior Compliance Officer in the organization and administration of the Legal and Regulatory Compliance Work Group (CWG). Maintain CWG membership and ensure all business units have representation and active participation in CWG. 
Participate in targeted compliance workgroups identified by the Senior Compliance Officer (e.g., Public Authority Reform, Public Authority Reporting Information System, NYS Comptroller’s Regulations).
Collaborate with Internal Audit and Enterprise Risk Management to conduct compliance reviews to verify that compliance risk mitigation activities and internal controls are in place and functioning as intended.
Support the Office of Ethics and Compliance role in the inter-business unit Risk Alignment & Controls Committee.
Develop, audit and track annual FERC Standards of Conduct and other required compliance training initiatives.
Prepare written documentation on the status of compliance initiatives, prepare and deliver presentations and coordinate compliance communications. 
With the assistance of the Law Department, respond to compliance inquiries re: FERC Standards of Conduct, FERC Anti-Market Manipulation, NERC Reliability Standards, Public Authorities Accountability Act and other legal requirements.

Knowledge, Skills And Abilities

Excellent written and oral communications skills.
Proficient skills with organization, planning, prioritization and presentation capabilities.
Ability to develop and maintain professional working relationships with internal and external stakeholders.
Skills and aptitude for use of electronic data and document management systems (e.g., Microsoft Excel, PowerPoint, SharePoint).
Experience managing data and document management, including policies/procedures, training records, report development and submissions. 
Demonstrate working knowledge with electric utility and NYS public authority legal and regulatory requirements. 
Demonstrate working knowledge of requirements for an effective compliance program and NYPA’s compliance status. 
Must demonstrate ability to interpret and communicate legal and regulatory compliance documents and requirements.
Ability to participate in regulatory audits and risk assessments.
Ability to work cooperatively with compliance owners, attorneys and facilitate achievement of Compliance goals. 

Education, Experience and Certifications

BA or BS Degree required.
Minimum five (5) years’ experience in Corporate, Legal or Regulatory Compliance positions required.
Electric Utility or Governmental experience preferred.

Physical Requirements

Approximately 20% travel within New York State to NYPA’s operating and transmission facilities and industry/professional conferences/working groups.
Valid NY State driver’s license.

Our Company

Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours!

The Opportunity 

Adobe seeks a hardworking and creative attorney to advise Adobe’s Experience Platform product, engineering, and marketing teams. Adobe Experience Platform is an open and extensible platform that helps Adobe's enterprise customers centralize and standardize customer data and content from various sources and apply data science and machine learning to improve the design and delivery of rich, personalized experiences. This position will provide legal product support to teams involved in the development and marketing stages, from concept to launch, while cross-collaborating with legal peers. The ideal candidate will be proficient in data protection laws globally, including the individual rights and business requirements of state privacy laws. This role requires an adaptability approach to keep up with emerging legal issues, changing regulations, and industry trends while bringing a high level of passion and providing timely, accurate, and well-reasoned responses to queries from internal clients. 
What you'll Do 

Support product teams as they develop and bring to market new technologies and product offerings by helping to identify and resolve privacy, IP, go-to-market, and license compliance issues. 
Build positive relationships with the Experience Platform teams, including product marketing, product management, engineering, technical operations, client care, pricing, and sales. 
Proficient in providing legal guidance to multiple levels of management. 
Collaborate with subject matter authorities in Adobe's Legal, Security, and Policy (LSP) Organization, including privacy, patent, copyright, security, and licensing attorneys, to analyze legal risks and support the business. 
Draft, supervise, and close agreements, including inbound and outbound technology licenses, product documentation, and partnership agreements. 
Lead product launch processes, including technology release checklists and questionnaires. 
Continue to learn and calibrate in this rapidly changing industry related to issues associated with identity management, targeted marketing, and associated privacy implications and serve as an internal subject matter authority in those areas. 
Anticipate client needs to facilitate creating and improving processes, forms, templates, knowledge resources and training to drive efficiency. 
What you need to succeed 

J.D. from an accredited law school and active bar membership. 
A minimum of 8+ years of relevant legal experience (e.g., software licensing, supporting clients in the cloud-based services industry, supporting product development and go to market). 
Effective interpersonal skills, both written and verbal. 
Strong drafting and negotiation skills with proficiency in transactional agreements (preferably software license agreements). 
Demonstrate strong problem-solving abilities and a willingness to think creatively. 
Proficient with and interested in global and state data regulations and privacy issues. 
Technical background or interest in software products and development. 
Dedication to providing clients with high-quality and timely legal advice. 
Validated ability to balance and prioritize opposing projects/demands. 
Desire to build an exciting career within LSP. 
Enthusiastic, hard-working, with a solid understanding of the business industry to provide legal advice in a way that supports Adobe's growth and strategic objectives while managing legal risks. 
A bias for sharing relevant information across teams, within legal, and with peers across the Digital Experience legal teams. 
A strong sense of humor!

About the job
The Compliance Officer is responsible for developing and overseeing the company compliance program and procedures to ensure the company is compliant with all State and Federal regulations and regulatory requirements. Duties include maintaining the company compliance documents, reviewing regulatory risks associated with new initiatives, implementing appropriate controls and overseeing all compliance related issues. Update regulatory compliance policies and procedures, monitor changes to laws and regulations and provide compliance briefings to senior management.

Develop, implement and administers the Company’s Compliance and Risk Management Program; review and write compliance related policies and procedures; make recommendations to Executive Leadership when appropriate; submit reports to Executive Leadership to monitor, review and evaluate new and changing federal and state regulatory requirements and assist management with designing, developing and implementing policies, procedures, processes and controls to ensure compliance.
Serve as a resource by providing compliance related research and subject matter expertise. Provide technical reviews and testing to ensure processes have been implemented effectively. 
Responsible for developing, implementing and administering all aspects of the HMDA/Fair Lending Compliance Management Program. Analyze results from external and internal Fair Lending audits, comparative file ("matched pair") analyses. Present reports to the compliance committee that summarize results with recommended courses of action and improvements to reporting and managing changes.
Communicate effectively verbally and in writing; share information and ideas with others; listen well and select the right form of communication for the topic and to avoid misunderstandings. Effectively negotiates resolution with a positive attitude.
Chairs the Compliance Committee, holding regular meetings to bring any deficiencies or concerns to the attention of management, along with recommendations for corrective action.
Oversee the Appraisal Desk to ensure all employees are compliant with applicable regulatory requirements.
Acts as a liaison to third party outside regulators and audit firms.
Responds to alleged violations of rules, regulations, policies, and procedures by evaluating or recommending the initiation of investigative procedures.
Identifies potential areas of compliance vulnerability and risk, and develops/implements corrective action plans.
Monitors the performance of the compliance program and related activities on a continuing basis, taking appropriate steps to improve its effectiveness.
Directs and oversees the daily operation of the Compliance Department, including establishing clear performance goals and duties for each employee within the department, motivating teamwork and positive change as appropriate, and managing the personnel issues to include staffing, training, performance appraisal and corrective action.
 Manages special projects/additional responsibilities assigned by leadership.

Requirements

Education and/or Work Experience Requirements:

Minimum of 5+ years of management experience in compliance and quality control in a mortgage lending environment. 
Experience creating and developing a comprehensive compliance program, including a compliance audit plan, policies and procedures. 
Comprehensive knowledge of mortgage loan origination processes, servicing, vendor management, regulatory compliance and risk management. 
Bachelor’s degree preferred. 
Certified Regulatory Compliance Management designation preferred.

As a Compliance Specialist with Frost Brokerage Services, you will be responsible for conducting compliance monitoring and testing within Frost Brokerage Services. You will ensure that activities meet the requirements of all state and federal laws and regulations and will recommend policies and procedures intended to prevent unethical and illegal conduct. You welcome a challenge and strive to contentiously improve processes with integrity, caring and excellence in mind.

Monitor activity reports and identify suspicious activity by customers and/or registered representatives and research accordingly
Conduct compliance testing and monitoring and report findings and conclusions to management

Provide general compliance guidance and respond to questions regarding licensing and registration requirements
Maintain appropriate documentation of all testing and provide written reports to management
Assist in planning of compliance testing as well as during compliance examinations by regulatory agencies
Always take action using Integrity, Caring, and Excellence to achieve all-win outcomes

What You’ll Need

3+ years brokerage experience in a compliance related function; or equivalent experience
Bachelor’s degree preferably in Finance or Accounting
Proficient in Microsoft computer applications
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Ability to work under pressure and meet deadlines
Independent thinking and decision making skills
FINRA Series 24 (or ability to obtain within 120 days of hire)

General Lines Agent License: Life, Accident, Health, and HMO
FINRA Series 4, 53, 27, and CAMS designation
Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Word, Excel, and Access strongly preferred

Our Benefits

Referral bonus program + more!

Since 1868, Frost has dedicated their expertise to provide exceptional banking, investment, and insurance services to businesses and individuals throughout Texas. About AIT Worldwide

AIT Worldwide Logistics is a global freight forwarder that helps its customers grow by expanding access to markets all over the world where they can sell and/or procure raw materials, components and finished goods. For more than 40 years, the America’s-based supply chain solutions leader has relied on a consultative approach to build a global network and trusted partnerships in nearly every industry, including aerospace, automotive, consumer retail, food, government, healthcare, high-tech, industrial and life sciences. Backed by scalable, user-friendly technology, AIT’s flexible business model customizes door-to-door deliveries via sea, air, ground, and rail—on time and on budget. With expert teammates staffing more than 100 worldwide locations in Asia, Europe, India, and North America, AIT’s full-service options also include customs clearance, warehouse management and white glove services. Represents insured and the Company in the defense of bodily injury and property damage lawsuits, subrogation, and Allstate Financial cases. Prepares for and conducts hearings, trials, arbitrations, mediations, and depositions. Prepares and argues pre and post-trial motions. Assists colleagues in the resolution of calendar conflicts. Provides counsel to business clients on day to day issues. Provides project management, coordination, and collaboration between legal teams. Monitors and reviews new laws, regulations, and case law; identifies and summarizes relevant issues; collaborates with other areas of L&R department; proactively provides advice and counsel to business unit on the impact of new laws on business; monitors counsel

Key Responsibilities

Review new file assignments and approve initial pleadings, propound discovery, and/or develop strategy
Contacts clients to discuss their case and answer any questions. Maintains contact at a minimum of 90 days
Contact claims (initial litigation plan, recurring minimum 90 day contact, strategy conferences, etc.)
Review all documentary evidence
Prepares witnesses and clients for depositions, arbitrations, mediations and trials including expert witnesses
Conducts depositions and examinations under oath and prepares summary documents
Prepares and conducts court appearances (matter management conferences, hearings, status conferences, etc.)
Conducts settlement/dispositive proceedings (e.g. mediations, arbitrations, etc.)
Try and/or arbitrate cases and prepares motions in liminie and summary documents
Draft post-trial motions
Prepare for and participate in appeals
Provide legal opinions to claims clients
Investigate and pursue subrogation litigation as appropriate
Manages projects

Knowledge/Skills/Abilities/Experience

Juris Doctorate degree and member in good standing of LA State Bar
Up to 5 years Insurance Defense, Subrogation and/or Personal Injury litigation experience
Trial and/or Arbitration experience is preferred, with flexibility to work across several disciplines that may include SIU, PIP, UM and Subrogation.
No Fault and/or SIU experience is a plus.
Computer skills required; experience with Microsoft Office, Lexis, and the internet
Ability to work well with others on a team of attorneys, paralegals, administrative assistants, supervised by an attorney Lead Counsel
Must be able to handle a large caseload
Excellent verbal, written and interpersonal skills are key to working with a variety of internal and external contacts as well as for preparing reports, pleadings, and correspondence, collaborating with others, etc. Will work independently as well as part of a cohesive team.
Ability to travel
Periodically lifting in excess of 20 pounds throughout the day, depending on court matters being handled. Attorneys are required to cover court matters for each other; attorneys have laptops.
Bending to pick up the computer bag which sometimes is more than 20 pounds, entering and exiting a vehicle, maneuvering files and computer at security checkpoints
Turning and twisting at work
Driving at least 40-50 miles daily depending on the activities being covered, court, doctors’ depositions, discovery depositions, and case evaluations, etc.
Sitting for pro-longed periods of time en route to court, in court or at court proceedings, depositions, etc.
Walking and rolling brief case with files from vehicle to the legal proceeding and/or deposition and facilitations, etc.
Trial preparation could require lifting in excess 20 lbs. because of exhibits, materials, records from plaintiff, etc. These materials are printed for some proceedings.

About the job
Ironclad Environmental Solutions is America's Top Choice for specialty containment needs. We provide waste management services and specialty-containment solutions to a wide range of industrial sectors throughout the US. Ironclad Environmental Solutions has that small company feel, with all the resources a big company can supply. We offer generous benefits and extensive career growth and development programs, with plenty of opportunities to support our local communities and colleagues in need.

The candidate must be able to identify, analyze, and document RCRA compliance as a result of applying expert knowledge of federal, state, and local regulations.

Job Responsibilities:
The ideal candidate will have familiarity working with numerous waste disposal facilities on profiling, coordinating transportation and disposal, and cost assessments
Able to sample, characterize, profile, coordinate, and manifest waste streams to appropriate disposal facilities
Waste management and compliance experience, including knowledge of RCRA, CERCLA, TSCA and SWDA
Preparation of agency waste notifications, annual and biennial reports, state- specific report and maintenance of required records
Coordinate with various regulating agencies for transportation and site permits and updates, as required, as well as follow up with reports and required regulatory agency submissions
Completing, tracking, updating, and renewing waste profiles and completing manifests for Hazardous and Non-Hazardous waste shipments
Ensure the fleet maintains compliance with all Federal and State regulatory agencies such as DOT, FMCSA, PHMSA, LPSC, and TXRRC
Administer the driver qualification process for all drivers in coordination with the company’s DOT/FMCSA compliance program with the goal of maintaining compliance, improving safety, and avoiding DOT violations associated with driver qualification regulations
Function as point-of-contact/SME for Driver Qualification File (DQF) documents
Review new driver “onboarding” DQF documents to ensure all information is properly completed
Partner with recruiter and operations team to ensure they are DOT compliant and that all DOT qualification documentation is complete
Maintain updated active driver lists in random drug testing pools/consortiums
Review driver motor vehicles records (MVR’s) as needed and provide subject matter expert advice on violations noted on the records
Assist in developing, recommending, and executing changes needed with fleet telematics platform (ELDs and dashcams)
Assist in the preparation of monthly, quarterly, or annual Fuel and Mileage Tax Filings and payment of returns.
Processes License Permit, Registration and Authority applications and orders.
Claims management of auto liability claims and, in conjunction with operations management, develop approaches to reduce auto liability claim experience
Manages onboarding process and safety training sessions for all drivers and is the process owner for all driver related safety training
Perform quality work within set deadlines with or without direct supervision
Limited travel may be required (estimated at 10 – 20 %)

Job Qualifications:
Have 5-7 years of previous experience working in DOT, FMCSA, OSHA and Hazardous Materials regulatory compliance at a nationwide level
Expert knowledge of hazardous and non-hazardous waste management and disposal
Capable of analyzing sampling data
Experience in the transportation industry (fuel tax, licensing, permitting and registrations, DOT safety, driver qualification file compliance, and hours of service log auditing)
Previous fleet management experience, to include developing and implementing policies and procedures to address safety and other aspects of fleet management
Must be able to exercise tact, discretion, and professionalism when dealing with internal clients and external counterparties (customers, vendors, etc.), as well as when handling sensitive and confidential information
Strong problem solving, organizational, time management and analytical skills

About the job
The Job

Tango is seeking a talented individual for the position of Bank Secrecy Act/Anti-Money Laundering (BSA/AML) Officer to coordinate and oversee systems and controls that not only maintain our compliance, but also proactively prevent and detect illicit financial activity.

This VP-level role reports to our Chief Compliance Officer and leads a team of compliance professionals. The BSA/AML Officer will also provide expertise to advise and guide the company in the evaluation and development of effective compliance internal controls, program governance, and process improvements.

The rewards and payments space is constantly evolving, and you will lead cross-company efforts to design and implement innovative processes and solutions tailored for our industry, ensuring compliance with BSA/AML/OFAC regulations and maintaining a positive customer experience.

The successful candidate must have outstanding communication skills, an ability to anticipate and deliver on the needs of a fast-paced and innovative business, and the flexibility to simultaneously manage a wide range of projects.

Reports To: Chief Compliance Officer

As The BSA/AML Officer At Tango, You Will 
Oversee and monitor an effective BSA/AML compliance program that is aligned with current industry best practice, regulatory guidance and compliance practices.
Mentor and develop a team of Regulatory Compliance professionals, holding them accountable for analysis and consultation in a fast-paced environment that is continuing to grow and scale.
Provide subject matter expertise to the business in identifying, assessing, prioritizing and AML, Know Your Business (KYB) and payments compliance risk.
Establish, maintain and leverage relationships with other functional areas, to direct activities that promote an effective and synchronized approach BSA/AML compliance, such as:
Collaboration across multiple stakeholder organizations and senior leadership to ensure appropriate controls are designed and implemented within Tango’s products.
Collaboration with technology groups to apply innovative approaches to build cutting-edge transaction monitoring and KYB solutions.
Collaboration with revenue teams to assess risk of potentially higher-risk platforms prior to onboarding during the initial sales process.
Oversee examinations, internal audits, and external audits of the BSA/AML and OFAC programs; respond to exams and audit concerns and oversee corrective action of all related compliance deficiencies.
Establish, implement and supervise BSA/AML and OFAC compliance policies and training throughout the organization to ensure that the BSA/AML and OFAC programs are effective and efficient in identifying, preventing, detecting and correcting non-compliance with regulatory requirements.
Advise stakeholders of emerging risks, new or amended laws, regulations or agency guidance; recommend and implement changes and controls to mitigate risks, including those posed by any third-party relationships.
Prepare and provide regular updates and reports to CCO, senior leadership, authorized committees and working groups as appropriate.
Engage in relationships with key regulators to manage external requests, responding in a timely fashion, and ensuring coordination with internal stakeholders.
Manage an effective customer and vendor risk management program.
Ensure all required regulatory reporting is conducted in a timely, accurate, and compliant manner.
Oversee the company’s response to 314(b) requests and Suspicious Activity Reports (SARs) 

To be effective in our BSA/AML Officer role, you must have:

Deep understanding of the financial services industry is required and must include experience in payments, gateway, e-money/wallet products and services, banking functions, money service businesses, or merchant processing.
Demonstrated ability to build and lead an effective, cohesive, and collaborative team.
Well-developed skills in leadership, influence management, business advocacy, communication and training; ability to think and act strategically and tactically.
Experienced in executive, board, and regulatory level reporting, in addition to managing regulatory expectations within financial services.
Strong focus and record of execution, with the ability to devise, own and drive compliance metrics.
Strong interpersonal and communication skills with the ability to influence at all levels of the organization, while being able to simplify complex topics for understanding and critical decision making.
Ability to organize, prioritize, and lead multiple deliverables simultaneously.
Strong intellectual curiosity to expand and further develop an existing compliance toolkit.
Ability to balance compliance risk with business opportunities, with the agility to meet changing business needs.
15+ years of experience with global BSA/AML programs (BSA, KYC/CIP, OFAC, and USA Patriot Act within the financial services or fintech industry - including a minimum of 5 years as an AML Compliance Officer at a licensed money transmitter.
10+ years of experience in acquiring and payments processing (eCommerce, FinTech, banking preferred)
8+ years experience managing a team of BSA/AML professionals
Experience managing state regulatory examinations and working with state regulators.
Experience presenting BSA/AML metrics to executive level management.

Our ideal BSA/AML Officer at Tango will have most of the following skills and experience:

Association of Certified Anti-Money Laundering certification (ACAMS)
Certified Regulatory Compliance Manager (CRCM)
Certified Fraud Examiner certification (CFE)
Experience with non-US customer due diligence

About the job
Systems and Compliance Trainer

Job Summary:

The Systems and Compliance Trainer is responsible for designing, implementing, and delivering training programs related to systems, processes, and compliance within the organization. This role involves auditing, assessing training needs, developing training materials, delivering effective training sessions, and evaluating the effectiveness of the training programs. 

The Systems and Compliance Trainer will collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure employees have the necessary knowledge and skills to adhere to company policies, procedures, and regulatory requirements.

Duties and Responsibilities:
 
Design, develop, and deliver training programs that effectively communicate complex concepts, processes, and compliance requirements to employees.
Create and update training materials, including presentations, manuals, job aids, and online learning modules, ensuring they align with the organization's systems and compliance guidelines.
Collaborate with subject matter experts to gather information and insights on systems, processes, and compliance requirements to develop accurate and up-to-date training content.
Deliver engaging and interactive training sessions, both in-person and through virtual platforms, utilizing a variety of training methods, such as lectures, group discussions, case studies, and hands-on activities.
Stay current with industry trends, best practices, and regulatory changes related to systems and compliance to ensure training materials and programs are up to date.
Provide ongoing support and guidance to employees regarding systems, processes, and compliance-related inquiries, clarifying doubts, and reinforcing training concepts as needed.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including HR, legal, and Client Services, to ensure training programs align with company policies, procedures, and regulatory requirements.
Assist in the development and implementation of compliance-related policies, procedures, and guidelines, ensuring they are effectively communicated to employees through training initiatives.

Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in a relevant field, such as Training and Development, Human Resources, Business Administration, or a related discipline.
Proven experience as a trainer, preferably in systems training and compliance within a regulated industry.
Strong knowledge of training methodologies, instructional design principles, and adult learning principles.
Excellent presentation and facilitation skills, with the ability to engage and motivate learners in a classroom or virtual environment.
Solid understanding of systems, processes, and compliance requirements relevant to the organization or industry.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to assess training needs and develop effective training solutions.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to explain complex concepts in a clear and concise manner.
Detail-oriented with exceptional organizational skills to manage multiple training programs and projects simultaneously.
Ability to work collaboratively with cross-functional teams and build effective working relationships.
Proficiency in using Microsoft Office Suite (Word, PowerPoint, Excel) and other relevant training tools and software.
