About the job
Overview

This position ensures the legal, operational, and risk management compliance of the Bank at a high level of complexity and ability. Facilitates the security and integrity of Bank activities through the expert identification of risks, inefficiencies, and compliance issues. Provides guidance to business leaders and associate teams through knowledge of new and existing laws that impact enterprise activities. Leads the review of business processes, procedures, and activities for risks and inefficiencies. Assists internal and external audits. Develops and implements new, compliant policies as appropriate. Serves as a liaison between corporate, legal, and division teams to identify and resolve complex issues. Assists management with special projects and initiatives that foster an understanding of and compliance with applicable regulations, rules, and standards. May provide leadership to less experienced associates in the work group.

Responsibilities
Compliance Improvement - Leads the analysis of external laws and regulations as well as internal processes and systems. Develops and revises policies, procedures, services, products, and systems that ensure regulatory compliance. Fosters understanding and proper implementation of necessary changes in impacted business areas. Assists special projects or related business initiatives as needed, which may include consulting on specific compliance matters.
Business Support - Serves as a liaison between examiners, regulators, auditors, and legal and corporate compliance teams during compliance examinations, processes, and procedures. Tracks, investigates, and resolves complex or escalated issues which may involve system testing or direct consumer complaints. Recommends process and operational improvements that enhance efficiencies and reduce risk. Provides technical support to business programs, systems, or vendors throughout daily activities. Assists less experienced associates in addressing and addressing factors that perpetuate risk.
Reporting - Prepares reports for management on results of compliance reviews, legal changes, or new regulations. Conveys the necessary actions to fulfill regulatory requirements and communicates changes amongst work groups.
Compliance Expertise - Maintains a strong knowledge of current or changing laws, regulations, requirements, policies, and procedures that affect assigned area of the Bank. Serves as a subject matter expert in providing guidance to management and associates on compliance-related matters. May facilitate compliance trainings, educational resources, or other methods of strengthening knowledge within the Bank of applicable rules, regulations, and standards. May participate in industry events or professional organizations in order to remain knowledgeable on factors that could impact enterprise activities.
Qualifications

Bachelor's Degree and 7 years of experience in Compliance, legal, or audit OR High School Diploma or GED and 11 years of experience in Compliance, legal, or audit

License or Certification Type: CRCM (Certified Regulatory Compliance Manager) designation. Preferred, Possess Valid Series 7, 63, 24, 65/66 and preferred Insurance licenses Required, Preferred CRCP & ACAM designations Preferred

Skill(s): Possess Valid Series 7, 63, 24, 65 or 66, and preferred insurance licenses, Certified Anti-Money Laundering Specialist (CAMS) or, Certified Anti-Money Laundering and Fraud Professional (CAFP) or, Certified Regulatory Compliance Manager (CRCM), Certified Regulatory and Compliance Professional (CRCP)

About the job

Your primary objective will be to ensure compliance with industry standards, legal requirements, and company policies. Your expertise in ISO 14001, ISO 9001, ISO 45001, ISO 27001, and R2V3 certifications will be crucial in developing, implementing, and maintaining effective QEHS programs and practices.
Responsibilities:
Implement QEHS management system in alignment with ISO 14001, ISO 9001, ISO 45001, ISO 27001, and R2V3 certifications.
Conduct regular audits and assessments to monitor compliance with QEHS standards, legal regulations, and company policies.

Collaborate with cross-functional teams to develop and update relevant QEHS policies, procedures, and work instructions.
Provide guidance and training to employees on QEHS-related matters, promoting a culture of safety, quality, and environmental responsibility.
Lead incident investigations and root cause analysis to identify opportunities for improvement and prevent recurrence.
Monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) to assess QEHS performance and recommend corrective actions as needed.
Liaise with external auditors and regulatory bodies during certification audits and inspections.
Keep abreast of industry trends, emerging QEHS standards, and regulatory changes to ensure ongoing compliance and best practices.

Bachelor's degree in a relevant field (e.g., Environmental Science, Occupational Health and Safety, Quality Management) or equivalent work experience.
Proven experience as a QEHS Manager or similar role within the ITAD or related industry.
Strong knowledge and certifications in ISO 14001, ISO 9001, ISO 45001, ISO 27001, and R2V3 standards.
Familiarity with applicable local, state, and federal regulations pertaining to environmental, health, safety, and data security.
Excellent understanding of QEHS management systems and practices, including risk assessment and mitigation.
Experience in conducting internal and external audits and managing certification processes.
Ability to develop and deliver effective training programs on QEHS-related topics.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to identify trends, root causes, and implement corrective actions.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills to collaborate with stakeholders at all levels of the organization.
Detail-oriented mindset with the ability to manage multiple priorities and meet deadlines.

Job Description

Full Stack Finance offers a complete, end-to-end range of financial and human resources (HR) related services to early stage and high growth companies. About the job
Who We Are

Apex Fintech Solutions (AFS) powers innovation and the future of digital wealth management by processing millions of transactions daily, to simplify, automate, and facilitate access to financial markets for all. Our robust suite of fintech solutions enables us to support clients such as Stash, Betterment, SoFi, and WeBull, and more than 20 million of our clients' customers.

Collectively, AFS creates an environment in which companies with the biggest ideas in fintech are empowered to change the world. We are based in Dallas, TX and also have offices in Austin, New York, Chicago, Portland, and Belfast.

If you are seeking a fast-paced and entrepreneurial environment where you'll have the opportunity to make an immediate impact, and you have the guts to change everything, this is the place for you.

AFS has received a number of prestigious industry awards, including:

About This Role

The Advisory Compliance Officer (ACO) will coordinate with the Enterprise Chief Compliance Officer, Sales Practice Compliance professionals and other members of the Apex Fintech Solutions (AFS) Compliance department to ensure regulatory requirements and industry practices are met with respect to the firm’s provision of trading, clearing, and custody services to Registered Investment Advisers, asset managers, and related service providers to the wealth and investment management industry.

While serving as an Advisory Compliance Officer for AFS, the individual will work closely with the AFS Compliance Sales Practice Compliance team and Advisory business team members to ensure investment management regulations are interpreted and guidance provided to business resources. The role’s focus will include providing regulatory advice and guidance, policy interpretation, conducting monitoring activities, policy drafting and other related activities to support the sustainable and scalable implementation of the compliance program to ensure that FINRA, SEC, and related industry practices are properly identified, and requirements are met.

Key functions of the Advisory Compliance Officer role include:

Implementation, and oversight of sales practice and related business requirements for a clearing broker dealer supporting investment advisers.

The ACO will be responsible to review existing WSP, policies, procedures, and related business documents to ensure advisory related business practices meet FINRA and related regulatory requirements. 
Coordinate with Compliance team members and business partners to ensure industry and regulatory best practices are understood and implemented where applicable. 
Serve as primary Compliance subject matter expert to the business regarding providing trading, clearing, and custody services to advisory clients. 

Compliance Monitoring 

The role will identify and implement compliance review and monitoring specific to the support of advisory related compliance requirement and as aligned with Compliance Program governance. 
Coordinate the review, testing, and (as needed) remediation of advisory business controls. 
Working closely with business partners and compliance team members, the ACO will participate in the review of advisory prospects and new clients to help identify unique regulatory or operational risks impacting AFS. The work requires a strong understanding of how the regulations directly apply to the Apex businesses. 

We are looking for someone who:

Is passionate - You have a genuine passion for people and developing relationships. 
Is motivated - You are driven to be the best. You challenge yourself by setting goals, crushing them, and helping your teammates do the same. 
Is collaborative - You are excited to work with others throughout the organization to help foster a superior workplace and culture. 
Wants to make an impact - You are looking to do amazing work. You are all about partnering with executives to drive execution. 
Operates with integrity - You always conduct yourself with honesty and operate ethically. You say what you mean and mean what you say. 
Wants to grow - This role will constantly change with the needs of the business, be ready to challenge yourself and tackle any task that comes your way. 
Can focus on varying work streams - This role will work across many functions, be ready to change your approach, focus, and mindset throughout the day. 

What you will do all day:

Compliance Officer - Provide training, assistance, advice and guidance in the review and analysis of daily functions including customer and firm business activity. 
Participate in ongoing projects and initiatives with various teams - Partnering with business units and establishing, maintaining, and developing credible relationships to effectively manage a robust compliance program. 
Help the company continue to meet standards - Clearly and concisely communicating regulatory, industry and compliance developments, including policy changes, to the businesses. 
Minimize regulatory compliance risk - Providing input, assessing, and reporting on compliance risk related to material business/operational changes and new initiatives. 

A few reasons why you might love us:

We are a leader in the space - Apex is recognized for disrupting the financial services industry, enabling fintech standouts like Stash, Robinhood and Betterment. We have an amazing track record of success, and we foster ongoing innovation. So, you get all the benefits of a proven, growing company, while enjoying a very entrepreneurial culture. 
Your work will be immediately impactful - You will be able to see your direct impact on our executive team and the firm as a whole. You won’t just be another talented professional weighed down by old school tactics. 

The skills you will need to succeed: 

7-10 years of compliance, risk management or related experience
7-10 years of industry knowledge of the investment advisory space including operations, trading, investment guideline management, and client onboarding
FINRA Series 7 and Series 24 licenses required
Knowledge of the clearing and trading financial services industry, including regulatory application to business processes
Ability to lead and participate in diverse compliance projects, and serve as a subject matter expert
A strong understanding of market structure, including trading, reporting, and clearing
Strong communication and interpersonal skills
A track record of working with and advising business partners on compliance and related risk matters
The ability to implement compliance and business processes to accommodate regulatory changes and developments
Experience in implementing policies, procedures, and manuals
Experience in metrics based, KRI/ KPI reporting for regulatory bodies and internal management
An analytical mind, and the ability to work collaboratively to help solve complex problems and streamline processes

#compliance #mid-senior #full-time

About the job
Job Description

Your missions as a Customs Compliance Officer include:

Serve as the company’s global subject matter expert on import/export/duty drawback and all matters related to global trade.
Pro-actively identify potential import/export compliance risks, recommend, and develop corrective measures. Adjust business practices and implement process change as necessary.
The jobholder will serve as the focal point for U.S. customs entries ensuring that all imports/exports are assigned the appropriate HTSUS codes, data is reported accurately, and all appropriate duties, taxes and fees are paid in compliance with trade regulations.
Establish post-entry and post-export review procedures and conduct regular internal audits to ensure compliance.
Develop regional knowledge of Global Free Trade Agreements (FTA’s) and the ability to use FTA's for the benefit of the company across geographic locations.
Monitor changes in the regulatory environment and adjust internal compliance controls as necessary to ensure Best Practices are in effect.
Manage, direct, and evaluate the performance of customs brokers and other customs related service providers.
Periodically conduct training sessions for company personnel on applicable Customs & Boarder Protection regulations and Trade compliance (sanctions/boycotts).
Support Contracts Coordination (ATMI Legal) on supplier agreements regarding customs and free trade matters and contract work.
Dimensions

Primary focus is on customs compliance in the United States, U.S. Territories, Canada and Mexico. The jobholder is the main contact with Customs and Border Patrol in the conduct of importation, exportation and drawback activities in the United States. The jobholder is also a liaison in trade compliance issues and OFAC SDN transaction screening.

Purposes

Ensure compliance of the import/export/duty drawback processes with all internal company rules and all applicable laws/regulations. Ensure a professional interaction with internal stakeholders at all levels in addition with local, state, and federal regulatory agencies. The jobholder is autonomous in his/her decision making and has the entire responsibility of regulatory activities.

Context and environment

Fast-paced, dynamic trading environment with time-sensitive, business critical activities requiring strong planning and organizational skills and attention to detail. Ability to work with limited direct supervision. Handle and resolve potential conflicts between the Group and third parties (customers, suppliers, govt. entities). Ability to anticipate and mitigate compliance risks and take initiative in proposing alternative solutions to issues.

Candidate profile

Are you someone with the following:

A graduate degree in the customs law field 
5 to 10 years professional experience related to international trade and custom compliance
advanced level in freight forwarding
Technical competencies in duty drawback, Customs and trade compliance; Import or export compliance; Free trade agreements; Economic sanctions required
Rigorous, reactive, team oriented, self-starter, commercially minded, receptive to change with excellent communicative skills

About Us / Company Profile

At TotalEnergies we know that you're more than what's on your CV. If this opportunity excites you, but your profile doesn't exactly match the description above...give it a try & apply. Diversity of perspectives & experiences make us stronger.

TotalEnergies is a multi-energy company that produces and markets energies on a global scale: oil and biofuels, natural gas and green gases, renewables and electricity. Our 105,000 employees are committed to energy that is ever more affordable, clean, reliable and accessible to as many people as possible. Active in more than 130 countries, TotalEnergies puts sustainable development in all its dimensions at the heart of its projects and operations to contribute to the well-being of people.

TotalEnergies Trading & Shipping (T&S), an international trading company, puts its expertise to use in the global energy markets. With its biomass blending and trading activity, TotalEnergies T&S is an active participant in the development of sustainable biofuels. Our maritime transport expertise also helps to reduce the carbon footprint of sea transportation and we recently announced the time chartering of new vessels equipped with LNG propulsion.

Our Culture:

We are committed to meet the energy needs of a growing population while fulfilling our ambition to be a major player in the energy transition. The volatility of the energy trading markets requires excellence in risk management and a culture of innovation.

Our people flourish in an environment that promotes expertise, entrepreneurship spirit, agility and a purpose-driven culture, generating boundless opportunities to learn, grow and achieve collaborative success while ensuring safety in all our operations.

We look for passion, ambition and open-mindedness. While we evolve in a demanding and ever-changing industry, we cultivate a friendly workplace where team spirit and respect guide our daily routine, and where the diversity of our people and their skills create a nourishing experience for all of us.

About the job
Role

Directly responsible for being the initial point of contact and providing general compliance support to all departments within the credit union, minimizing the potential for compliance issues. Responsible for monitoring departmental email boxes, responding or assigning as appropriate. Serves as a resource to employees for questions relating to compliance. Maintains a
general understanding of credit union operations, specifically in the area of member
advisor procedures, in order to assist various departments. Responsible for being the
first point of contact and answering any questions related to general compliance
matters. Escalates complex matters as appropriate and within a timely manner. Monitor
departmental email boxes, responding or assigning as appropriate.
Assists the compliance and risk management teams with ensuring the credit union is
operating within established risk tolerances and in compliance with its outside

federal laws, rules, regulations and regulatory guidelines affecting the financial services
industry. Performs regulatory compliance research as directed. Identifies potential

About the job
One of the largest AP labs in the United States, with over 300 staff members and 60+ distinguished Pathologists is looking for a Director of Quality & Risk Management to add to their team. They are on an unwavering pursuit of Excellence in Patient Care - Every Diagnosis, Every Day. This is what they stand for. Their lab continues to grow in technology and scientific advancement while offering our employees a wide array of training and career progression pathways. If their mission of patient care resonates with you, Come Grow With Them in Pursuit of Excellence as their new Director of Quality & Risk Management.

Under the supervision of the Chief Executive Officer and the Medical Director, the Director of Quality & Risk Management provides leadership and expertise in evaluating potential risks and exposures for the company. This position is responsible for the oversight of multiple areas including accreditation, patient safety, quality improvement, risk management and HIPAA compliance.

Direct Hire Opportunity! 
Location: Tukwila, WA 
Onsite Role - Option to go hybrid with a 3 day in person work week 
Pay: $105 - $160k / DOE 

Essential Duties for the Director of Quality & Risk Management :
Oversees the electronic document control system and the accreditation program company wide.
Oversees the incident reporting system and ensures that follow-up investigations are conducted as warranted.
Develops and maintain a written quality improvement plan and annual evaluation of the plan’s effectiveness.
Develops and maintain a performance measurement work plan to ensure timely data collection, analysis, and reporting of established performance measures related to key operational and clinical processes and outcomes.
Serves as a liaison between the PLLC and the LLC QA Committees.
In conjunction with the Chair of the QA committee, leads the LLC Committee through the Plan Do Study Act cycle and reports on outcomes.
Manages electronic storage of quality improvement reports to promote ongoing access for key stakeholders.
Develops and maintains a companywide risk program develops and maintains a written risk management plan and annual evaluation of the plan’s effectiveness, and develops and maintains policies and procedures related to the risk program.
Reports to insurance carriers as needed and collaborates with insurance broker and carriers to ensure proper insurance coverage and reporting occur.
Serves on the Compliance Committee as the HIPAA Privacy Officer and collaborates with the Chair of the Compliance Committee to develop and maintain a written corporate compliance plan.
Develops tools to perform the annual evaluation of the compliance plan’s effectiveness.
Serves as a resource for all external and internal audits; ensures that corrective action plans are documented in a timely manner and effectively implemented.
In consultation with the Corporate Compliance office, submits a mandatory notification of known or suspected corporate compliance violations to the appropriate regulatory agencies.
Develops and ensure the organization is evaluating and improving its patient safety.

Knowledge/Skills/Abilities of a Director of Quality & Risk Management :
Demonstrates excellent problem solving, change management, leadership, and analytic skills.
Demonstrates exceptional understanding of the elements that support high quality work processes, training and quality assurance.
Demonstrates strong knowledge of pathological terminology and operations, healthcare fundamentals, patient safety standards, and performance improvements standards.
Must be able to express himself/herself effectively both in written and verbal communications.
Must have transportation available in order to visit multiple company sites as needed.

Qualifications/Experience of a Director of Quality & Risk Management :
5-7 years of management experience working in healthcare quality, risk, and or compliance required.
Bachelor's/Master's Degree in related field or equivalent work experience preferred.

Certification in Healthcare Risk Management, CPHRM
Certification in Professional Healthcare Quality, CPHQ
Certification in Patient Safety, CPPS
MT(ASCP), HTL (ASCP) or HT (ASCP), CT (ASCP), PA (ASCP) certification.

About the job
Job Description

Primary Purpose:

The Enterprise Compliance Analyst I is responsible for ensuring that National General Policies and processes adhere to regulatory and legal compliance standards such as PCI, HIPAA, and ISO Cybersecurity Frameworks. The Compliance Analyst will work with the other members of the team to enhance business practices and internal controls and performs other internal assessment related activities to support the execution of the department's annual assessment plan.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:

Works with Security Architects, Security Analysts, Security Administrators and other IT and business departments to review procedures and controls to meet IT compliance requirements
Supports the execution of assessments related to HIPAA, PCI, NY DFS, MARS-E and other industry/regulatory requirements as well as common security frameworks such as NIST, ISO, and HITRUST
Fieldwork/Execution: with appropriate supervision, performs testing (including walkthroughs), takes ownership to complete clear and well-organized papers that appropriately document the work performed, uses root cause analysis for problem solving and communicates potential issues timely to supervisor.
Evaluates risks of key control deficiencies and effectiveness of overall control framework, and ensure management has effective and timely control remediation plans.
Reporting: Formulates appropriate conclusions in alignment EIRC management regarding the adequacy of internal controls and procedures based on the assessment of work performed and knowledge of company operation, drafts well written, clear and concise assessment report and participates in presenting the findings to the Enterprise Information Risk & Compliance management.
Remediation: Monitors the implementation of corrective action plans with first and second lines of defense and presents updates to the findings to the Enterprise Information Risk & Compliance management.
Conducts assessments of vendors against NIST controls while documenting remediation items and working with vendors until items have reached a satisfactory level of risk.
Other duties as assigned

Minimum Skills and Competencies:

2-4 years substantive experience as a Compliance Assessor or Auditor with a licensed financial institution or a regulatory compliance examiner
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or Computer Information Systems or related or equivalent experience
Demonstrated knowledge of HIPAA, PCI, SOX, ISO27000 and NIST Cybersecurity Frameworks
Excellent communication and writing skills
Demonstrated detailed oriented self-starter and the ability to work independently with limited supervision and limited direction, and in collaborative team environments
A strong ability to multi-task and manage varying priorities and projects
Excellent interpersonal, verbal, and written communication skills with the ability to communicate security risk and compliance related concepts to a broad range of technical and non-technical staff
The ability to provide support after normal business hours as needed

Desired Skills:

CIA, CISSP, CISA, CISM, CCRISC, or CGEIT certifications
RSA Archer, Tripwire Enterprise, Tripwire IP360, Nessus, BeyondTrust Retina, Qradar, Trustwave TrustKeeper, Proofpoint, McAfee ePO/HBSS
Experience with high-level programming languages (e.g. Java, C, C++, C#, python) and web application development (JavaScript, PHP, ASP)
Knowledge of SQL & Oracle

About the job
Company Overview:
We are a reputable law firm based in Seattle, Washington, specializing in family law matters. Our firm is dedicated to providing exceptional legal representation and guidance to clients facing various family-related challenges. We strive to support our clients during sensitive times, offering compassionate service combined with extensive legal expertise.

Job Description:
We are currently seeking a highly skilled and experienced Family Law Attorney to join our team in Seattle. The successful candidate will be responsible for handling a diverse caseload, representing clients in family law matters, and ensuring their legal rights are protected. This position requires a deep understanding of Washington State family law statutes and regulations, as well as the ability to provide strategic legal advice and advocacy.

Responsibilities:
Conduct comprehensive consultations with clients to assess their individual legal needs and objectives in family law matters such as divorce, child custody, child support, spousal support, adoption, guardianship, and domestic violence.
Provide expert legal representation to clients in court proceedings, mediations, negotiations, and alternative dispute resolution processes.
Draft and review legal documents, including pleadings, motions, petitions, settlement agreements, and court orders.
Conduct legal research and analysis to support case strategy and stay current with evolving family law regulations, precedents, and best practices.
Collaborate with other attorneys, paralegals, and support staff to effectively manage caseloads and ensure the timely delivery of legal services.
Advocate for clients' best interests, promoting fair and equitable resolutions while ensuring compliance with applicable laws and regulations.
Guide clients through the legal process, explaining complex legal concepts in a clear and concise manner and providing emotional support when needed.
Build and maintain strong client relationships by demonstrating professionalism, empathy, and responsiveness.

About the job
At EY, you’ll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we’re counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better, too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all.

EY is a leader in serving the global financial services marketplace and the only professional services firm with a separate business unit dedicated to the financial services industry – the Financial Services Organization (FSO). Our focused model and bold ambition have put us at the center of the events that continue to reshape and redefine our industry, working side by side with a range of clients from our most venerable institutions to dynamic new entrants across Banking and Capital Markets, Wealth and Asset Management and Insurance. Our purpose is to help build a financial services industry in which financial institutions are trusted and flourish, and the global economy is healthy, growing and secure. If you have a passion for rallying together to solve complex challenges, then come join our dynamic FSO team! 

The opportunity 

This is an area that has seen substantial investment, focused on technology, knowledge and development for assurance professionals. You’ll see that reflected in your career, with plenty of opportunities to take on new responsibilities. That could mean developing a deep professional knowledge base in one area, or diversifying to audit in other markets such as wealth and asset management, banking, private equity and capital markets. 

Your Key Responsibilities

You’re likely to balance your time between managing a team of assurance professionals across a portfolio of projects, and personally engaging with our clients. It’s the perfect role if you’re looking to diversify your professional management skills and experiences, all while further developing your leadership skills.

Skills And Attributes For Success

Performing complex and specific audit procedures, while developing effective, client-focused audit strategies 
Coaching and managing a driven team of audit professional, facilitating them to have the information, tools and opportunities they need to grow 
Proactively building relationships that support our ability to provide tailored services that meet a wide range of assurance needs and contribute to new business development 
Identifying and reacting to potential risks and developing new ways to improve our products and processes that promote growth and increase revenue 
Continually updating your understanding of business trends and emerging technologies to maintain your reputation as a trusted business advisor 

To qualify for the role you must have 

A bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Business or Finance, supported by approximately 3 years of work experience as an auditor 
A record of excellence in serving clients across the insurance industry 
A CPA certification in the work state location 
Engagement management, execution and reporting skills, and the ability to build relationships with clients with a diverse range of backgrounds 
Confidence in your ability to prioritize when managing multiple project simultaneously 
The ability and willingness to travel and work in excess of standard hours when necessary 
Access to reliable transportation to/from the EY office and client sites. A driver’s license is strongly recommended as ride share and public transportation options may not be available in all locations 

Ideally you’ll also have 

A firm understanding of engagement economics 
A proven ability to build a network of contacts and mutual business relationships 

What We Look For

We’re interested in leaders who are creative and agile thinkers, with a genuine interest in improving our audit capabilities. You’ll also need to be a capable communicator both in the boardroom and across your team. If you have the technical and personal skills to understand our clients and provide excellent services every time, this role is for you.

What We Offer

We offer a comprehensive compensation and benefits package where you’ll be rewarded based on your performance and recognized for the value you bring to the business. The salary range for this job in most geographic locations in the US is $85,300 to $156,300. The salary range for New York City Metro Area, Washington State and California (excluding Sacramento) is $102,400 to $177,600. Individual salaries within those ranges are determined through a wide variety of factors including but not limited to education, experience, knowledge, skills and geography. In addition, our Total Rewards package includes medical and dental coverage, pension and 401(k) plans, and a wide range of paid time off options. Under our flexible vacation policy, you’ll decide how much vacation time you need based on your own personal circumstances. You’ll also be granted time off for designated EY Paid Holidays, Winter/Summer breaks, Personal/Family Care, and other leaves of absence when needed to support your physical, financial, and emotional well-being.

Continuous learning: You’ll develop the mindset and skills to navigate whatever comes next.
Success as defined by you: We’ll provide the tools and flexibility, so you can make a meaningful impact, your way.
Transformative leadership: We’ll give you the insights, coaching and confidence to be the leader the world needs.
Diverse and inclusive culture: You’ll be embraced for who you are and empowered to use your voice to help others find theirs.

If you can demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, please contact us as soon as possible.

The Exceptional EY Experience. It’s Yours To Build.

EY | Building a better working world

EY exists to build a better working world, helping to create long-term value for clients, people and society and build trust in the capital markets.

Enabled by data and technology, diverse EY teams in over 150 countries provide trust through assurance and help clients grow, transform and operate.

Working across assurance, consulting, law, strategy, tax and transactions, EY teams ask better questions to find new answers for the complex issues facing our world today.

About the job
As part of Risk Management and Compliance, you are at the center of keeping JPMorgan Chase strong and resilient. You help the firm grow its business in a responsible way by anticipating new and emerging risks, and using your expert judgement to solve real-world challenges that impact our company, customers and communities. Our culture in Risk Management and Compliance is all about thinking outside the box, challenging the status quo and striving to be best-in-class.

Global Financial Crimes Compliance (GFCC) team is part of The Global Compliance & Regulatory Management department which is responsible for the provision of compliance services to the Firm. The GFCC organization has over 700 staff members across the world. The team covers both global and business-aligned functions supporting the firm's Anti-money laundering, Sanctions, and Anti-corruption programs and is led by the BSA/AML Officer and the AML Operations Executive.

This Sanctions Compliance Officer will report to the Global Financial Crimes Compliance - Sanctions Lead and is an integral part of GFCC responsibilities to protect the organization and to fulfill the Bank's regulatory requirements. Ideal candidates possess leadership, attention to detail, ability to process high volumes an analytical ability, initiative, a solution oriented mindset, knowledge of banking process, service operations, products and systems and the ability to work effectively in a deadline driven, diverse team/site environment.

Job Responsibilities

 Completion of processes around regulatory driven sanction list or internally developed watch list searches of transactions and account holders looking for designated high risk clients and sanctioned transactions. 
 Work with internal Lines of Business (LOBs) and Office of Foreign Assets Control (OFAC) and responsibility for all functions related to the restriction, blocking and unblocking of accounts/property.. 
 Review blocked and rejected transactions from the various Compliance regions, request and obtain applicable indemnities, consult with management and assist in the preparation of the daily, weekly and annual blocked property reports sent to OFAC. 
 Responsible for the monitoring, reporting, related to OFAC. 
 Oversee process to determine if there is a true match to a suspect name, review, analysis and decisioning on wire transactions and specific issues escalated to/from internal business units; validation on positive search results and providing detailed research information to support the resolution of a match. 
 Provide written and verbal communication on issues with management, the lines of business and Compliance units, performing and reviewing highly sensitive client and transaction search information, reporting, escalating and documenting results. 
 The ability to work flexible hours is required. Will perform additional duties and special projects as requested. Occasional travel may be required. 

Required Qualifications, Capabilities, And Skills

 Minimum of 3-5 years of banking experience and at least 1 year of Compliance, legal or audit experience; AML, OFAC experience is highly desirable. 
 Strong written/verbal communication, leadership, proven high volume processing and analytical skills 
 Ability to maintain high quality in a risk intensive environment while demonstrating cross-line of business knowledge of banking systems and products. 
 Possess strong computer skills: Microsoft Office Suite including Excel, Word, Outlook and PowerPoint with excellent project management and presentation skills. 
 Self-reliance and willingness to own problems and creatively find solutions while being results oriented and possessing strong organizational skills with the ability to manage multiple priorities. 
 Flexibility to work varying daytime hours to accommodate transactional, product, reporting and regional deadlines. 

Preferred Qualifications, Capabilities, And Skills

 Bachelor's degree with an emphasis in Business Administration. 
 Experience with Alteryx, or other data tools is a plus 
 Customer contact and service operations experience is a plus. 
 Knowledge of SWIFT messaging and payment transactions is preferred.

Morgan and Chase brands. JPMorgan Chase was awarded the "WELL Health-Safety Rating" for all of our 6,200 locations globally based on our operational policies, maintenance protocols, stakeholder engagement and emergency plans to address a post-COVID-19 environment.

As a part of our commitment to health and safety, we have implemented various COVID-related health and safety requirements for our workforce. We offer a competitive total rewards package including base salary determined based on the role, experience, skill set, and location. For those in eligible roles, discretionary incentive compensation which may be awarded in recognition of individual achievements and contributions. About the job

LOCATION: Kent Campus Hospital / Dover, DE

 GENERAL SUMMARY:
The Compliance Officer manages the day-to-day operations of the Corporate Compliance Program to achieve high levels of compliance with all applicable laws and regulations while supporting the vision and mission of the organization. Coordinates compliance training, maintains compliance policies, monitors/reports results of compliance/ethics efforts, and provides guidance on matters related to Corporate Compliance. Manages the annual enterprise risk assessment. Oversees research compliance, including audit activities to ensure institutional compliance. Management of the Conflict of Interest program.
ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS & ACCOUNTABILITIES:
1. Develops, initiates, maintains, and revises policies and procedures for the general operation of the Corporate Compliance Program and its related activities to prevent illegal, unethical or improper conduct.

3. Ensures the compliance program functions in accordance with all applicable laws, regulations, and accreditation requirements.
4. Provides compliance direction after analysis of existing operations and operational proposals for potential compliance issues.

Ardagh Group is a global leader in metal and glass packaging solutions, producing packaging for the world’s leading brands. Did you know….
Ardagh produces many of the beverage cans and bottles you drink your favorite beverages from?
Metal and glass packaging we produce are permanent materials, meaning they can be infinitely recycled without any loss of quality?
We produce more than 160 million containers per day across the country?
Ardagh Metal Beverage North America produces more than 15 billion cans and can ends annually?
Approximately 75% of aluminum ever produced is still in use today?
Aluminum cans, with 73%, have the highest recycled content among all beverage containers?
Ardagh is passionate about sustainability and has a reputation for innovation. We push the boundaries of what’s possible, pioneering new production methods, new design techniques and new ways to recycle and save energy.  Partner with HR, Legal and/or outside counsel to design, implement and communicate policies and procedures

 Manage responses to internal and external reporting requests, audits and assessments, including state and federal reporting requirements: AAP, EEO-1, Vets 4212, CA DFEH Pay Data, and other BLS reporting inquiries

The Cyber Security Governance and Compliance Specialist is responsible for ensuring that our organization's information technology (IT) systems comply with regulatory requirements, industry standards, and best practices. They will work closely with IT teams, management, and external auditors to identify potential risks and implement appropriate controls.


Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
Will work closely with Director Cyber Security Governance and Compliance as well as key stakeholders in IT and the business on the following:
Regularly assess and recommend updates as needed to IT compliance policies, procedures, and standards based on regulatory requirements and industry best practices. Work to identify and remediate gaps in documented policies, ensuring accurate mapping is maintained to industry security frameworks (NIST CSF, IS027001).
Conduct operational gap assessments against published policies and standards, and work with key stakeholders to develop and prioritize remediation plans where necessary.
Conduct risk assessments to identify potential IT compliance issues and develop plans to address them.
Work closely with IT teams to ensure that IT systems are designed and maintained in compliance with regulations and standards.
Develop and deliver training programs to educate employees on IT compliance requirements and best practices.
Collaborate with internal and external auditors to facilitate audits of IT systems and processes.
Develop and implement remediation plans to address identified deficiencies or weaknesses.
Monitor and report on the status of IT compliance efforts to management and other stakeholders.
Assist with other compliance initiatives (such as PCI, ISO27001, NERC CIP) as needed based, on direction from enterprise leadership


Minimum Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree 
Minimum 4 years of experience in working with IT system and control/process owners and with internal and/or external auditors, to evaluate IT processes and risks and related control processes and evidence.
Experience with IT risk assessments and the development of remediation plans.


Preferred Job Requirements:
Bachelor’s degree with IT focus
Certified Information Systems Auditor, Certified Information Security Manager, or equivalent preferred but not required


Knowledge / Skills / Abilities:
Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively with stakeholders at all levels of the organization.
Strong understanding of IT and business processes, with the ability evaluate and/or implement IT controls and processes to manage cyber risks within those business processes.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to identify potential risks and develop effective solutions.


Physical Demands: While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to talk and hear; and use hands to manipulate objects or controls. The employee is regularly required to stand and walk. On occasion, the incumbent may be required to stoop, bend, or reach above the shoulders. The employee must occasionally lift up to 25 pounds. Specific conditions of this job are typical of frequent and continuous computer-based work requiring periods of sitting, close vision, and the ability to adjust focus. Occasional travel.

About the job
Join us as we work to create a thriving ecosystem that delivers accessible, high-quality, and sustainable healthcare for all.

Compliance Manager 

We are looking for a Compliance Manager to join the Compliance Team within our Legal Department. In this role, the Compliance Manager will bring sound judgment, critical thinking, practical guidance, and a data-driven approach to help shape an evolving and dynamic compliance organizational program. This individual will be expected to know the fundamental principles of applicable healthcare laws, regulations, and privacy/security frameworks and apply that knowledge throughout the business and our service offerings. To do this work effectively, this individual will need to build relationships across all levels of the organization, including Sales, Marketing, Product Development, Engineering, Customer Success, Information Security, Operations, Finance, Human Resources, Internal Audit, and Legal.

The Compliance Manager will be a key member of the team responsible for exerting strategic influence over compliance functions and operations, while ensuring the company operates with the highest standards of integrity, accountability, transparency, and trustworthiness in all that we do. Given the breadth of subject matter and teams this role will support, the successful candidate must be versatile, adaptable, and personable to effectively impact and influence business initiatives and our expanding compliance program.

Job Responsibilities

Leverage data and data analytics to inform risk profiling and strategic decision-making regarding areas of compliance focus and priority 
Prepare detailed compliance reports and presentations (including statistical analysis of issue reporting and risk assessments) for submission to management, the Board of Directors, and government agencies, as necessary 
Develop tools and programs to analyze data and internal/industry trends that will improve compliance programming and target areas of greatest need for additional (or re-allocated) resourcing 
Analyze patterns of stakeholder outreach and similar business activity to address redundancies via the development of education/training materials and targeted communications 
Apply knowledge and understanding of applicable healthcare laws and regulations to understand obligations, including requirements and prohibitions, imposed on athenahealth by legislative frameworks 
Work directly with stakeholders and subject matter experts to implement compliance program strategy and recommendations informed by various assessments, audits, and analytics 
Working with Security to understand and improve the Company’s overarching controls framework and mitigate both regulatory and business risk through application of reasonable physical, administrative, and technical safeguards 
Partnering with Procurement and applicable business units to ensure appropriate review of vendors, subcontractors and business partners prior to engagement and effective monitoring after onboarding 
Supporting Product and Business Development teams by communicating and integrating core compliance philosophies and principles into strategic initiatives and long-term business planning 
Engaging with Internal Audit to build out an oversight and monitoring program covering business functions and operations presenting material risk to the Company 
Coordinating with Legal to ensure inclusion of appropriate and consistent contractual provisions that mitigate risk and potential exposure to athenahealth arising from various business relationships. 
Manage and oversee a steady volume of internal compliance reports/questions submitted to the Compliance team to successful resolution, including supervision and project management over complex cases requiring cross-functional support from various business units 
Produce solutions to unique questions that support corporate strategy and ensure athenahealth service offering compliance 
Develop and coordinate multifaceted educational compliance training programs 
Independently investigate and act on compliance issues, including internal investigations and any resulting corrective actions 

Education, Experience, & Skills Required: 

3-5 years’ experience at a technology company and/or in a healthcare compliance program or equivalent 
Bachelor’s degree 
Strong organizational and time management skills, with the ability and willingness to spend the time necessary to meet demanding deadlines and adjust to shifting priorities 
Team-oriented attitude and willingness to support the greater Compliance and Legal functions 
Commitment to learning and openness to alternative ideas and perspectives 
Ability to think creatively and strategically, employing both business acumen and compliance knowledge 

Additional Qualifications Preferred (but not Required): 

Development of company policy documents and experience applying those policy and related legal requirements to concerns of non-compliance 
Experience responding to requests or inquiries from government agencies, programs, or other authorities 
Familiarity with information security standards and frameworks (i.e., NIST Privacy and Security), best practices for securing health information systems, and applicable laws and regulations 
Familiarity with HIPAA requirements, compliance obligations, and investigations 
Ability to work collaboratively with a cross-functional team and adapt quickly to changing circumstances, subject matters, and team dynamics 

About Athenahealth

Here’s our vision: To create a thriving ecosystem that delivers accessible, high-quality, and sustainable healthcare for all. 

What’s unique about our locations?

From an historic, 19th century arsenal to a converted, landmark power plant, all of athenahealth’s offices were carefully chosen to represent our innovative spirit and promote the most positive and productive work environment for our teams. Our 10 offices across the United States and India — plus numerous remote employees — all work to modernize the healthcare experience, together.

Our Company Culture Might Be Our Best Feature.

We don't take ourselves too seriously. But our work? That’s another story. athenahealth develops and implements products and services that support US healthcare: It’s our chance to create healthier futures for ourselves, for our family and friends, for everyone.

Our vibrant and talented employees — or athenistas, as we call ourselves — spark the innovation and passion needed to accomplish our goal. We continue to expand our workforce with amazing people who bring diverse backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives at every level, and foster an environment where every athenista feels comfortable bringing their best selves to work.

Our size makes a difference, too: We are small enough that your individual contributions will stand out — but large enough to grow your career with our resources and established business stability.

Giving back is integral to our culture. Our athenaGives platform strives to support food security, expand access to high-quality healthcare for all, and support STEM education to develop providers and technologists who will provide access to high-quality healthcare for all in the future. As part of the evolution of athenahealth’s Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR) program, we’ve selected nonprofit partners that align with our purpose and let us foster long-term partnerships for charitable giving, employee volunteerism, insight sharing, collaboration, and cross-team engagement.  

What can we do for you?

Along with health and financial benefits, athenistas enjoy perks specific to each location, including commuter support, employee assistance programs, tuition assistance, employee resource groups, and collaborative workspaces — some offices even welcome dogs.

In addition to our traditional benefits and perks, we sponsor events throughout the year, including book clubs, external speakers, and hackathons. And we provide athenistas with a company culture based on learning, the support of an engaged team, and an inclusive environment where all employees are valued.

We also encourage a better work-life balance for athenistas with our flexibility. While we know in-office collaboration is critical to our vision, we recognize that not all work needs to be done within an office environment, full-time. With consistent communication and digital collaboration tools, athenahealth enables employees to find a balance that feels fulfilling and productive for each individual situation.

athenahealth is committed to a policy of equal employment opportunity—that’s why we recruit and hire applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy), national origin, disability, age, sexual orientation, veteran status, genetic information, gender identity, gender expression, or any other factor prohibited by law. We’re happy to provide a reasonable accommodation, for those with a disability, to complete any part of the application process. If you are unable to access or use this online application process and need an alternative method for applying, please contact us at taoperations@athenahealth.com for assistance.

https://www.athenahealth.com/careers/equal-opportunity

About the job
Brief Description: The Regulatory Compliance Officer will be responsible to assist in the development and administration of regulatory implementation, regulatory examination and inquiry management, and annual risk assessment, among other duties in connection with the regulatory obligations of Mizuho entities registered as Swap Dealers (SD), Security Based Swap Dealers (SBSD), and OTC Derivatives Dealers (OTCDD).

Responsibilities. The individual in this role will be responsible to:
Participate in the evaluation of new and amended regulations, primarily with respect to CFTC, SEC, and NFA SD and SBSD regulations, for applicability to Mizuho Capital Markets LLC and its US affiliates.

About the job
Company: KARL STORZ Endoscopy-America, Inc. (KSEA)

Job Code: 13563

Description

KARL STORZ SE & Co. KG based in Tuttlingen, Germany, is a family-owned, global company committed to benefiting humanity by advancing medical technology through innovation and education.

For more than 75 years, KARL STORZ has been dedicated to earning its international reputation as a leader that designs, engineers, manufactures, and markets all its products with an emphasis on visionary design, precision craftsmanship, and clinical effectiveness.

KARL STORZ SE & Co. KG based in Tuttlingen, Germany, is a family-owned, global company committed to benefiting humanity by advancing medical technology through innovation and education.

Formorethan75years,KARLSTORZhasbeendedicatedtoearningitsinternationalreputationasaleader thatdesigns,engineers,manufactures,andmarketsallitsproductswithanemphasisonvisionarydesign, precision craftsmanship, and clinicaleffectiveness.

This position is open to be remote or may be based in our El Segundo, CA location.

Job Summary/Profile

If you are an experienced compliance professional looking for a new challenge to help envision and drive the development and enhancement of a compliance program, if you seek the unique experience of working for a growth-oriented MedTech company with visionary leaders, then this job opportunity is for you!

A highly engaging and growth-oriented opportunity to help define the vision for KARL STORZ Compliance organization in the Americas. The Senior Director will be responsible for planning, leading, and executing a variety of complex business initiatives. The right candidate will be able to effectively leverage project and change management techniques to produce results that meet the needs of KARL STORZ. The Senior Director will report to the Chief Compliance Officer for the Americas and will partner with cross-functional leaders and global stakeholders to drive a culture of compliance.

You will also work with the Company’s experienced Compliance and Legal teams to drive innovative and key compliance initiatives across the organization. The Senior Director, Compliance will have routine exposure to, and an opportunity to partner with, members of the Executive Management Team, as well as key senior business and functional leaders.

Working with the Chief Compliance Officer Americas, the Senior Director will support Karl Storz’s overall compliance program enhancement and be responsible for ensuring all requirements are met through the ongoing expansion of our current program, including compliance with various legal and regulatory requirements (e.g., False Claims Act, Anti-kickback Statute, etc.) and industry Codes (e.g., AdvaMed Code) and agency guidance (e.g., OIG Model Compliance Program Guidance). You will also be responsible for driving and/or overseeing critical operational components of the Compliance Program - including driving the continued development and management of our data analytics and compliance monitoring program, as well as our transparency and disclosure program; overseeing the continued enhancement of our compliance policies, procedures and associated training; leading the effort to collaborate with the business on operational excellence initiatives; oversee follow-up on matters reported through the company’s Hotline; continuously identify potential areas of compliance vulnerability and risk, and opportunities for enhanced training, and develop and implement corrective action plans as necessary; and oversee the investigation of allegations of violations of policy or misconduct (conduct/coordinate investigations; communicate findings to the appropriate senior leadership as necessary).

Duties And Responsibilities

You will be a seasoned professional that is comfortable and experienced with working in a dynamic environment that can change quickly; is a progressive thinker about compliance, evolving risk and appropriate controls; embraces innovation and creativity to advance compliance in a “right-fit” way for the business; prefers to roll-up-sleeves and do the operational and tactical work required to build out the foundation of the program; is open and eager to collaborate with other Compliance and Legal colleagues daily on compliance and risk management matters; and wants to make a positive impact to the developing culture of the Company.

Specific Responsibilities Will Include, But Not Be Limited To

 Demonstrate acumen to collaborate, drive results, and influence cross-organizational stakeholders and decision makers with different operational and jurisdictional responsibilities.
 Support the U.S. compliance program in line with the OIG Compliance Program Guidance, the AdvaMed Code and regulatory guidance and industry better practices
 Establish and oversee the development, drafting, implementation and roll-out of policies, procedures, SOPs, compliance controls and systems to foster compliance with healthcare fraud and abuse, transparency reporting laws, as well as industry codes, such as the Food, Drug and Cosmetics Act (FDCA), Federal Anti-kickback Statute, Federal False Claims Act, U.S. Sunshine Act and state transparency laws
 Develop and implement a comprehensive compliance training program and associated technology to promote compliance with applicable policies, laws, and regulations (i.e., new employee, all employee, management team, functional)
 Work cross-functionally to help identify and drive implementation of key technology solutions
 Provide compliance oversight and participate, as required, in review and approval processes for core commercial and medical activities, such as initiatives involving interactions with healthcare professionals, healthcare organizations and patients/advocacy groups
 Design and execute an annual monitoring program, including the use of data analytics; develop and disseminate periodic reports for the functions and leadership teams; leverage the monitoring results and metrics to enhance the compliance infrastructure and controls
 Institute and maintain effective compliance communication channels for the Company by promoting awareness of the Code of Conduct, the use of the Compliance Hotline, as well other means for employees to report compliance-related concerns or engage with senior leadership
 Monitor the corrective action plans agreed to by the functions, as applicable, to ensure timely completion
 Prepare quarterly compliance reports for the Chief Compliance Officer to present to the EMT to provide assurance related to the effectiveness of the Compliance Program
 Support the design, management, and execution an annual compliance workplan, including functional objectives, strategic priorities and operating budget, and design and document metrics to assess the compliance workplan and program
 Other duties as assigned by the Chief Compliance Officer relevant supporting the Compliance Program.

Minimum Qualifications

 Undergraduate degree required
 12+ years’ work experience in Compliance or Legal function, preferably in the medical device, pharmaceutical or life science industry
 Knowledge of and experience with laws, regulations, and industry guidance that affect the medical device, pharmaceutical, or life science industry including global aggregate spend and other federal or state reporting/transparency laws, fraud and abuse laws, OIG, and AdvaMed and/or PhRMA Code compliance standards and requirements
 Experience with managing and executing transformational projects with cross-organizational stakeholders and decision makers
 Appropriate judgment to liaise with Legal and business colleagues and/or external counsel as needed
 Strong influencing skills: proven track record and experience building and cultivating relationships with key partners and stakeholders across organizational levels
 Ability to work under fast-paced conditions, comfortable making decisions and demonstrates good judgment
 Must have demonstrated high EQ and client-service orientation; able to recognize and respond quickly and pragmatically to urgent situations and demanding clients
 Strong process-orientation: has proven effectiveness in identifying, developing and implementing scalable/sustainable process and other continuous improvements to achieve organizational efficiencies and increase effectiveness
 Strong executive presence and confidence to present to senior/executive leadership
 Committed team player while taking initiative to get results with minimal supervision
 People management experience

Preferred Qualifications

 JD preferred
 Certified in Healthcare Compliance (CHC)

About the job
Who We Are

For over 20 years, SPINS has been a leader in recognizing the transformative power of data in retail. We offer our clients cutting-edge tools to attract attention from a fast-growing segment within the Health & Wellness industry, the values-based consumer. Nearly half of shoppers prioritize products that emphasize wellness, social responsibility, and sustainable practices. SPINS retail consumer insights, analytics, and consulting services give our clients a competitive advantage to increase their share of this growing market. Our data is the most comprehensive and accurate in the industry, allowing clients to power AI models and machine learning algorithms that help them better understand and meet their customers' needs. At SPINS, behind all of our impressive data is our real differentiator, our people. We pride ourselves on our collaborative, flexible, and communicative culture that puts people at the center of everything we do.

The in-house legal team manages all legal items related to our business, from contracting to litigation to compliance with laws. We work with all areas of the business and get a good view of how all aspects of SPINS operate. Our team focuses primarily on supporting our sales and retail teams in negotiating contracts with our clients and retailers, while also supporting our legal entities, intellectual property, insurance, real estate, and M&A. Due to growth, our team will also support strategic initiatives, new products, data privacy and security, litigation and other high impact, long-term projects.

SPINS is adding a Corporate Counsel to the team. The Corporate Counsel is an integral part of SPINS’ legal team and a trusted business partner. This individual will be part of a three-lawyer team that acts as counsel to management and handles a variety of legal matters. The Corporate Counsel provides day-to-day advice and guidance to help each business segment meet its objectives through a deep understanding of the business, knowledge of the laws and regulations applicable to the business, and sound judgment and analytical skills. This individual will provide guidance on a wide range of legal matters as well as mitigate legal risks. In addition to leading various projects, this unique entry-level role will provide exposure to various fields of law, including but not limited to intellectual property, privacy, employment law, real estate, insurance, mergers and acquisitions, and corporate law.

Are you ready for a dynamic learning experience that will serve as a launch pad for your career? If you are based in Chicago, please apply.

What You Will Do

We value strong writing and interpersonal skills, the ability to set priorities and adapt to changes, meet deadlines, and lead multiple projects. Our attorneys benefit from a culture of teamwork, integrity, and respect, providing a comfortable team environment filled with energetic and knowledgeable professionals. The successful candidate will be an effective advocate with excellent writing skills who is prepared for more hands-on experience. We value in-person office relationships and all individuals on the team can expect a reasonable workload.

Take primary accountability for advising sales and retailer recruiting, which includes negotiating contracts as well as the designing and drafting of form commercial, data licensing, SaaS, and non-disclosure agreements
Proactively identify legal risks within the business and initiate practical solutions to mitigate those risks
Identify process improvements to effectively mitigate and manage legal business risks, reduce outside legal costs, improve quality of service, and ensure compliance with SPINS’ legal requirements
Own corporate administration of our various legal entities
Keep abreast of legal and regulatory developments impacting the business and provide training, communication, and advice to management and coworkers regarding such developments
Anticipate, counsel, and manage disputes
Provide legal guidance on diverse regulatory and compliance matters
Actively support and manage policy development and implementation
Assist in the management of intellectual property matters
Assist with mergers and acquisitions activity
Support drafting and negotiation of strategic agreements
Serve as a legal-business advisor to help define the structure of complex contracts
Assist SPINS’ General Counsel with regard to compliance and litigation matters
Lead special projects and other matters as needed to assist the General Counsel

Other Responsibilities

 Provide leadership and guidance to help the business meet its objectives through a deep understanding of each business segment and the application of laws/regulations to those segments
Establish rapport and build positive working relationships with business unit management and coworkers at all levels to ensure collaboration
Provide a broad array of legal advice to all business segments, including support in a variety of compliance matters
Collaborate with and advise various internal clients and departments, such as Finance, Sales, Marketing, and HR

What You Bring

2-3 years of significant legal experience within a corporation or law firm
Licensed to practice law in Illinois
Corporate, commercial, and compliance legal experience required
Successful in partnering with and effectively advising business clients on a wide array of matters, balancing strategic and tactical issues
Work autonomously, issue spot, and provide incisive, practical, and business-focused advice and counsel
Able to resolve complex legal issues in a practical manner and to grasp creative/complex business ideas and express them clearly and concisely in a written product
Able to juggle competing priorities and adjust priorities as the business requires
Strong written and verbal communication skills, including the ability to draft and revise efficient and clear legal provisions, clearly and concisely articulate complex legal concepts to non-lawyers and to interact with stakeholders of all levels, including senior management
Detail-oriented, well-organized, and able to manage time efficiently
Strong interpersonal skills; a team player able to deal effectively with individuals at all levels and across business units
Ability to deliver well-organized, clear presentations in groups and in one-on-one meetings
Prior experience maintaining discretion and confidentiality
Ability to communicate and work effectively within the legal department and across business units.

And We Give Bonus Points For

Data licensing experience a plus.
SaaS contract experience a plus.

What SPINS Offers

We have enjoyed tremendous growth over the years and, as a leader in a fast-growing industry, we have no plans to slow down! While all that growth brings excitement, it is also an opportunity for SPINS to show it values the health and wellness of its team members. Whether you are based at our Chicago headquarters or remote, we continue to stay true to SPINS:

We embrace hybrid and remote work options so that you have the flexibility to create a work/life balance that actually works!
Virtual yoga, HIIT, meditation classes, and “team SPINS” Peloton rides
Each employee is allotted paid time to use to volunteer with an organization of their choice and charitable donations are matched.
CEO Connect, a monthly informal small group Q&A session with our top leader 
Semi-annual company-wide survey that is used to shape company programs, perks, and culture.

The SPINS Way

Direct – We communicate with clarity, honesty and respect in all situations and embrace opportunities to provide solution-oriented feedback.
Determined – We are committed to overcoming all obstacles to achieve results. We adapt to change, seek opportunities to learn and rapidly translate that learning into action.
Passionate – We go above and beyond to help our partners achieve their goals. We challenge assumptions and are comfortable forging new paths.
Collaborative – We leave our egos at the door, believing that working together we will produce an outcome that’s greater than each individual contribution.

For details about the information SPINS’s collects about our applicants and how we use it, please see the SPINS Privacy Policy here.

About the job
JOB TITLE: Grants Manager LOCATION: San Antonio, TX FULL/PART TIME: Full-time w/Benefits
Job Description
SUMMARY: The main objective of the Grants Manager position is to manage, analyze, and implement all components of grants processing, including IRS compliance, grantmaking requirements, data entry, and reporting of data. The Grants Manager will work closely with the Chief Operating Officer (COO) and President to implement the Foundations’ mission.
DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
• Track and review grant proposals and progress reports for three grant cycles per year.
• Conduct due diligence of grantees, including reviewing all applications and progress reports for completeness and compliance for red flags around IRS status/IRS regulations and financial health.
• Receive and enter grants data into grants management system and online filing system while ensuring integrity of data, in accordance with legal and regulatory requirements as well as with the Foundations’ own processes and requirements.
• Review and analyze prospective grantee financial statements, organizational budgets, management, facilities, and organizational practices.
• Perform a predetermined number of site visits to grantee organizations per each grant cycle with a NCF Board Member.
• Schedule payments, including grant awards and installments.
• Review progress report budget to ensure that grantee expenditures are consistent with the
approved grant budget.
• Establish and maintain the Foundation’s central grant files for completeness of each grant record, from initial request to grant close-out.
• Provide administrative support and technical assistance to prospective and current grantees and serve as a key point of contact for grantees around grant-related issues.
• Responsible for maintaining the foundation website and social media pages.
• Assists in the preparation of materials for Board meetings.
• Work with the COO and President to develop or revise applications and grantee report formats to ensure data can be tracked in grants management software and in preparation of the Foundation’s Annual Statistics.

• Produce regular and ad hoc grantmaking reports and perform data analysis as needed.
• Conduct ongoing grants administration and research, including analyses of the nonprofit sector, while keeping up to date of significant developments and trends in fields pertaining to the Foundation’s mission.
QUALIFICATIONS AND EXPERIENCE:
• Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience in Business related field preferred.
• Minimum 3 - 5 years’ experience in grants management, including knowledge and understanding of best practices in grant making, grant writing, and current IRS regulations as they relate to private non-profit foundations and compliance or equivalent experience in a Business-related field directly working with non-profit organizations. Required.
KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES:
• Ability to multi-task, prioritize, and follow through to effectively manage work and meet multiple deadlines.
• Possess a high level of attention to detail, strong organizational and critical thinking skills, and, at the same time, ability to think broadly and analyze trends.
• Demonstrates excellent interpersonal, verbal, and written communication skills, with the ability to communicate complex technical, budgetary, and grants administration details to grantees, and Board members.
• Proven abilities in analysis, database management, and data reporting; Working knowledge of Blackbaud GrantMaking online system, a plus.
• Excellent research, writing, and editing skills, with attention to detail required.
• Proficient in Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Outlook; with advanced skills in developing
Word forms/templates, Adobe Acrobat forms, and manipulating data in Excel.
• Ability to maintain a positive and professional work environment.
• MUST be able to maintain a HIGH Level of Confidentiality.
• Perform other duties as assigned; including but not limited to administrative tasks and other projects.
WORK ENVIRONMENT:
• Must flourish working in a small office group setting.
