About the job
Description

Looking for an opportunity to make an impact?

Unleash your potential at Leidos, where we deliver innovative solutions through the efforts of our diverse and talented people who are dedicated to our customer’s success. We empower our teams, contribute to our communities, and operate sustainably. Everything we do is built on a commitment to do the right thing for our customers, our people, and our community. Our Mission, Vision, and Values guide the way we do business.

If this sounds like an environment where you can thrive, keep reading!

Are you tired of feeling overworked and unfulfilled? Do you crave a better work-life balance that allows you to pursue your passions and enjoy your downtime? At Leidos, we understand the importance of a healthy work-life balance. Say goodbye to those 60+ hour work weeks and join us in exploring our exciting job opportunities.

We are in search of a dynamic and talented candidate to join our team of experts in creating innovative, all-encompassing solutions for our programs. In this role, you will gain invaluable skills such as time and task management, critical thinking and problem solving, and the ability to convey complex issues concisely and with ease. You'll thrive in a fast-paced and diverse environment, enjoy flexible working arrangements, and work with a management team that prioritizes your career growth and development.

If you're up for the challenge, join the NISC IV program at Leidos and become an Environmental Regulation Compliance Analyst! As a part of our Civil Group, you will support the Western Service Area (WSA) Operations Support Group by ensuring compliance with various federal, state, and local laws and federal regulations through evaluations, analysis, and thorough review of documentation. You will have the opportunity to provide advice and interpretation regarding the National Environmental Policy Act (NEPA) on federal actions that affect the National Airspace System (NAS).

Don't miss out on this incredible opportunity to work with some of the best and brightest minds in the industry. Take your career to the next level with Leidos, and apply today!

Your greatest work is ahead!

The Mission 

Leidos Civil Group helps modernize infrastructure, systems, and security. We are a trusted partner to both government and highly-regulated commercial customers looking for transformative solutions in mission IT, security, software, engineering, and operations. We work with our customers including the FAA, DOE, NASA, National Science Foundation, Transportation Security Administration, Custom and Border Protection, airports, and electric utilities to make the world safer, healthier, and more efficient. Our customers take on the toughest challenges out there, and at times need a helping hand from specialists in their fields. We combine our scale as a Fortune 500 company with the deep technical knowledge of our core capabilities and the expertise of our talented and diverse workforce to deliver mission-centric innovations. For each of these core capabilities, we have developed proven, repeatable processes that help us deliver agile, cost-effective solutions to foster a better world. To explore and learn more, click here!

Join our team and discover a culture of collaboration, innovation, diversity, trust, caring management, communication transparency, work-life balance, and overall job satisfaction. Share your resume with us today!

The Challenge

Provide Subject Matter Expertise (SME) support between Airports, Air Traffic facilities, and the FAA for environmental issues resulting from proposed actions triggering NEPA application.
Evaluate the potential environmental impacts associated with proposed actions involving air traffic routing or flight path changes. Heavy emphasis on noise impacts resulting from these changes.
Provide SME support for appropriate level of environmental documentation in the form of Categorical Exclusion (CatEx), Environmental Assessment (EA), or Environmental Impact Statement (EIS) on FAA initiated actions.
Coordinate and draft written responses to environmental analysis resulting from requests for changes to traffic routing or flight path changes.
Coordinate final NEPA documents including CatEx, EA, or EIS, and associated Finding of No Significant Impact (FONSI) or Record of Decision (ROD) for projects requiring NEPA application.

What Sets You Apart

Must be able to work onsite in Des Moines, WA. (Temporary remote work OR when asked to return to the office). Partial telework potential with Manager's approval. 
Experience writing or reviewing environmental documents, including but not limited to Categorical Exclusions (CATEX), Environmental Assessments (EA), and/or Environmental Impact Statements (EIS).
Experience reviewing all environmental impact categories.
Working knowledge and proficiency utilizing Microsoft Office applications, including: MS Word, MS Excel, MS Office, and MS PowerPoint.
Ability to obtain Public Trust security clearance.
Ability to quickly learn and apply business processes and techniques.
Bachelor's degree with 4 years of prior relevant experience OR Masters and 2 years prior relevant experience OR additional years of relevant experience in lieu of degree may be considered/accepted.

You Might Also Have

Ability to translate complex data/information into concise written documents for a non-technical audience.
Experience with FAA or aviation-related programs.
Ability to plan, initiate, organize, and prioritize work independently.
Experience with database management, KSN websites, and MS Excel.
Highly developed presentation skills, self-motivated and proactive team player, excellent written and oral communication skills, and proficiency using MS Office software is desired.

At Leidos, the opportunities are boundless. We challenge our staff with interesting assignments that provide them with an opportunity to thrive, professionally and personally. For us, helping you grow your career is good business. We’d like to learn more about you, apply today!

Pay Range

Pay Range $66,300.00 - $102,000.00 - $137,700.00

The Leidos pay range for this job level is a general guideline only and not a guarantee of compensation or salary. Additional factors considered in extending an offer include (but are not limited to) responsibilities of the job, education, experience, knowledge, skills, and abilities, as well as internal equity, alignment with market data, applicable bargaining agreement (if any), or other law.

About Biologics Testing Solutions

With more than 50 years of experience and proven regulatory expertise, the Charles River Biologics group can address challenging projects for biotechnology and pharmaceutical companies worldwide. Offering a variety of services such as contamination and impurity testing, protein characterization, bioassays, viral clearance studies and stability and lot release programs, we support clients throughout the biologic development cycle, from the establishment and characterization of cell banks through preclinical and clinical studies to marketed products. Whether clients need stand-alone services, a unique package of testing, or insourced support, our Biologics group can create a custom solution to suit their needs. Each year more than 20,000 biologic testing reports are sent each and over 200 licenses products are supported by our biologics testing solutions team.

About Charles River

Charles River is an early-stage contract research organization (CRO). We have built upon our foundation of laboratory animal medicine and science to develop a diverse portfolio of discovery and safety assessment services, both Good Laboratory Practice (GLP) and non-GLP, to support clients from target identification through preclinical development. Charles River also provides a suite of products and services to support our clients’ clinical laboratory testing needs and manufacturing activities. Utilizing this broad portfolio of products and services enables our clients to create a more flexible drug development model, which reduces their costs, enhances their productivity and effectiveness to increase speed to market.

With over 20,000 employees within 110 facilities in over 20 countries around the globe, we are strategically positioned to coordinate worldwide resources and apply multidisciplinary perspectives in resolving our client’s unique challenges. Our client base includes global pharmaceutical companies, biotechnology companies, government agencies and hospitals and academic institutions around the world.

At Charles River, we are passionate about our role in improving the quality of people’s lives. Our mission, our excellent science and our strong sense of purpose guide us in all that we do, and we approach each day with the knowledge that our work helps to improve the health and well-being of many across the globe. We have proudly supported the development of 86% of the drugs approved by the FDA in 2021.

FLSA Compliance Specialist
We are currently seeking a FLSA Compliance Specialist to join our team. 

Summary
This position is responsible for assisting Insperity clients in their compliance efforts concerning Department of Labor (DOL) guidelines governing exempt/non-exempt classification issues under the Fair Labor Standards Act, specific state laws regulating wage and hour issues, and administrative decisions.

Essential Functions
Under general supervision and moderate decision-making:
Provides FLSA (wage and hour) review service for Middle Market and Emerging Growth clients with 50 or more worksite employees to assist with clients" compliance with FLSA and similar state laws and regulations.

Provides support, resource information to internal service providers, supervisors, and managers regarding requirements for compliance with FLSA as it relates to exempt/non-exempt issues.

Researches federal and state requirements regarding job classifications, payment of wages, and overtime compensation.
Participates in the escalation process with manager to resolve client issues with FLSA Service.

About the job
The Manager, Compliance & Quality Assurance, serves as a key subject matter expert and lead for DAOU’s federal and state regulatory activities in the areas of wine production, alcohol sales, distribution, and tasting room operations. This position is responsible for auditing wine activity and raw material data entry, tracking and tracing multi-tier wine lots from harvest to bottling, coordinating data entry corrections, and facilitating federal, state, and local report preparation.

Core Responsibilities

Records & Reporting

Prepare all federal and state regulatory reports accurately, on time, and in collaboration with third-party partners as applicable. 
Compose and maintain reports for annual production, wine lot gains and losses, ShipCompliant activities, and other statistical and analytical information, including reports about our compliance and quality assurance efforts. 
Oversee all federal, state, and local permit updates for all facilities, including changes at current sites, the addition of new sites, basic permit updates, letterhead applications, etc. 
File for all county fictitious business names when required. 
File for all TTB permit amendments like trade name additions and corporate officer or director changes. 
Apply for, maintain, and renew all licenses, registrations, and as needed to support operations of the company. 
Facilitate monthly California Winegrower’s, and semi-monthly TTB excise tax returns for all production facilities. 
Maintain all records and documentation in an organized, appropriate, and easily accessible way. 

Inspection, Review, & Audit

Assist with internal and external audits to ensure adherence to compliance and quality standards and regulations.
Assist as needed with the internal label approval process, COLA, and TTB submissions.
Perform daily and weekly wine lot data entry tracking and traceability; ensure software transactions are performed accurately and timely. 
Perform data entry audits by wine tiers to ensure accuracy and completeness. 
Develop, review, and recommend policies and practices to improve efficiencies and comply with local, state, and federal regulations pertaining to related areas of responsibility; recommend revisions to existing policies to ensure compliance with applicable laws. 
Collaborate with departments to ensure compliance needs and gaps are prioritized, identified, and addressed; advise internal stakeholders on regulatory and compliance matters. 
Perform other related duties as assigned. 

Regulations & Agency Coordination

Serve as key point of contact internally and with our third-party compliance partner to ensure the company complies with all regulatory requirements for all of the various company federal and state licenses. 
Engage with third-party consultants, service providers, and government agencies to resolve compliance issues as needed. 
Be well-versed and knowledgeable in federal and state regulations for wine and spirits. 
Stay abreast of upper acceptable quality limitations (AQLs) for all supply materials. 

Requirements

Must be at least 21 years old. 
Bachelor's degree in relevant field. 
Certification for quality control (such as ISO 9000) is a plus. 
1–2 years’ experience in the principles and practices of compliance, quality management, and quality assurance, preferably in the wine industry. 

Success Factors & Preferred Skills

Strong analytical skills and attention to detail, significant experience with QA and compliance methodologies and standards, and ability to create and evaluate data and statistical information. 
Ability to solve complex problems while managing changing priorities and issues. 
Exercise sound, independent judgment within established policy guidelines. 
Understanding, interpreting, and applying laws and regulations. 
Extraordinary interpersonal skills for establishing and maintaining positive and effective working relationships with agencies, department teams, and individuals. 
Excellent written and verbal communication skills. 
Strong self-management skills, with the added ability to take initiative, multi-task, be innovative and work under pressure. 

Working Conditions

Regular working schedule to include weekdays, and some evenings. 
Long and irregular hours during peak seasons and special events or audits. 
Requires local travel to and from production locations and may require limited travel on an as needed basis for locations outside of local area. Local area is defined as no greater than 45 miles from Company headquarters.
Must be able to lift at least 45 lbs. 
Sitting for long periods of time (8 hours per day). 
Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. 

Benefits

401K, Medical, Dental, Vision, Life.

About City Parks Foundation

At City Parks Foundation (CPF), we are dedicated to invigorating and transforming New York City parks into dynamic, vibrant centers of urban life through arts, environmental education, sports, and community building programs for all New Yorkers. Our ethos is simple: we believe thriving parks mean thriving communities.

Community engagement includes Partnerships for Parks, a public-private program of City Parks Foundation and NYC Parks, which supports and champions a growing network of community leaders who care and advocate for the transformation of our neighborhood parks and the Parks and Open Space Partners-NYC coalition of conservancies and alliances. We also administer the NYC Green Fund, a regranting program for parks and open space nonprofits and grassroots organizations.

We produce SummerStage, the iconic free, outdoor performing arts festival in NYC, presenting world-class artists from across the globe and our own neighborhoods on our mainstage in Central Park and in local parks in all five boroughs, and our Swedish Cottage Marionette Theatre and roving PuppetMobile present marionette puppet theater throughout New York City.

We connect youngsters to nature in the urban environment through progressive, experiential teaching. Using parks as classrooms, we provide learning experiences and hands-on activities in urban forests, coastal areas, and gardens.

Free golf, tennis, track & field, soccer, and fitness programs bring high-quality instruction and equipment into areas where few organized athletic opportunities exist. We offer leveled training, year-round scholarship coaching, and special pro events.

We are a small but rapidly growing mortgage surplus recovery company and we are looking for an experienced attorney for a full-time position. Our clients are individuals or heirs of those who have recently gone through foreclosure; we assist them in recovering the surplus funds to which they are rightfully entitled as a result of the foreclosure. About the job
About UTB

As a Texas business bank focused on our clients, our mission is to provide creative and responsive solutions to help our clients achieve financial success. The strength of UTB is based on our ability to listen and react to our customer’s needs in a timely, personal, and professional manner. UTB team members experience a collaborative environment where innovation and professionalism are highly esteemed.

Position Overview

We are currently hiring for a Digital Assets Compliance Analyst to work with our Digital Asset Compliance Director and the Chief Compliance Officer in managing our high-risk lines of business. This role focuses on cryptocurrency, international banking, and foreign correspondent banking. The ideal candidate has a background in the Risk Advisory world doing compliance testing, internal audit, or direct experience working with high-risk customers and state and federal examiners. Candidates will need experience working with money services businesses (MSBs), International Wire Transfers, Digital Assets, Virtual/Cryptocurrency, or Foreign Exchange. Additionally, candidates must excel in oral and written communication in this area and be adept at explaining complex regulatory requirements to senior-level management.

Position Description

The following position information is not meant to be all inclusive but rather highlights key components of the job:

Analyze and research customer account activity to identify suspicious transactions. 
Monitor, review, and research regulations and produce analytical reports that detail trends, patterns, and risk factors in customer transaction activity as it relates to incoming and outgoing international wire transfers, FX, and crypto compliance programs. 
Provide expert compliance and regulatory support pertaining to the Bank Secrecy Act (BSA), Anti-Money Laundering (AML), and the office of Foreign Assets Controls (OFAC) as well as identification of suspicious activity patterns, customer onboarding due diligence, Know Your Customer (KYC), and Customer Identification Program (CIP) requirement for high-risk customers, products, and services. 
Manage customer onboarding and ongoing BSA/AML processes for international wire transfers, digital asset product customers, and foreign correspondent financial institutions. 
Monitor OFAC & SAR reporting for international wire transfers and digital asset products. 
Stay current on industry and regulatory requirements and issues. 

Education & Experience

Bachelors degree, preferably in Accounting or Finance. 
Minimum 3 years’ experience preferably in one or more related field(s) including risk-advisory, banking, internal audit, regulatory compliance, BSA/AML Compliance, foreign correspondent banking, Money Service Business, fintech, and/or cryptocurrency-related businesses. 
Experience using automated BSA/AML monitoring systems preferred. 
Experience with and understanding of international payments, cryptocurrency, and wire transfers preferred. 

Skills & Attributes

Ability to quickly learn new concepts and demonstrate competence in a complex financial services environment. 
Creative, flexible, responsive, solutions-driven approach to problem solving. 
Possess a willingness and capability to work on a team (even as an individual contributor) and with other departments with minimal direction while meeting tight deadlines. 
Ability to exercise sound judgement when solving problems through researching and analyzing issues. 

Certifications

Certified Anti-Money Laundering Specialist CAMS (or Eligible) Preferred

Certified BSA/AML Professional (CBAP) Beneficial

Certified Internal Auditor (CIA) – Beneficial

Certified Regulatory Compliance Magner (CRCM) – Beneficial

Certified Global Sanctions Specialist (CGSS) - Beneficial

About the job
Job Description:
Regional bank located in Suffolk County Long Island is in search of a Director of BSA/AML Compliance

Summary: The Director of BSA/AML Compliance is the Board-designated BSA Officer and responsible for the supervision of the Bank’s BSA/AML/OFAC unit. BSA/AML responsibilities include providing the Chief Compliance Officer (“CCO”) and senior management with assurance that an effective, risk based BSA/AML/OFAC program exists designed to ensure compliance with all BSA/AML/OFAC laws and regulations. 
Responsibilities: 
Conduct BSA/AML/OFAC Risk Assessments as needed, and no less than annually, with consideration to products, services, customers, and geographies that may present BSA/AML/OFAC related risk; reporting such annually to management and the Board of Directors or a committee thereof. 
Develop, implement, maintain, and administer the Bank’s BSA/AML/OFAC compliance program, including but not limited to monitoring for cash activity, suspicious transactions, and customer identification program (“CIP”) and due diligence compliance as well as drafting and updating policies and procedures related to BSA/AML/OFAC compliance. 
Oversee and document the Bank’s Compliance with NYS DFS Transaction Monitoring and Filtering Requirements “Part 504” and coordinate the Bank’s annual certification. 
Review and update the BSA/AML/OFAC Policy and Cannabis Banking Policy no less than annually and submit them for Board approval. 
Direct BSA department staff in the course of their daily work regarding monitoring and reporting, ensuring staff is fulfilling all required functions in a timely, efficient, and effective manner. 
Perform and oversee quality assurance reviews of work performed by the BSA Department staff to ensure the accuracy of work performed. 
Oversee parameter tuning and periodic model validation for the Bank’s BSA/AML/OFAC software. 
Oversee various bank-wide quality assurance reviews and compliance monitoring in the areas of 
BSA/AML, CIP and Enhanced Due Diligence, and OFAC. 
Maintain collaborative alliances with all Bank business lines to ensure appropriate 
BSA/AML/OFAC risks and red flags are identified and communicated prior to implementation of 
new/changed products and services. 
Coordinate with the Training Department to ensure appropriate BSA/AML/OFAC compliance 
training for applicable staff throughout the Bank. 
Coordinate appropriate training for BSA Department staff to maintain a high level of knowledge 
of BSA/AML/OFAC compliance.

About the job
The Firm

XTX Markets is a leading algorithmic trading company partnering with counterparties, exchanges and e-trading venues globally to provide liquidity in the Equity, FX, Fixed Income, Commodity & Options markets. We provide consistent liquidity, helping market participants throughout the world obtain the best prices in the various assets classes we cover, regardless of changing market conditions.

At XTX Markets technology is our business and we are a diverse organisation which attracts outstanding talent from across all industry backgrounds. We are focused on teamwork and our people collaborate on all aspects of the business, working openly and with respect for each other, our clients and the market. Our culture is non-hierarchical and one where everyone is valued. We strive for excellence in everything we do.

The Role 

XTX is seeking a Compliance team member based in New York to contribute to the global compliance processes of the firm with a focus towards US regulatory requirements as we continue to grow and expand our US based offering. We are particularly interested in candidates with experience in Equity Options trading. 

The Compliance Officer will be a key member of the team supporting the Head of U.S. Compliance, the CCO and contributing to the global department’s mission in a variety of wide-ranging functions. The candidate will work collaboratively to administer the XTX compliance program, understand, and monitor the Firm’s trading activities, diligently monitor the regulatory horizon, and help to evaluate, implement and improve processes intended to meet regulatory requirements.

Responsibilities
  Provide compliance support for Equity & Options Trading
Developing written policies and procedures, with review and testing of existing
Provide advisory related to electronic non-discretionary trading Risk and IT on regulatory guidance and rules
Working with the global surveillance function
Acting as a point of contact for the business on matters relating to conduct compliance, employee compliance training
Monitoring the regulatory horizons for requirements that will impact XTX
Drafting and maintaining management information, internal briefings, processes, and procedures documentation
Rulebook and product reviews
Regulatory reporting
Collaboration with the XTX Legal Team and advising XTX’s businesses from a compliance/regulatory perspective

Essential Attributes
Approximately 5 to 10 years compliance experience. Particular interest in Options experience.
Experience with US equities trading compliance requirements and institutional brokerage
Experience in electronic trading, including an understanding of quantitative trading and the associated compliance control framework
Experience with regulatory reporting (CAT, 605, 13F, 13H, 17H), registrations (U4/5, Form BD), Written Supervisory Procedures (WSPs), internal inspections, books, and records requirements – all considered valuable
Knowledge of US rules relevant to proprietary and electronic equity trading including: Reg NMS, Reg SHO, Market Access Rule, CAT reporting, supervision – preferred
Experience with Swap Dealer regulation in the US including CFTC/NFA requirements – considered valuable
Ability to perform reviews of rulebooks and regulations to identify requirements applicable to the Firm’s businesses
Excellent communication skills. Ability to explain regulatory requirements clearly and concisely in both written and verbal formats
Experience working with exchanges and regulators would be beneficial
Proprietary trading, quant firm, bank, brokerage, or large asset management compliance experience is preferable
Ability to synthesise data, maintain detailed records and provide management reports
Technical experience including basic coding is desired but not strictly required

The base salary range for this role is between $175,000 to $225,000 depending on relevant job-related skills and experience. You will be eligible for participation in a discretionary annual performance bonus scheme and will enjoy a comprehensive package of benefits. All bonuses, benefits, and any sign-on payments are in addition to the base salary range stated.

About the job
COMPLIANCE MANAGER

Position Description

The Compliance Manager will foster an environment that enhances and promotes compliance and adherence to all relevant federal, state and local laws, rules and regulations applicable policies and procedures. The Compliance Manager will assist the Chief Compliance Officer with coordination and management of the compliance program including compliance hotline administration, management and development of the compliance workplan, coordination and management of Regulatory Compliance Committee and Management Compliance Committee meetings, and manage HIPAA and privacy program and serve as the Privacy Lead.

The Privacy Lead is responsible for the organization’s Privacy Program including but not limited to daily operations of the program, development, implementation, and maintenance of policies and procedures, monitoring program compliance, investigations and tracking of incidents and breaches and insuring patients’ rights are in compliance with federal and state laws.

Key Roles And Responsibilities

Builds a strategic and comprehensive privacy program that defines, develops, maintains and implements policies and processes that enable consistent, effective privacy practices which minimize risk and ensure the confidentiality of protected health information (PHI), paper and/or electronic, across all media types. Ensures privacy-related forms, policies, standards, and procedures are up-to-date.
Collaborates with in the information security officer to ensure alignment between security and privacy compliance programs including policies, practices, investigations, and acts as a liaison to the information systems department.
Conducts related ongoing HIPAA privacy compliance monitoring activities in coordination with the organization’s other compliance and operational assessment functions.
Takes a lead role, to ensure the organization has and maintains appropriate privacy and confidentiality consents, authorization forms and information notices and materials reflecting current organization and legal practice requirements.
Assists in the development, implementation, operation and oversight of the Compliance Program to promote adherence to laws, regulations and ethical business practices.
Oversee and maintain tracking system/compliance database for compliance related reports. Collect and summarize compliance and privacy monitoring checklists/activity from regional operations. Assist Compliance Officer with maintaining policies, procedures, training and tools. 
Works collaboratively to develop centralized resources and tools to standardize

compliance and achieve program effectiveness and efficiencies, where applicable.

Coordinates documentation, tracking and resolution of compliance/privacy matters

originating from internal or external sources. Assists with development of resource

tools for trends in inquiries and incidents.

Reviews education materials and supervise Compliance Specialist with coordination of

compliance education assignments and monitoring of completion. Collaborates with

various departments to ensure new hires are properly assigned for compliance training,

exclusion screening and other compliance related processes.

Prepares Compliance related reports and presentations and other communications for review by Chief Compliance Officer.
Oversee compliance hotline and collaborates with human resources to ensure the compliance hotline is monitored on a timely basis, investigations are completed timely and documented appropriately. Ensure all data is consistent and shared quarterly with MCC & RCC.
Assists Legal and Compliance team with requests from government agencies/contractors, management, employees and others, as necessary, to ensure an understanding of the organization’s compliance initiatives meet regulatory needs.
Coordinate requests from Compliance and Legal team from management, government agencies, internal audit testing of systems/controls and other needs. Assist Compliance Officer with validation of accuracy of information provided and drafting initial response.

Minimum Qualifications

Bachelor's Degree in Business Administration, Healthcare Administration or other related field OR equivalent education/experience.
Recommended privacy certification such as certified in Healthcare Privacy Compliance (CHPC) and/or other healthcare industry related credential.
A minimum of 5 years’ experience in healthcare compliance management. Background in health care, including health care regulatory and compliance. Knowledge of regulatory impact on multi-state/multi-unit health care operations.
Knowledge and professional experience in hotline operations, policy development, exclusion monitoring, etc.
High ethical standards and an appropriate professional demeanor
Ability to maintain confidentiality and navigate sensitive matters related to organization, employee and senior leadership situations
Ability to work collaboratively in team and partner well with others
Project Management skills
Strong communicator – verbal and written communication skills
Team player

This position is a driver and lead of the Enterprise-Wide Compliance Program including but not limited to Deposit, HMDA, Flood and Fair Lending (FL) Monitoring Programs and will assist in ensuring the bank complies with various lending-related state and federal regulatory requirements as well as bank designated policies, procedures, and practices. Being able to monitor and manage multiple outsourced 2nd Line of Defense (LOD) testing is key since most compliance 2nd LOD testing is performed by outsourced 3rd parties. This position will also potentially serve as the management succession position for becoming the next Chief Compliance Officer as the bank grows in asset size. 
 Key Responsibilities:
Act as a compliance lead, strategist and subject matter expert (SME) while assessing and advising on emerging compliance issues, with focus on fair lending. Also serves as a key contributor to the requirements and implementation of the Bank’s Governance and Enterprise Risk and Control framework related to fair lending and general consumer compliance. 
Leads mortgage compliance initiatives and maintains a strong working knowledge of the requirements of mortgage origination and fair lending regulations including but not limited to knowledge of HMDA, ECOA, FHA, FCRA, RESPA, TRID, Flood, TIS, Reg, CC, etc. 
Manage monthly outsourced HMDA processes to ensure 3rd parties perform timely data scrubs and monthly reporting. Lead annual submission of the loan application register (LAR) via RiskExec platform.
Manage and oversee all 2nd LOD testing on consumer deposit and lending sides, which is mostly outsourced to 3rd parties for efficiency and review testing findings and ensure appropriate corrective action from the lines of business are implemented. 
Work closely with Chief Compliance Officer and EVP of Mortgage Banking in identifying problems and/or solutions as it relates to ensuring compliance with Fair and Responsible Banking expectations. 
Attend Committee meetings for Residential Lending QC, Mortgage Servicing, etc. and evaluate for trends or systemic issues and Participate and lead aspects of the Compliance Committee, and attend other bank Committees as needed for the Chief Compliance Officer.
Lead in maintaining compliance policies, procedures, programs and risk assessments to ensure compliance with existing regulations and best practices, in collaboration with the Chief Compliance Officer. 
Monitors federal and state regulatory developments and maintain Regulatory Change Management, compliance risk assessments, and lead corrective action on any compliance audit and/or exam findings. 
Manage complaint log and work with business units for timely resolution of consumer complaints.
Assist with monitoring and geo-coding loans funded through area partners for fair lending and CRA along with maintenance of the CRA Program.
Learn and be responsible for annual NMLS licensing requirements 
Learn and maintain GRC tool Logicgate for Change Management, Regulatory Inventory, risk assessments and 2nd LOD testing matrixes 
Participate in regulatory examinations as needed with the Fed, FDIC, DOB, CFPB and assist with any correction action that is need throughout the Bank

 Professional Experience / Qualifications:
7-10 years compliance oversight and banking experience, required
CRCM required
RiskExec software experience, preferred 
3-5 years in managing and leading enterprise-wide mortgage compliance initiatives including maintaining risk assessments - fair lending experience, required
B.A/B.S. Degree from a four (4) year college, required.
Strong knowledge of banking and mortgage compliance regulations and requirements including but not limited to HMDA, ECOA, FHA, FCRA, FLOOD, TRID, RESPA, TIL, etc.
Ability to work independently, lead projects, etc. with minimal required supervision.
Strong language and communication skills with the ability to communicate clearly and concisely across with the Chief Compliance Officer, mortgage production, deposit operations and loan operations personnel and across multiple levels, foster open communication, and active listening with both internal and external stakeholders. 
The willingness to proactively lead, develop and participate in a culture of continuous improvement allowing the company to maintain effective compliance and organizational efficiency.

About the job
Job Title: Payroll & Labor Compliance Specialist
Job Summary:
We are seeking a detail-oriented and experienced Payroll & Labor Compliance Specialist to join our team. The specialist will play a crucial role in ensuring accurate and compliant payroll processing, as well as maintaining labor compliance within our organization. The successful candidate will possess in-depth knowledge of payroll processes, labor laws, and regulations to guarantee that our payroll operations adhere to legal requirements. The specialist will work closely with various departments to address payroll-related inquiries, resolve compliance issues, and implement best practices.
Responsibilities:
Payroll Processing: Manage end-to-end payroll processing for the organization, including but not limited to salary calculations, overtime, bonuses, benefits, and deductions. Ensure accurate and timely payroll generation while complying with local, state, and federal regulations.
Labor Compliance: Stay up to date with labor laws, regulations, and compliance requirements at the local, state, and federal levels. Develop and implement policies and procedures to ensure adherence to labor laws and regulations, including wage and hour laws, tax regulations, employment eligibility, and record-keeping requirements.
Record Keeping: Maintain accurate and confidential payroll records, employment contracts, and related documents. Ensure proper documentation and archiving of payroll and labor compliance records to facilitate audits and reporting.
Auditing and Reporting: Conduct regular audits to identify and rectify payroll discrepancies or non-compliance issues. Prepare payroll reports, tax filings, and other required documentation accurately and in a timely manner.
System Management: Collaborate with the HR and IT teams to maintain and optimize the payroll system, ensuring it aligns with business requirements and supports accurate payroll processing and labor compliance.
Employee Support: Respond to employee inquiries regarding payroll, tax, and labor-related matters. Provide guidance on payroll policies, procedures, and compliance requirements. Address and resolve employee concerns in a timely and professional manner.
Training and Communication: Develop and deliver training sessions or materials to educate employees and managers on payroll procedures, labor laws, and compliance requirements. Communicate updates and changes in payroll and labor regulations to relevant stakeholders.
Continuous Improvement: Identify opportunities to streamline and automate payroll processes while ensuring compliance. Recommend and implement improvements to enhance payroll efficiency, accuracy, and compliance.
Collaboration: Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including HR, Finance, and Legal, to ensure alignment and consistency in payroll and labor compliance practices.
Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in Human Resources, Accounting, Business Administration, or a related field.
Proven experience (X years) working in payroll administration, labor compliance, or a similar role.
In-depth knowledge of payroll processes, tax regulations, labor laws, and compliance requirements.
Familiarity with payroll software and systems; experience with ADP, Workday, or similar platforms is preferred.
Strong analytical skills and attention to detail to ensure accurate payroll calculations and compliance.
Excellent communication skills with the ability to explain complex payroll and labor compliance concepts to employees and stakeholders.
Ability to maintain confidentiality and handle sensitive payroll information with discretion.
Strong problem-solving and decision-making skills to address payroll discrepancies and compliance issues effectively.
High level of integrity and ethics with a commitment to upholding labor laws and regulations.
Professional certifications such as Certified Payroll Professional (CPP) or Certified Payroll Compliance Practitioner (PCP) are a plus.
Join our team as a Payroll & Labor Compliance Specialist and contribute to ensuring accurate payroll processing and maintaining labor compliance within our organization. Your expertise will be instrumental in promoting fair and compliant employment practices while supporting the success of our employees and our business.

About the job
Judge Advocates are commissioned officers within the Marine Corps whose responsibility is to uphold the law outlined by the Uniform Code of Military Justice as well as the core values of honor, courage, and commitment. Unlike many opportunities in the civilian sector, the Marine Corps allows Judge Advocates to immediately serve as first chair as prosecutors or defense counsel. Judge Advocates can further specialize in various fields of law such as military operational law, international law, cyber law, or criminal justice.The path to becoming a Marine Corps Judge Advocate begins with attending Officer Candidates School in Quantico, Virginia. First year and second year law students will attend paid training at Platoon Leaders Class during the summer for one 10-week session before returning to school. Third year law students and bar-certified lawyers will attend Officer Candidates Course for 10 weeks and immediately begin follow-on training upon accepting a commission as a Second Lieutenant.
 To apply, you must meet the below criteria:· US citizenship· Bachelor's degree from an accredited university· Currently attending or graduated from an ABA accredited Law School· 22+ on the ACT or 1000+ on the SAT· 2.0+ undergraduate GPA· 150+ on the LSAT (waiverable if below)· Younger than 42 by time of commissioning· Be able to become physically fit with no major health issuesBenefits to include:· Competitive salary· Quick promotion and career progression· Medical and dental insurance, to include family· Professional education courses· Opportunity to travel· Tax free housing and food allowances· 30 days of paid leave per year· All federal holidays off
For more information follow the below link or email me at joseph.guthmann@marines.usmc.mil.https://www.marines.com/about-the-marine-corps/roles/judge-advocate-division.html

About the job
Pricing and Compliance Officer’s primary role is to provide support to Pact’s Business Development team in the delivery of high-quality and compliant cost proposals for opportunities of various sizes and complexities. The Officer will report to the Director of Pricing and support the entire Pricing team, working closely with staff at DC and country offices. The Officer is part of a dynamic global team driving business development in support of achieving Pact’s annual sign-on target to support Pact’s Strategic Plan. A successful candidate will ideally have experience in both compliance and pricing, with a particular focus on USG funding.

Key Responsibilities:
General:
Has ability to work independently and effectively on multiple proposal efforts, toward the achievement of fully compliant and competitive cost proposals.
Establishes and maintains positive working relationships with funders, partners, and Pact staff in DC and country offices.
Contract Compliance:
- Reviews RFAs, RFPs, and other solicitations for contractual and/or award compliance and regularly liaise with Grants and Contracts team to clarify compliance questions related to proposals. Answers or coordinates answers to cost allowability or other compliance questions.
- Prepares internal and external questions and clarifications for internal audiences and external clients.
- Keeps abreast of and provides guidance to staff on funder regulations related to live opportunities. Conduct desk research and analysis on US Government and other funders’ regulation policies including, but not limited to, Federal Acquisition Regulation (FAR), Agency for International Development Acquisition Regulation (AIDAR) and US Department of State Standardized Regulations.
- Provides support to subaward negotiations under the direction of the Director of Pricing, including collection and review of documents from proposed subawardees.
- Identifies cost-related risks related to internal and external requirements and recommend plan for mitigation including justification of working at risk. Makes recommendations to Director/Senior Director of Pricing related to development of company policies related to contract or award pricing compliance and risk management.
- Ensure all aspects of the cost proposal are drafted and presented in compliance with RFP/RFA specifications.
Cost Proposal Management
- As cost proposal manager, assigns all cost proposal sections in collaboration with proposal manager, proposal champion and other dept such as Grants & Contracts and HR, develops calendar for cost proposal, and ensures completion of all sections. Provides quality assurance (final assembly and production and quality control) of the entire cost proposal volume.
- Assist with the production of the cost proposal volume, responsible for ensuring all compliance and contractual documents of the cost proposal volume are completed and in accordance with client’s and Pact’s requirements, before sending documents to the proposal manager for final packaging and submission.
- Liaise with contracts and grants/finance and program operation staff supporting existing projects for country offices operational inputs on proposal development.
- Reviews, edits and finalizes budget documents and narrative for cost proposal. Review Cost proposals for realism, and compliance with NICRA, RFP/RFA and other technical requirements.
- Collaborates with different departments to ensure that budgets and budget notes provide a client-oriented high quality pricing proposal and properly interface with our internal financial and accounting systems.
- Assists colleagues with other budget development activities such as award/contract/subcontract budgets, task orders and pipeline analyses and reviews project budgets as needed during non-proposal periods.
- Makes recommendations to Director/Senior Director of Pricing related to development of company practices on cost and pricing.
- Develops, modifies, and customizes budget checklists and other templates to ensure all internal and external cost/pricing requirements are met.
- When necessary, travels internationally to assist the proposal teams with budget preparation (understanding the activities to be undertaken on the project and the resources involved, and collecting local data and quotes).
Other Business Development Responsibilities:
- Researches and analyze various funder requirements for proposal budgeting and project management. Develop pricing tools, templates, guidance, and trainings, when applicable.
- Conducts market research and cost/data gathering for countries and program work. Create and revise cost-related tools, templates, worksheets, guides, and training manuals.
Partnership Engagement for Cost Proposal:
- Liaises with partners (primes or subs) on cost proposal requirements, ensuring compliance with client’s and Pact’s requirements and agreeing on timeline for deliverables and reviews.
- Interfaces with subcontractors/subawardees to ensure budget documentation received is complete and reasonable, realistic, and, in collaboration with proposal managers, that the budgets are compliant with donor’s requirements and the technical approach.
All other duties as assigned

About the job
Job Description:

The Compliance Services Specialist will handle some of the 200,000 registration renewals processed each year. The specialist will cultivate relationships with DMVs and trusted vendors to ensure partnership across the industry. The specialist will be well-versed and able to operate within external and internal systems and technologies to manage processing and communication. The specialist will adhere to detailed methods of tracking to ensure fleet vehicles are on the road legally with the proper license and registration. Individuals in this role will be assigned to one of the following working groups and understand the role includes flexibility to be reassigned to another team to suit the business needs to optimize customer satisfaction.

DRIVER FULLILLMENT CENTER
Print title, registration and tax documents based upon owner, state and specific client or vehicle instructions assign ownership to ensure compliance within state and county statutes

Order duplicate mso’s directly through manufacturer website and follow up until received 

REGISTRATION EXPRESS
Process title and registration transactions for vehicles moving to new states/provinces, for buyouts, and for new vehicle deliveries if not completed by delivering dealers. Obtain/issue temp tags as appropriate to ensure vehicles are legal for use

REGISTRATION RENEWALS:
Process registration renewals using the appropriate resource (e.g., electronic transfer, on-line terminal, mail) for each jurisdiction, while achieving department performance standards for accuracy and timeliness
Ensure clients are billed correctly for renewals by verifying registration and service fees
Reconcile discrepancies using data acquired from Wheels’ databases and from vendor reports

2 years of previous office or customer service experience

About the job
Walsworth is a 65+ attorney law firm with offices in Orange County, Los Angeles, and San Francisco.

We are seeking a motivated attorney with 5 or more years of civil litigation experience working on the defense of employment matters. We offer fully remote or hybrid work options from our offices in Orange County, Los Angeles, or San Francisco. Applicants must reside in California and be available to make in-person appearances as needed. Ideal candidates can work independently with limited supervision, and will have significant experience conducting discovery, taking depositions, preparing and arguing motions, and assisting with trial preparation. Must be admitted to the State Bar of California.

The annual base salary for this position starts at $150,000 - $175,000 (Walsworth is not a lock-step firm. The exact amount of salary for this position is dependent on a variety of factors). In addition to base salary, Walsworth offers an additional bonus program ranging from $10,000 - $29,000, paid sick time, medical insurance, dental insurance, vision insurance, life insurance, disability insurance, and 401k.

Walsworth was established over 30 years ago and consistently strives to maintain a supportive and diverse work environment with opportunities for advancement. For the seventh consecutive year, the firm earned top rankings in Law360’s Glass Ceiling Report on both “The Ceiling Smashers” list, a ranking of the best law firms for female partners, and the “The Best Firms for Female Attorneys” list. In 2021, Walsworth was rated #1 for best firms for female equity partners and in 2020 was in the top 20 for minority equity partners for firms of 100 or fewer attorneys. In addition to the firm’s focus on a diverse workplace, Walsworth offers a family-friendly and collegial culture.

We are a certified Women’s Business Enterprise (WBE) by the Women’s Business Enterprise National Council (WBENC) and by the California Public Utilities Commission, and we are proud to have the largest California presence of any WBE law firm in the United States. Walsworth is also the largest California member of the National Association of Minority and Women-Owned Law Firms (NAMWOLF), and is active in the California Minority Counsel Program (CMCP). We are also excited to announce that Walsworth has just achieved Mansfield Certification Plus! The Mansfield Certification, facilitated by Diversity Lab, recognizes the structural changes and actions the firm has taken over the past 18 months to diversify leadership by broadening the slate of talent considered for internal leadership roles and increasing transparency. The Certification “Plus” status indicates that, in addition to successfully meeting the consideration and transparency requirements, Walsworth has achieved 30% representation of historically underrepresented lawyers in current leadership roles and pathway activities.

To apply for this position, please submit your resume through LinkedIn or by email to recruiting@wfbm.com. Candidates meeting our requirements will be asked to interview with team members via Zoom. A criminal background check will be conducted after a conditional offer of employment.

About the job
Job Description

Job Summary

Drug Device Combination Product Specialist is a position within the Quality Assurance department of Amneal's Piscataway location.

This role provides quality support for Piscataway based combination products throughout the product lifecycle. This role will be responsible for supporting a group of individuals acting as compliance lead on individual products. This role will proactively minimize product quality and design control risks through early detection and mitigation during product lifecycle once the Design Transfer done for the product to site, working closely with project leads, quality, manufacturing, and regulatory functions.

The candidate will be expected to work in a dynamic and highly interdisciplinary environment to support commercial Devise and Drug Device combination product. The role will enable efficient communication and decision-making related to the quality and design control of our combination products.

Essential Functions

Participates in the change control process and assures proposed changes are compliant to the quality system requirements.
Serve as point of contact and as Subject Matter Expert in medical devices and Drug Device combination products from the compliance aspect, once the Design Transfer is completed.
Interface extensively in a matrixed environment with drug product design and development teams and Commercial Operations Team to maintain compliance as per 21CFR Part 820 and Subpart 4. Requirements of QSR.
Expert in assessing regulatory, quality, and compliance environment for medical device and Drug Device combination product to be compliant with the requirements
As an expert, lead and participate in various Risk assessments and will facilitate the process working cross-functionally with critical stakeholders
Maintain and update Design History File at site for individual products and ensure compliance throughout the lifecycle of the commercial products.
Provides technical and quality support to suppliers.

Additional Responsibilities

The candidate will be responsible for Quality Compliance support for combination products , manufactured at Amneal’s Piscataway site. This individual works across functions cooperatively with other members of the team. This individual will understand the regulatory, quality, and compliance landscape in device development, including Drug Device combination products and provide necessary support on compliance front.

Education

Bachelors Degree (BA/BS) in Chemical, Biomedical, Pharmaceutical Technology - Required
Vocational / Technical with CQE Certification, Quality Assurance or related field - Required

Work Experience

5 years or more of Medical device experience, preferably with Drug Device Combination product in pharmaceutical industry. - Required

Skills And Abilities

Demonstrates ability to work across functions and with critical stakeholders - Advanced
Excellent communicator, ability to convey position, verbally and in writing - Advanced
Resolve challenging issues and the ability simplify - Advanced
Exceptional organizational, communication, and critical thinking skills - Advanced
Ability to thrive in a constantly changing environment with strong work ethic and attention to detail - Advanced

Specialized Knowledge

Extensive knowledge of the compliance requirements of Design, Development and Lifecycle management of Medical devices and Drug device combination products as outlined in: FDA QSR 21 CFR Part 4 and 820 / ISO 13485, ISO 14971 and Regulation (EU) 2017/745.
Knowledge of industry regulatory and compliance standards in US and EU.
Knowledge in design controls, risk management and quality system requirements
Understanding of the pharmaceutical industry

About the job
Calling all innovators – find your future at Fiserv.

We’re Fiserv, a global leader in Fintech and payments, and we move money and information in a way that moves the world. We connect financial institutions, corporations, merchants, and consumers to one another millions of times a day – quickly, reliably, and securely. Any time you swipe your credit card, pay through a mobile app, or withdraw money from the bank, we’re involved. If you want to make an impact on a global scale, come make a difference at Fiserv.

Job Title

Compliance Specialist, FCC AML

What does a successful Compliance Specialist FCC AML do?

The AML Compliance Specialist will be a compliance professional within Fiserv’s Financial Crimes Compliance Team working from New Jersey’s largest Fintech hub in Fiserv’s brand new 400,000-square-foot facility. This role requires knowledge of the current regulatory landscape and compliance requirements prescribed by the Bank Secrecy Act (BSA) and other applicable Anti-Money Laundering (AML) laws and statutes as they relate to non-depository financial institutions. This role will be part of a diverse team of AML analysts who are responsible for conducting investigations of potentially suspicious activity, conducting the on-boarding of high-risk clients, and completing the required periodic client reviews.

What You Will Do

In this role, you will synthesize large amounts of complex information, transactional or otherwise, to identify potential money laundering, terrorist financing, or other suspicious activity and determines the next courses of action including, when warranted, drafting suspicious activity reports (SARs) and/or currency transaction reports (CTRs) prior to submission.
You will utilize your analytical skills to support in-depth investigations using both internal and external tools to arrive at, and thoroughly document, sound risk-based conclusions.
In this role you will effectively communicate conclusions in person and through other channels while maintaining a consistent, methodical approach in a highly regulated and deadline-driven environment.

What You Will Need To Have

2 +years of experience involving financial crimes investigations within a Fintech, money services business, or financial institution
Demonstrated analytical and research skills using investigative techniques including transaction analysis, evidence gathering, and pattern recognition
Consistent approach to research and analytics, and the ability to thoroughly and concisely articulate conclusions reached
Ability to interpret and clearly communicate complex payment patterns and document accordingly
Detailed analytical and research skills including use of online research tools and report writing
Working knowledge of applicable laws, regulations, and guidelines (e.g., BSA, OFAC, NACHA, Payment Network rules and regulations)
Ability to provide authoritative and consultative guidance and support to management related to business needs, including proactively anticipating and coordinating technological needs based on regulatory changes
CAMS, CFE, CRCM or equivalent
Bachelors degree
Ability to travel up to 10%

What Would Be Nice To Have

Master’s Degree or JD
Clear, concise communication style (written and verbal); demonstrates engaged listening skills; able to maintain composure in a fast-paced, highly structured, time-sensitive environment
Proven organizational and time management skills resulting in ability to manage numerous projects simultaneously
Experience with financial crimes compliance systems, technologies, and processes, especially AML transaction monitoring typologies and rules

This role is not eligible to be performed in Colorado, California, New York or Washington.

Please note that salary ranges provided for this role on external job boards are salary estimates made by outside parties and may not be accurate.

About the job
At SanMar, the work you do makes a difference.

What's the Short Version?

A Resale Compliance Representative provides excellent customer service while ensuring that customer accounts are in compliance with all the states' regulations for resale certificates. The Resale Compliance Representative position is a high-volume customer contact position, as they assist customers in renewing their resale certificates on file with SanMar. They assist customers with the completion of state forms, answering questions and providing resource tools to them. Their work impacts customer orders shipping without delay and contributes to SanMar's successful completion of various state resale audits.

What Will You Be Doing?

Ensure that SanMar’s customers are in compliance with each state’s requirements, process resale renewals according to state schedules, and maintain a working knowledge of various forms and state requirements.
Monitor incoming faxes and e-mails directed to the Resale Team, routing the appropriate person as necessary.
Monitor the resale message line throughout the day and provide responses as necessary.
Complete customer information updates within 24 hours of receipt, which may include address changes, name changes, ownership changes.
Assist the customer, Inside Sales and Credit department regarding resale issues and renewals, request resale forms when required.
Accurately meet deadlines with the monthly state resale renewal project, a key ingredient in SanMar’s resale renewal process.
Maintain and accurately update SanMar’s customer software and customer information systems with up to date information.

What Are We Looking For?

Experience with Microsoft office.
Less than 1 year of customer service experience is preferred.
Track record demonstrating outstanding customer service skills.
Proven track record demonstrating excellent attendance and punctuality.
Must be able to work as part of a team and be self-directed with minimal supervision.
Ability to learn new processes and procedures and retain information with the ability to utilize available resources to find answers and obtain information.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Flexible with change.
Strong attention to detail.
Self- motivated, self-directed, work independently and confidently.
Excellent organizational and time management skills.

What's Our Offer? 

Salary Range: You`ll earn between $18.75 - $22.85 (WA, NJ); $17.25 - $21.02 (MN, NV, TX, VA); $16.13 - $19.65 (AZ, ID, FL MT, OH, TN) on an hourly basis, depending on experience.

Bonus: You`ll be eligible for an annual discretionary bonus up to $2,000.

Paid Time Off: You`ll accrue paid time off on a weekly basis based on hours worked up to 112 hours per year to start. Employees also receive 7 paid holidays and 1 paid family day off.

Additional Benefits:

Comprehensive medical, dental, and vision benefits
401k plan and matches $1 for $1 up to 4% of earnings, matched & vested at every pay cycle
Life insurance
Short/long-term disability coverage
Paid maternity/paternity leave
Pet insurance

What Should You Expect?

Remote: While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to sit; reach with hands and arms and talk or hear. The employee is frequently required to use hands to finger, handle or feel. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception and ability to adjust focus. Ability to work on computer for multiple hours with frequent interruptions. SanMar's Eastpointe office is located near Seattle, WA and our standard working hours are 8:00-5:00 PST. Quarterly travel may be required.

Who is SanMar?

SanMar is more than just a t-shirt company.

We see t-shirts as a blank canvas that can be used to unite a team, tell a story or show your love for your favorite local haunt. We create meaningful connections that elevate lives through the apparel we provide.

As the industry leader in promotional apparel, we live by a refreshingly simple philosophy: Be Nice and Tell the Truth. This is how we’ve done business since Marty Lott founded the company in 1971. Today we work with apparel manufacturers from around the world, we’ve grown to more than 5,000 employees and we still work with those same simple principles in mind.

You can see our values take shape in A Canvas for Good, our platform for positive action and citizenship. We are dedicated to being good stewards of the world we share, to lifting up the communities where we work and to respecting our employees. Our IDEA Council guides company-wide diversity efforts, and our annual Sustainability Report shows our progress toward our goals of doing business responsibly.

Why Work at SanMar?

Our people are at the heart of everything we do. They bring their talent, passion and dedication to work with them every day. Their hard work inspires us and gives us purpose. We love working here together.

Whether you work in our headquarters, from your home or in one of our distribution centers across North America, we believe that investing in you is just the right thing to do. Our comprehensive benefits package is designed to support your health and well-being, life balance, career growth and (eventually) retirement.

SanMar works with brands you already know, like Nike, The North Face and Brooks Brothers, as well as providing industry-leading private label apparel and accessories. Our people come to work excited to do their part, providing clothing that helps people feel that they’re a part of something special.

Here’s your chance to be a part of this story. If you’re ready to work in a place where your participation matters and your growth is a priority, we’re ready for you.

SanMar is an Equal Opportunity Employer

Whoever you are, wherever you’re from, whomever you love or follow in faith, whatever your disability or superpower status, whichever ethnicity or gender you identify with, you are welcome at SanMar. Our team members are committed to creating an open and inclusive environment in which every employee can be successful.

SanMar participates in E-Verify.

The Pharmacy Manager of Regulatory Compliance is responsible for implementing, tracking, monitoring, reviewing, interpreting, and communicating all aspects of existing, proposed, and newly enacted federal and state rules and regulations as it pertains to the practice of allied health professionals. Conditions of Participation relative to the practice of pharmacy, nursing, and nutrition within the health system. Research the rules and regulations of each individual Board(s) of Pharmacy and Nursing (nurses and dieticians) to make sure the services provided (ROE, Telepharmacy, providing practices in new areas etc.) are permitted and will identify the rules and regulations and inform the leadership team of the findings.

About the job
Compliance Manager (Mid to Senior Level) 
Location: New Jersey

Company Overview: We are a leading iGaming company dedicated to providing innovative and entertaining online gaming experiences to players worldwide. As we expand our operations into New Jersey, we are seeking a highly skilled Compliance Manager to ensure strict adherence to regulatory requirements and maintain the highest standards of compliance within our online casino.

Role Overview: As the Compliance Manager, you will play a crucial role in ensuring our online casino operations in New Jersey are fully compliant with local laws, regulations, and industry standards. You will work closely with various teams across the organization, including legal, operations, marketing, and technology, to develop, implement, and maintain robust compliance programs and processes.

Responsibilities:
1. Regulatory Compliance:
o Stay up-to-date with the evolving regulatory landscape in New Jersey and ensure the online casino operates in full compliance with all relevant laws, regulations, and licensing requirements.
o Develop and implement policies, procedures, and controls to ensure compliance with state and federal gaming regulations, anti-money laundering (AML) laws, and responsible gaming requirements.
o Conduct regular compliance audits, assessments, and risk analyses to identify potential areas of non-compliance and implement corrective actions.
2. Licensing and Reporting:
o Manage the licensing process and maintain all necessary permits, certifications, and regulatory filings required by the New Jersey Division of Gaming Enforcement (DGE) and other relevant authorities.
o Prepare and submit accurate and timely reports to regulatory bodies, ensuring compliance with reporting requirements and maintaining transparent communication.
3. Compliance Program Development:
o Design and implement a comprehensive compliance program tailored to the iGaming industry, considering local laws, regulations, and industry best practices.
o Develop and deliver training programs and materials to educate employees on compliance requirements, responsible gaming practices, and anti-fraud measures.
o Collaborate with internal stakeholders to continuously enhance compliance frameworks, policies, and procedures based on regulatory changes and industry trends.
4. Auditing and Investigations:
o Conduct internal compliance audits to assess the effectiveness of controls and procedures, identifying any gaps or potential risks.
o Investigate incidents of non-compliance, fraud, and suspicious activities, ensuring prompt resolution and appropriate reporting.
o Liaise with external auditors and regulatory bodies during compliance audits and investigations, providing necessary documentation and supporting evidence.
5. Regulatory Liaison:
o Serve as the main point of contact for regulatory agencies, proactively building and maintaining strong relationships.
o Represent the company in interactions with regulators, responding to inquiries, requests, and investigations promptly and professionally.

Qualifications:
• Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Law, or a related field. A master's degree is a plus.
• A minimum of 3 years of experience in compliance management within the iGaming industry, preferably with experience in launching and operating online casinos.
• Strong knowledge of New Jersey gaming regulations, including the New Jersey Casino Control Act and regulations set by the DGE.
• Familiarity with responsible gaming practices, AML regulations, and player protection standards.
• Experience in obtaining and maintaining gaming licenses and managing relationships with regulatory bodies.
• Excellent analytical skills with the ability to identify potential compliance risks and develop effective mitigation strategies.
• Strong understanding of auditing and investigation procedures, including the ability to handle sensitive and confidential information.
• Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills to collaborate with cross-functional teams and external stakeholders.
• Detail-oriented mindset with the ability to work independently, manage multiple priorities, and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment.
• Professional certifications in compliance management or related fields are desirable.

About the job
Join our dynamic team at JP Morgan and be a part of our mission to deliver world-class financial solutions to our clients. As a member of the Firm-wide Controllers organization, you will play a crucial role in maintaining the integrity of our financial statements and controls, while driving continuous process improvement to ensure the success of our businesses, clients, and employees. With diverse opportunities across finance, risk, HR, and marketing, JP Morgan's corporate functions offer a unique and rewarding career path.

Job Summary

The Firm-wide Regulatory Reporting & Analysis (FRRA) team is part of the Firm-wide Controllers organization and is responsible for the design, implementation and execution of end-to-end processes supporting U.S. Regulatory Reporting including Consolidated, Capital, Standalone and CCAR/DFAST reporting (also included in scope, is International Regulatory Reporting for select locations in APAC/EMEA/UK/LATAM regions), Regulatory Reporting training and exam management. Additionally, FRRA drives broader strategic initiatives across external reporting including accountability, error and issue management, manual adjustments, variance analysis, quality assurance and the target U.S. Regulatory Reporting platform.

FR Y-14A reporting series collects detailed firms' financials and metrics under different stress scenarios. Financials collected is utilized by Supervisory agencies to assist in determining the Firm's capital adequacy and profitability.

You will be responsible for leading and executing overall end-to-end production and analysis of FR Y-14A reports and few associated narratives (supplementary information and data) submitted to FRB and OCC. You will closely partner with colleagues across Capital Management and Stress Testing, Corporate Finance, Line of Businesses, and Risk functions. You will need to leverage excellent communication and analytical skills, solid understanding of financials and their drivers to deliver results.

While Controllers perform many functions, some specific types of Controllers perform the following duties:

 Controls 
 External Reporting 
 Financial Control 
 Legal Entity Control 
 Product Control 
 Valuation Control 

Job Responsibilities

The FRRA CCAR Y-14A Vice President role will have responsibilities as follows:

 Lead and coordinate multiple aspects of FR Y 14A reporting process, and internal Risk Appetite reporting processes. 
 Consolidating and analyzing the consolidated stress testing results, including the Income Statement, Balance Sheet, Capital and Risk weighted assets (RWA) and present the key metrics to senior management, Board of Directors and regulatory agencies 
 Participate in testing and change management implementation of the relevant technology (W-Desk, Internal Aggregation\\consolidation system, Tableau, Axiom etc.) associated with the regulatory reporting. Co-ordinate with technology team to build required technology expertise for self and for his/her team. Oversee the review and maintenance of the regulatory reporting requirement's calculation rules\\logics within the technology solutions in partnership with technology teams. 
 Communicate new regulatory requirements to all the stakeholders and lead requirement clarification conversations with FRRA Policy team and Corporate Capital Stress Testing (CCST) team 
 Leading the refresh and review with central challenger of a Qualitative methodologies owned by the team, that are used for producing or used for providing guidance for producing the reportable data 
 Preparing and reviewing supporting documentation on processes, methodologies, and the control environment 
 Work extended hours during peak periods including some weekends 

Required Qualifications, Capabilities, And Skills

 8+ years in a banking organization with exposure to regulatory reporting, financial statements analysis, and financial products. 
 Experience in either of Regulatory Reporting, Planning & Analysis (Line of Business/Firm-wide P&A), Product Controller, and Legal Entity controller strongly preferred 
 Strong analytical skills and ability to work with large quantities of financial data to pull trends and insights, and identify any anomalies 
 Very strong communications skills, written and verbal and partnership building skills- for effective communications with stakeholders, senior management and regulatory agencies 
 Strong technical skills and agility to learn new technology. Experience using Microsoft Office Application Suite (Word, Excel, Access, and PowerPoint), Business Intelligence solutions (Example: Alteryx, Tableau) and regulatory reporting solutions (Example: Axiom) is preferred. 
 Ability to multi-task and be hands on in a fast-paced environment to meet deadlines under pressure 
 Strong sense of control and governance (ability to identify and close control gaps and/or issues) 

Preferred Qualifications, Capabilities, And Skills

 Familiarity with Tableau, Axiom is preferred 
 Knowledge of CCAR, Regulatory Capital and RWA is an advantage
